description:
These are amazing tacos and guac, everything for my catering delivery could have gone wrong. I made an address mistake, but in order to get my food to me, management went above and beyond to make sure I had the food delivered, and it tasted amazing. 

Thank you Tacolicious staff!
author: Sandra S.

description:
The food is delicious. Bartenders are always up for a great conversation. Would enjoy from time to time, if other shows were on the TV. Maybe something uplifting and funny after a long stressful day. Family Guy would be perfect. 

Keep up the good work and look forward to Family Guy Monday's.
author: Jeffrey F.

description:
Somehow, Taco Tuesday made for a fun, casual birthday outing!

Get a group of yelpers together, add in some $15 do-it-yourself-tacos and pour a couple of margarita pitchers ($29 on Taco Tuesday) and you're guaranteed a great catch up session with friends.

Since Tacolicious doesn't take reservations, our group of 8 waited 30 mins. before getting seated. If you arrive before 6pm, you can catch some happy hour specials ($7 guac, $7 margaritas) at the bar while you wait. 

I'm surprised that each taco now sells for $5.50 so it's not a cheap date if you head here. But the group easily killed several huge taco plates and got a whole variety of tastes to choose from: baja style cod, pastrami tacos (add $1), house special chorizo/potato, carne asada, guajillo braised beef and carne asada. I ordered a side of beans and rice and their cauliflower "al pastor" to complete the meal. 

I prefer the NB location a bit more than the Marina one, as it is more spacious and the bar is just gorgeous! Supreme service and a vibrant atmosphere bumps up this review to a solid 4 stars.
author: Janice C.

description:
I've never been that blown away by the Tacolicious tacos, but my boyfriend and I stopped in for some snacks in between meals and were very impressed.

The albacore tuna tostadas contramar-style (chipotle mayo, avocado, crispy leeks) were my favorite - a thin layer of tuna on a crispy shell. Completely delicious.

I would skip the tomato-watermelon salad (queso fresco, basil, sciabica olive oil), which was with yellow watermelon that was too watery and way too sweet. I added some salt, which helped to provide some contrast.

The habanero-tamarind glazed pork ribs were a great snack - not too hardy of a rib, but just enough to make you crave more.

The service was fairly light - we had to continuously wave down our waiter where we wanted a water refill or to get our check, but I would come back strictly for the tostadas!
author: Christina S.

description:
I love Tacolicious. But what happened to the amazing fresh minty salsa they used to serve with the chips?! That bomb salsa was one of our favorite things about coming here. Now the salsa is warm and kinda mushy. Sorta weird... warm salsa is weird. 


Either way still love the tacos and drinks. 


But the salsa!!!!
author: Mick N.

description:
Although this place is really good for tacos, they are a bit pricey for tacos. About $6 per taco and it feels much especially because I love just the street tacos you can buy at taquerias. 

Anyway what makes this unique are their drinks and the 3 salsas that come with a wooden spoon that range from mild to really spicy.  I love getting the cod fish tacos fried, the carnitas, and the veggie one. As for drinks, sangria or margaritas are good. We usually end up getting a pitcher but regretting it because of the cost. Overall great place though with shared tables good for groups or a date at the bar area.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Skip this place and go to the Mission for better tacos and salsa.

Since Tacolicious is a taco place, it is only reasonable for me to expect above average tacos. The tacos were disappointing.  Beef was too salty, breaded cod didn't have any crunch to it, taco shells were stale, salsas were not tasty, guacamole was bland. Service was okay and decor unmemorable. Overall a painfully mediocre experience.

Not the worst choice if you're in the neighborhood and crave tacos at a sit-down restaurant, I don't think it's worth going out of your way.
author: Heidi B.

description: Tacolicious may be a local Bay Area chain now, but not all locations are created equal. I think the Marina location is far better in terms of food in both quality and taste. A few differences I noticed were in the salsa and queso. The salsa here seems to have mint in it which made the taste reminiscent of mojitos. The queso here also had large slices of red peppers and less spice. The taco meat is also much "wetter" than other locations -- almost too much as the tortillas were nearly soggy upon arrival. I think the quality of the food was fine, but the taste was noticeably different compared to the Chesnut/Marina location. That said, I will stick to Italian food next time I'm in North Beach.
author: Edwina D.

description:
Free chips/sales - always a plus.

I'm giving this place 2 stars due to pricing (a bit expensive for small tacos) and just how oily the tacos are. 

When I bit into my MF Chicken Taco there was a pool of liquid that ended up on the plate.

Overall it's average. I'd rather visit another Taqueria.
author: Inci A.

description: The hostess (girl with long brown hair and face piercing) was so rude to me after I asked her a simple question about outdoor seating. The last thing I need is to have some girl scream at me in front of several people for no reason before I'm about to drop $75 on food...I'm never eating here again. They need to hire friendly people.....not unprofessional and unpleasant people who don't make you feel welcome!
author: Lady N.

description:
My first visit to Tacolicious was for a late Sunday brunch. There was no wait and the menu seemed pretty standard with traditional "Mexican" fare options. 

I ordered the michelada and their breakfast tacos. The portion of filling in the tacos was very generous and I was completely full after having one and a half of the tacos. They bring out chips and salsa when you sit, which is great! I always love it when Mexican places bring you free chips and salsa. The salsa had a nice flavor and wasn't overly spicy. The michelada itself was pretty decent it definitely had the kick of spiciness that I enjoy, I would have preferred a Dos Equis or Pacifico instead of a Tecate but that is just me being a little bit of a beer snob. 

They also have a cool combo which I did not get but if I go back again for lunch on a weekend or dinner on a weekday I would absolutely try it. It is a taco (or maybe two or three can't exactly remember) plus a shot of tequila plus a beer for $12. Not a bad deal at all. I would definitely go to this place again.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
I'm shocked this place has less than 4 stars. The tacos here are so delicious.

I had came here with four of my friends to celebrate my 21st birthday and the waitress was really nice. They even gave me the chrurros on the house because it was my birthday. That was really nice of them.

I don't remember exactly what tacos I ordered, but all I remember is that they were really tasty and not too overpowering. 

Since it was my 21st, I had to order a drink and I ordered a margarita. We also got a round of some shot that the waitress provided. 

Overall, my experience here was really enjoyable. They made my 21st birthday dinner very rememberable. I'll never forget their very kind service and the delicious food. 

Give this place a chance!
author: Allyson L.

description: PSA: this review does not review tacos. I try to stay on the healthier side when I can so I went with the ensalada chingaderas which let me tell you was so so so good. The mix of kale with crunch was amazing. I asked for the jalapeño vinaigrette instead of the coriander dressing because I love any extra spice I can get. I wanted to add avocado to my salad but apparently this wasn't an option so I got the guacamole instead.  they give you a big portion although it was expected when they charge you $10 for it. Overall great flavors in the salad and the guacamole was good too. My friends ordered tacos and they said they were on point. Everyone was stuffed after their meals, food baby's for sure. If you're in the mood for some good Mexican, try out tacolicous. They have locations all over the city and they do order delivery on a couple of the food delivery sites.
author: Kara N.

description:
Yikes!  I used to really like Tacolicious but am bummed about some of the menu changes.  Bring back the chorizo potato taco PLEASE!  The fried avocado taco does not make it ok for them to get rid of the chorizo potato taco.  Just so you know.  We ordered 12 tacos and when I lifted one off the plate we were all grossed out with the pool of oil underneath.  

My friends spent quite a bit of time here yesterday, but we were constantly ordering and super low maintenance, but we overheard the servers talking crap about us because they felt like we were there for too long.  So um, that's awkward.  Not coming back!
author: Jessica F.

description: I really like the bartender on duty (Paulo)... He gets 5 stars, but I'm giving the restaurant 3 because there's no Family Guy on the TV. He politely explained that sports are required to be on when the TV's are. Otherwise, I had a wonderful time in this establishment.
author: Rajah H.

description:
Overpriced, loud and tasteless. 

Drinks are watered down.

Okay vibe/music, but horrible Mexican food experience. Nothing authentic about this place.
author: Matt L.

description: This is about catering. We had Tacolicious cater our wedding welcome party in Sebastopol in August. The staff was really responsive and helpful during the booking process. We were able to swap out the dessert in the catering package for guac. The catering set up with the teal pots and the little succulents is super cute! Our guests enjoyed the food!
author: Christina S.

description:
Amazing food and flavors!! SF foodie and first time at tacolicious and would highly recommend. Tuna tostadas, chicken tacos, shrimp cesar salad were delicious. All food is non-GMO & organic!

I'll definitely be back.
author: Mike A.

description: Their specialty tacos are far more superb than the standard carnitas and beef. The standout is the battered cod and avocado selection. So far have only ordered through Trycaviar, but they're always speedy and delicious!
author: Danielle Y.

description:
This is a very fun restaurant to go to with friends. The atmosphere is lively, and the evening vibes pair perfectly with the nightlife of North Beach. 

I went with a group of girls, and the noise level was perfect for conversation. Not to loud, and not to quiet, I'd recommend sitting inside with a window table. 

 Now let's talk about the food. It was good, I can't say great because I have had much better Mexican food. I do have to say their chips and salsa were on point. The guacamole was very good as well. Although they are simple dishes, a well executed salsa and guacamole is key.

I also had the Beet Salad, which was by far the most amazing dish. The beets were perfectly ripe and the combination with the orange and queso fresco was amazing. 

My taco choice was the butternut squash taco (I wasn't feeling meat that night). It was nice they had a vegetarian option. The tortillas are homemade, slightly to thick and dense for me, but the flavors were very good.

Last but not least, the cocktail! We split a pitcher of margaritas and let me tell you, those babies were strong! Probably the only thing on the menu where you got your money's worth.
author: Cayla Dee P.

description:
This restaurant wins my award for "Worst Customer Service - Local Category". Consistency is key here, as the tacos are always delicious, and the table service is always non-existent, even on the slowest of days. Prepare to take a seat at a dirty table, because it won't be wiped without asking. Also, be prepared to have to go look for your server when you want another taco, another drink, or you simply want to pay your bill because once the food "eventually" arrives at your table, you'll never see your server again. 

I was hesitant to write this review because I'm local to the neighborhood and believe that any restaurant can have an "off day", but I've been here many, many times, and the service is terrible every songletime. Consistency is key at Tacolicious!

(Ps, thanks for replying Pablo, but the restaurant was DEAD. Had it been busy, I of course would have been much more forgiving. Systemic poor management and training is the only excuse for consistently poor service.)
author: Ted T.

description:
Huh, heard so many good things. Didn't live up to the hype. I thought the meat was overly seasoned. Sometimes I just want to taste the meat without all that other stuff.

Ordered carnitas and beef tacos. Preferred the carnitas. 

However, I will have to say that they have some bomb ass sauce. I received 4 different varieties. I do love me some good homemade salsa so thumbs up for that. 

Took stars away for the tortillas - not my style, too though and thick - and salsa was old. Cilantro had turned brown.
author: Song C.

description:
One of our talents was nice enough to treat us to lunch. We ordered through Caviar on last Tuesday, May 23rd. There was a choice of three restaurants. I picked Tacolicious since I've never been to the one in North Beach. Our delivery order arrived around 12:30pm.

4-Taco Meal: Mix and match all 4 ($17.95)
*Baja-style pacific cod: cabbage, cumin crema
*Achiote-braised chicken
*Traditional carnitas
*Guajillo-braised beef brisket

A couple people ordered the four taco plate, so it was hard figuring out who's lunch was who's. I chose the tacos above, but I'm not sure if I got the right plate as one of my meats was super sweet. I think it was the beef? It was hard to tell as everything ended up melded together in the take out container. I ended up liking the chicken the best as it was tender and had the best flavor. The cod was disappointing. Mostly batter and not much fish. A coworker of mine ordered the Chile con Queso ($9.95) which I was really excited about. But it was rather thin and not very cheesy. Kind of like a thicker soup. I was disappointed as I wanted it be cheesier. I asked for lots of sides of salsa, but they didn't include much, so not sure if they give you complimentary salsa with your tacos or not. I like A LOT of salsa with my tacos.

I've been to the Tacolicious in the Marina and I remember thinking it was pricey for what it was. I felt the same way about this location. And at almost $4.50 a taco, I expected more. Or at least, more free salsa!
author: Elena N.

description: Food is overpriced. Four regular sized tacos for $20... I thought The taste would make up for it but I was wrong. The tacos weren't necessarily bad but you would think that the price would Say something about the quality of the tacos. Not any workers fault but the owners really need to reconsider their standards and get off their high horse. Customer service was great.
author: Daniela R.

description: So, I am super bummed out about the kale salad no longer being on the menu. My doctor recommended Tacolicious to me. She said the kale salad was so delicious and so healthy and told me to add chicken. It had this cumin apple cider vinaigrette which was to die for! I'm very upset to see it was taken off the menu. I got that salad every single time I was there. I wish they would bring it back and bring it to all locations. Aside from the salad, I'm a huge fan of the short rib tacos although I'm not a fan of tortillas. I wish they grilled the tortillas a little bit so they had a tiny bit of char. I only eat the meat out of the room temperature tortillas.
author: Danielle S.

description:
The Taco Also Rises!

It was a warm spring day and we sat at a table outside Tacolicious watching it get dark and electric signs come on, and the res and green stop-and-go-traffic signal, and the crowd going by, and the Uber, Lyft and yellow cabs buzz around slower traffic, and the tourists going by, singly and in San Francisco, looking for the evening meal. I watch the waitress walk past the table and watched her turn left into the restaurant and lost the sight of her, and watched another, and then saw the first one coming back again. She went by once more and I caught her eye, and she came over and stood by the table.
"Well, what will you drink?" she asked.
"Just water."
"Do you know what you'd like?"
"Tacos, four of them, two traditional carnitas, one housemade chorizo with potatoes and one achiote-braised chicken"

The tacos arrived all lined up on a long plate accompanied by another plate containing three small sauce containers. I loved the red and the yellow sauce, they were spicy. The chicken was good, the chorizo was tasty and the carnitas was to die for!
author: Afshin A.

description:
I really wanted to go to Tacolicious, but it was kinda disappointing.  I truly felt as though I had entered the twilight zone the second I walked into this establishment.  There was no hostess to be found... We waited, waited and waited and finally 5-7 minutes later seated.  Usually this place is packed, but this day it surprisingly was not.  

So, when one of my best-test buddies and I sat down, it took a while to be greeted.  We first ordered our drinks and then about 15 min later ordered our meals.  Here's the first fail... our meals came out 25 minutes later with no sign of our duly awaited drinks... we asked the server and she rudely said ask YOUR server.  So we did and then one drink magically appeared, but where was the other mystery drink... We waited to find our server and asked for the other drink and all she said was, "oh sorry."  Then a few minutes later when I was finished with my meal my drink appeared as was now my liquid dessert.

30 minutes later the bill appeared.  I can tell you this was the first time ever I wanted to "Dine and Dash." Great look, poor service.  I don't know if ill try again.
author: Mercedes M.

description: Food is okay but the music is so loud. I don't understand! This is not a club. It's a restaurant. Not going to come back.
author: Appy G.

description:
We dined here after calling and being told this restaurant had no wait while the one at the marina had an hour long wait. Maybe that should have been an indication. We arrived and stood at the front desk for at least 5 minutes with no one acknowledging us. Finally we were greeted and got seated 15 minutes later even though there was no wait and the restaurant wasn't busy. Once seated we sat, with our 3 small children while no one came to our table for at least 10 minutes. At this point we had one kids menu and no crayons. Our kids were starving and going nuts after 30 minutes of no progress beyond sitting down at a table. Eventually we got some water and chips and salsa and put in our orders asap. I have food allergies and needed answers to a few questions before ordering but the answers were vague and uncertain so I played it safe with an $18 salad that was so bland. The lights were too dark to see our food and the music was so loud it was difficult to hear each other. We ran out of water part way through the meal and the server never even came back to check how our food was, let alone refill our drinks. Our kids drinks came in the middle of their meal and then we had to remind the server a couple of times to bring out the ice cream. A manager came at the end and said they forgot to make an adjustment to our bill so I assumed maybe they were going to discount it for the horrendous service, but nope, she brought the check back exactly the same as it had been before. 
Also, we took our children to the bathroom and the toilet paper and paper towels were both gone and the floor was littered with garbage. 
All-in-all this restaurant fell very far short of the modest expectations we had. Not much I can say good about it besides that the chips and salsa were decent and everyone else's food seemed fine.
author: Emily B.

description:
Pros: Came here during lunch with my coworkers and surprisingly they were not packed. The crowd on this block is usually for Tony's pizza down the block probably. The waiters were efficient with our orders and bill since we were on a time crunch. They refilled our chips often too.

Cons: Good luck with street parking. We ordered a variety of tacos but the beef brisket one was SUPER salty.

Ordered: If everyone is getting tacos, it's best to get the 10 piece order. We got 20 tacos in a variety of flavors.

Would I recommend: Ehhh... kinda on the fence on this place. Yes as a backup restaurant but not a first choice since its pretty basic.
author: Terry N.

description:
Good place if you're in the mood for overpriced tacos! Came here for a lunch date with a friend and it wasn't too crowded which made for good service. The server was helpful in answering our questions and giving suggestions.

The nopales and oaxaca cheese taco was by far my favorite. The nopales were fresh and mixed with a slice of grilled oaxaca cheese. Definitely not the kind of taco you'd find at a local taco truck. The salsas served were also fresh which made for good flavor. Worth the try but I won't be returning for $5 tacos.
author: Edgar A. S.

description: I was so glad to have made it to Tacolicious!  My girlfriend and I have visited their sister spot, Tacolab in San Miguel and we were very excited to hit the place up on our recent visit to San Francisco.  The chips and salsa were great.  I had a carnitas taco which was very good and a beer battered fish taco that was amazing!  They give you three choices of salsa.  I liked the habanero the best because it was very spicy!  We shared rice which we both enjoyed.  My girlfriend ordered the tacos dorados and was happy with them and I wanted to try them but I was too full once I got around to it. We were in the North Shore and found street parking very quickly which added to the happiness we felt at being there.  The service was very good, we were well attended to. We had a window seat which was nice so we could people watch.  There was outdoor seating as well but it was too cold a day for it.
author: La Shara C.

description: I'm giving 2 because chicken tacos and Guatemole was good. Other wise I didn't like at all. I walk in there and before I go I put myself to list from yelp. Nobody welcome me , I was standing up 20 mins waiting for table. I don't  like steak taco at all almost make me choke two times. I asked the server guy if he can change it for me he said he can't do that. I didn't like the service , taste etc. Ambiance was nice. They have a veggie options which is good. I like fried avocado tacos. When you first come they give you chips and salsa like everywhere , it's free and fresh. I was really excited to go and try their "pictures " tacos  but it's disappointing. Good luck to you...
author: İrem S.

description:
This place is pretty rad! 

We walked here after going to BBB. They fit our large group in quickly and we were met with multiple bowls of chips & salsa. These chips are freaking amazing!!!!!!!!!! We ordered two pitchers of margs. Strawberry & Original. Both were excellent. We ordered 20 tacos for our group / chicken, carne asada, fish & pork. This was the perfect amount of food for us. 

Why don't ALL Mexican Restaurants serve pickled onions with their street tacos? What an additional little treat. I would hands down stop here again for tacos. Great atmosphere, awesome food & drinks!
author: LeeAnn C.

description:
We ended up here for a quick drink before our show, and because the line at Tony's for a better meal option was too cray.

It's located on the edge of Little Italy and Chinatown, with several restaurants along the same street. When we stopped by on a Saturday afternoon it was very busy but we sat ourselves down at the bar. The ambience was pretty standard for San Francisco.

Service at the bar was sub par (we were never given menus or water), and the mojito seemed a bit watered down. But hey, free chips and salsa! Hardly anything is free these days so that was a bit refreshing.

Based on this experience though, I wouldn't return.
author: Sue V.

description:
My wife thinks Tacolicious is the best restaurant in North America. It is very good. Always sit at the bar. They serve beer in short pseudo-rocks glasses. I've never seen that before, but I really like it.

Bartenders are always very nice. If you sit and eat long enough, you usually get a few freebies. Couple different locations. Definitely an easy go-to spot.
author: David E.

description: Sooo overpriced. Tacos are good but it's truly insane how much they overpriced them for how small they are. It's good they serve chips and salsa bc I usually rely on that to fill me up as the tacos won't do the job.
author: Garrett S.

description: Great tacos! As well as great drinks and queso! I would recommend coming here for food! The staff is friendly as well!
author: Anthony M.

description:
Went here with some friends to grab a bite to eat on a Friday night. The place was packed, but we were lucky to grab the last available table for the 5 of us.

I ended up getting three different tacos: brisket, fish, and chorizo. All of the tacos were a decent size and had some good flavor combinations.

Their house margarita was also pretty good and the pitcher wasn't too expensive.

Overall, the vibe of this place is great and filled with energy and is perfect for large groups. Not a bad option if you are looking for an affordable meal out.
author: Ryan R.

description: The salads get never fail to disappoint. But they are a little bit pricey..  If you're feeling a nice hip vibe then here's a good place. The service is wonderful. Free chips and salsa with water. Pretty fast service. I paid $20 for a kale salad but it's enough for two. I suggest...GO!
author: Anita L.

description:
The space rocks! Unfortunately the food doesn't exactly follow suite.  

It took a bit for someone to take our order. Not sure if it was the general way that things were or if it was the time of day but it was painful since the space was not busy at all! 

The tacos were super dry but not too terrible. I wouldn't come back to tacolicious with all of the other tacos spots in the city.
author: Kaley K.

description:
Started with empanadas-- nothing special. Then tried the fish tacos and the carnitas. Neither were impressive. Their presentation far exceeded their taste... blower. 

Service wasn't great either. I hope that the incredibly slow service was due to a sick call, but who knows... at least the server was apologetic about it, and the drinks were on the house without us even complaining (that's how long it took...), so that's always a plus.
author: Phi N.

description: I visited this place on a Saturday during the NBA and NHL playoffs. The bar area was packed and a few tables were open. Since it was just myself the hostess offered to seat me near the bar area that had open seating. I waited 15 minutes and no one stopped to take my order or offer me something to drink. At this time a spot opens up at the bar. I moved to the bar and had a drink in hand right away. I ordered the plate of 4 tacos. I had the steak, chicken, and carnitas. The steak was cold and not worth eating. The carnitas was hot and really delicious. The chicken was luke warm and seemed to be way too moist of some sort of juices. The hot sauce was good along with the carnitas tacos. I would probably not come back due to the lack of service and cold to warm food.
author: Jason D.

description: I'm sitting here right now, 6pm on a Friday night and THEY'RE OUT OF GUACAMOLE. How does a taco place run out of guacamole?!??
author: Sue C.

description:
Ok, so my son brought me here from several options nearby his house and even though we gad mexican food (bad) last nite...
We'll this was something special for sure. The HABANERO Was Let's say...HOT! QUATRO tacos all tremendous and the best ever. Never gad any as good in this would anyway.  Claire and HADIE  We're Great Employees To Take Care Of us.  Marguerite and beer chasers helped a lot. Why a 5, we'll it'll bring them up a little to where they might be...love, me.
author: Sumner B.

description: Just what we were hoping for when we planned this meal - tasty tacos served in a good atmosphere. I could have tried quite a few things on the menu but went with the helpful servers advice and it was dead on. Great service. Thank you, you came recommended and did not disappoint!
author: Kett M.

description: Sampled three different types of tacos and wow they definitely packed a full plate of flavor and targeted different taste buds in my mouth. The amount of meat per taco was amazing. Many people may be discouraged when they see the prices and don't want to spend that much for just tacos but on occasions I would definitely say go... filling, tastes good, variety and great environment. Recommend to friends and family. Types of tacos we tried Pork, brisket and cod. Yum.
author: Jasson C.

description:
Visited Tacolicious last Thursday night with a bunch of girlfriends. Despite our large party of 8, we were immediately seated (we called ahead which helped!) We were greeted by endless bowls of chips and a not-so friendly waitress who seemed like she'd rather be anywhere else...

We each ordered two tacos and were served a bowl of guacomole for the table. Since none of us ordered the guac we assumed it was complimentary and began to eat. It wasn't until we were half way through that we noticed that guac was actually on the menu for $10! 

While the tacos were delicious, the aftermath of Tacolicious was not so. About an hour after eating there all of us started to feel some sort of way. I ended up getting sick as a result of what I believe to be the fish tacos I ordered... Maybe I have a sensitive stomach, but the fact that we all felt sick to our stomaches was not the best sign... For how many great restaurants are located in North Beach, I probably wouldn't come back here.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
Been to tacolicious a few times now and the name alone makes me want to go here. I mean come on, it's the greatest name for a Mexican restaurant maybe ever. This is exactly what I would name a Mexican restaurant if I ever happened to open one. Anyways, I was pretty surprised that it wasn't busier when we got here last night, but we got a table for 5 right away. We started off with a pitcher of margarita fesca (milagro blanco, pomegranate, rosemary,
agave). Oh my god, it was delicious. I was downing it like juice. They immediately brought us chips + salsa. We also ordered guac. They kept on bringing chips every time the bowl would be empty. Very much appreciated. I ordered the shot and a beer braised chicken taco and the carnitas taco. Both were great. Will definitely be back soon!
author: Ilana B.

description:
I went into Tacolicious and was ignored by the staff

The place was empty

After 15 min I walked out frustrated

I guess they don't care or need my business
author: Jim O.

description:
Dinner review. 

Plantains - 3/5
Taco (chorizo) - 2/5
Taco (carnitas) - 3/5
Taco (brisket) - 4/5
Taco (steak) - 2/5
Churros - 4/5

Overall, "A-OK."
author: Mark O.

description:
I've gone here a few times with coworkers and have had a such a lovely experience-the service and food being exceptional each time. The place is great for groups of people, which is probably why people from work always recommend coming here. And there is a full bar. Seems like a great place for happy hour if you ask me (except I haven't actually been here for happy hour). It's definitely a great place to socialize over food and drinks. 

The times I've gone here, I've gotten the 'Guajillo Braised Beef' tacos and the 'Traditional Carnitas'. The meat in both of these tacos were very flavorful and tender. Each taco is about five bucks each, which seems a little expensive if you ask me. But you can get four tacos for $17.95 which comes to about $4.50 per taco and ten tacos for $39.95 which comes to $4 per taco-- now this price seems a little more reasonable. The tacos are definitely exceptional and the salsas that come with your meal are great! I usually try to not eat too many tortilla chips so I don't get too full before my meal, but the salsas were so good, they made it hard to stop. Since each taco comes with two corn tortillas, I'm always able to split the two corn tortillas and divide the meat to make my one taco into two tacos since there is always enough meat to do so (am I the only one who does this?).

I probably wouldn't come here on my own. Like I said, it's more of a place to socialize. But I would def come back with a group of people to try their happy hour.
author: Meghan J.

description: Came here late Thursday night with a friend to grab dinner. We had the tuna tostada which was really good and then we had 2 tacos each, at about $4-5/taco. Decent place for tacos, cool vibe, but lots of people there just drinking or partying, not necessarily a great dinner spot. But, it's a good place to go to when you are craving tacos in the neighborhood. I may return due to proximity, although tacos did not blow me away. It's more of a bar feel then a restaurant.
author: Marie D.

description: I work in the neighborhood and am always struggling to find healthy things to eat for lunch, Tacolicious has some options for salads that are absolutely delicious- however they're tiny and over priced.
author: Melina V.

description: Good solid tacos, but this is coming from someone who rarely eats tacos and isn't an aficionado by any means.  Tried just about all of them and they were tasty.  Happy overall with the experience and price.  We sat outside, service was fast and pleasant as well.
author: James A.

description:
Grand selections of tacos to choose from.

A good variety of salsas to test try too!

Nice open air and outside seating.

Warm churros with chocolate ooze was a finishing win!

Tacolicious indeed!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I came here with a group of friends and we were seated pretty quickly. We had the mushroom empanadas which were actually really good. I ordered the butternut squash and carnitas tacos but was very disappointed with the squash ones. We all shared a margarita pitcher but I didn't really like the flavor. If I'm ever back in San Fran I might visit again.
author: Ana C.

description: not the best of the locations and the crowd tends to skew more tourist but with a happy hour featuring $6 margs, what else could you ask for??
author: Alexandra K.

description: This place had a fun atmosphere and it was happy hour so I was able to get 6 dollar margaritas. I went to this place off of a recommendation of a friend. I ended up trying 4 different kinds of taco: chorizo/potato, cod, mushroom carnitas, and traditional carnitas. I ended up liking the cod the best and then the mushroom carnitas second. The traditional carnitas was pretty good but I thought could of been a little better and the chorizo and potato tasted a little dry but was still pretty good. They also give you three different types of sauces ranging from mild to very spicey. I'd go again with friends for the cool vibes and the pretty good tacos.
author: Casey W.

description:
Beans with bacon here were excellent, tacos and plantains good as well. 

The bartenders are great and you could tell they really know their craft. Their micheladas are alright, they could use better beer than the canned stuff. For $6 though, it's quite good.
author: Siddhartha G.

description:
Hands down the best salsa I have ever eaten. The chips and salsa were free, too, something I always appreciate at Mexican restaurants.
When we ordered we thought the tacos were a bit pricy, but they they showed up and I understood why. Every taco has two tortillas. There's generous filling. It comes with a variety of  dipping salsas. 
The servers were attentive and our food arrived quickly. Easily the best meal we ate in San Francisco.
author: Lisa D.

description: Worst service I've ever experienced two times in a row at this location  we had to ask for chips and salsa as we waited 15-20 mins after we ordered and never received it.  Our drinks came out one at a time for some reason when we were two bites away from finishing our meal....pretty bad  we had to ask 3 different people for our check and they still never brought it.  We left cash on the table
author: Spraynard K.

description:
In my opinion this place is overhyped and overpriced. If you have had real authentic tacos from the various Mexican restaurants in SF you will know why this place doesn't even compare. Like honestly one taco is 5 dollars.... Like what is it made out of? Gold? When I can get 5 tacos for 5 dollars somewhere else. I do have to give it to them that their sauces are really good and also their tortilla chips but that's basically it. The wait was over an hour. I thought it was going to be more efficient and less of a wait since they text you when your table is ready. I came back here after 45 mins and they said that they texted me but I received no text what so ever.. So they gave my table to someone else.. And I received their text after waiting 15 mins inside the restaurant when I came back... So overall wait was an hour and maybe more

For the food: I didn't think the tacos were that amazing to come back because they are pretty expensive but I did really like the fish tacos (cod) and the carnitas were also good. Their deal was 10 for 40 I think and I still think 4 dollars for one taco is still way over priced. 

Overall: servers were really nice but the wait and the cost killed this place for me. I really wanted to like this place since I saw so many yummy pictures of the tacos but overall this place was disappointing. Don't think I will be coming back when there are so many other taquerias that are cheaper and have better food.
author: Leslie F.

description: Came here while in town on business with a friend.  We shared 10 tacos, an order of guac and a picante margarita.  Great service and food- highly recommended!
author: Rachel S.

description: Great service good food and really cool tile floor.  Real cocktails and reasonable prices. It ain't dirt cheap but u get what u pay for.
author: Nato S.

description: Such an amazing find, great food, if you're vegetarian the fried avocado tacos are amazing! Definitely coming back :)
author: Shannon S.

description: Super friendly and quick service. Our server was very knowledgeable about menu and food sensitivities.  We loved the fresh guacamole and the cod tacos.  We also tried the carnitas- they were tasty but too oily. We'd go back for the guac and cod though!
author: Sarri T.

description:
This place is just way too expensive for what you get. I'm all for paying $4 per taco, but it better be a BOMB taco. The tacos at Tacolicious were just downright underwhelming, and even inedible for my standards. I came with a group of 4 and we ordered a total of 20 tacos (2 orders of the 10 plates), and within that assortment of 20 we pretty much tried every taco on their menu, including their "taco of the week". I liked the carnitas the best, but it was in no means impressive. It was just the best of a bunch of meh tacos. On the other hand, I literally could not eat the fish taco. I'm not sure if they fry all the fish at a certain point of the day and leave them under a heat lamp, but when I bit into the taco the only thing I could taste was stale oil. I'm uncertain of if there was actually any fish under all the batter. It was really bad. 

With all that said, if I could, I'd still give this place 2.5 stars because the service was pretty good, the ambiance was hip, and the servings were pretty generous. But in terms of the quality of the food, I was incredibly unimpressed, and felt very much robbed when I paid over $30 for 5 tacos that were not very good. Needless to say I will not be returning.
author: Jaymee G.

description:
My grandma would be so disappointed in me if she knew I ate here.

Food: We ordered a bunch of tacos, some asada and chicken. Both meats were very dry beyond belief. I doused everything with salsa and lime to add some moisture. The meats were flavorless, especially the chicken. Not sure if they marinated the meat at all or just not long enough or maybe the meats were just overcooked. All plausible theories, but also just speculation. As I mentioned I used a hefty amount of salsa to try to compensate lack of flavor and dryness, but to my surprise (not really) the salsas were just mediocre. Not spicy at all and barely any flavor. I don't think I will be trying this place again.

Ambiance: clean, large space, modern and hip decor. Basically the opposite of an authentic or true Mexican hole in the wall restaurant. 

Service: Inattentive and unpleasant. I don't think the busy boy/waitress woman liked that I kept asking for lime, water, etc. 

Price: When in SF, you just accept high prices, but this was just too much. The food wasn't pleasant, service was equally unpleasant, I really wish I didn't spend so much. 

Overall: This place is not authentic at all. Steer clear if you're looking for authentic tacos or just stick to the mission. With a name like "tacolicious," I should have known better.
author: Astrid Z.

description: Was really excited to try this place but won't ordering again. Not sure if I should place more blame on Door Dash or the establishment itself. I ordered the Baja Style Pacific Cod Taco.... it was a small piece of fish smashed onto a cold tortilla. That's it. No sauce or garnishes. I also got a Green Chili Pollo taco which was such a mess it was unrecognizable. Again, no garnishes or anything. Just a cold taco. Sad day for this taco lover!
author: Rachel R.

description: Overpriced ($5+ for 1 street taco?!) and taste not very good.  Guac was not bad.  Pretty good service.     Stay with your local taqueria!
author: Dkac C.

description: Their tacos are great, service could step it up a little. It wasn't even busy and i had to ask for my check 3 times. I just didn't feel as if i was being served, might as well just gone to the front and ordered and then sat down. But to end on a plus, the tacos are seriously the best.
author: Peej J.

description: A fun chain to check out in the city, whether you are in the mission, north beach, or the marina. The tacos here are solid, and it's a fun atmosphere. This is one of those places that is more trendy, than it is authentic Mexican food, but sometimes that can be a good thing. Great for a lunch date, but if you are looking for the most authentic mexican food in the city, head to a taqueria in the mission instead.
author: Ross S.

description: The service is beyond horrible. I've walked out of here twice now. Save yourself the headache and SKIP THIS LOCATION. The one I. The marina or the mission are great. It's only a matter of time before this location closes because of the horrible service - this place is never crowded and for some reason still can't get their shit together.
author: Sophie I.

description: I've been to all tacolicious locations, and this was by far the best one! The service was great, the food was delicious as always, and the restaurant itself had a very pleasant vibe. I asked the really nice server girl, whom was attentive, if she could take my card so I could pay the bill in advance to surprise my bf. She executed the task very well, and the surprise was a success!!! Thank you very much I really appreciate it.
author: Paola N.

description: We LOVED these tacos. Bottomless chips and salsa, great location and a really fun environment! Unique flavors of tacos, all amazing. Pictured are pacific cod, mushroom carnitas, and chicken Chile verde. Great service!
author: Steve N.

description: Delicious and creative tacos; love the authentic small corn tortillas, and thank you for allowing the mix and match. Many comparable restaurants require you to order 3 of the same variety. At Tacolicious, you can actually do a sampler for the whole table.
author: E T.

description: Our server was great the salsa was a little watery but overall we enjoyed the experience the atmosphere is comfortable. This place offers great menu and drink options. Recommend coming here.
author: Saul D.

description: Some of the best tacos in San Fran. Friendly atmosphere and great taco selection. Reasonable prices followed by a great alcohol variety makes for a fun time among friends while noshing on tasty salsa and chips. Check this place out if you're in the area searching for some quality Mexican!!!!
author: Matthew S.

description:
Terrible service!!!
Drinks took forever to come... I had to pick them up at the bar after asking the waitress three times.
Food order came wrong. 
Food was ok, nothing special. If it weren't for the service, I'd consider coming back.
author: Isabela R.

description:
Despite the crazy chaotic scene that was the North Beach Festival happening outside, Tacolicious was able to serve and delight in a quick and efficient manner.

We were seated immediately and given a generous portion of chips and salsa which they replenished whenever we wanted.
Today, we opted for the Tacolicious deal. 1 shot of tequila + 1 beer + 1 taco =$10.

I've only been to Tacolicious one other time, and that was the one in the Mission where I had terribly undercooked Butternut squash tacos.
Today, I saw they got rid of that terrible taco and replaced it with a Fingerling Potato Taco.

This taco was much much better. It tasted like a breakfast taco! There was also mushrooms, onions, and cilantro. It was warm, soft, and fresh. It went perfectly with their trio of salsas. I mean, potatoes & hot sauce is the perfect combo. The beer offered in the combo is Tecate, but I didn't mind bc we were drinking all day anyway, and it felt good to just have a cold beer that didn't cost $9.

Our server was super attentive despite it being busy. She rocked it! 
Thanks for the great service and great tacos. A good redemption by Tacolicious!
author: Lanie L.

description: Good salsa collection. The taco menu choices are above average. Highly recommend the mushroom and chorizo. Overall a complete menu!
author: Rikin M.

description:
I can now officially say I've visited every Tacolicious location in the city. What can I say? I love me some tacos and guac. Seriously though, this location is awesome! Located in the heart of North Beach, this is definitely one of my top places to visit when in the area. They served my party and I in a quick, polite and efficient manner. The Stockton St. Tacolicious crew was extremely accommodating, (the Valencia location is a kind of all over the place, it takes forever to get seated). 

Food:
TACOS TACOS TACOS. My favorite are the traditional carnitas and Shot-and-a-beer Braised Chicken tacos. They were so filling and ridiculously satisfying. Pricing is as follows:

1 For     3.95
4 For     14.00
10 For    33.00

We were a party of 4 and we ordered 8 tacos, we were all full by the end of the meal. Don't let these tacos fool you, they are packed with meat aka you will get full sooner than expected. If you visit Tacolicious you also have to order the Guacamole even though it's an extra 8 bucks. Trust me, you will not regret.
 
Service:
Like stated before, I found that this location had a better sense of customer service when compared to my experiences at the Valencia and Marina locations. From the servers, to the chefs, everyone at this location was incredibly sweet and welcoming. Thumbs up for that.

Atmosphere:
I visited on a Friday night, so it was definitely lively and pretty packed. However, the wait for a table wasn't too insane. It was a fun atmosphere with a lot of younger people getting their taco craving out of the way before hitting those North Beach bars. Lightweight felt like I was in the Marina for a quick second. But yeah, overall it's a fun and lively environment; making it great for big groups of people.
author: Stefany Z.

description:
The food is terrible!  There was so much grease at the bottom of the plate, how is it possible that the pork was dry!  And the salsa tasted like cilantro.....straight cilantro.  
Worse lunch I've had in SF.  Don't waste your money.
author: Andrea S.

description:
Lousy service, got the order wrong (4 chicken, 4 fish tacos), then waited another 20 minutes to get the right order. Tacos were not nearly as good as an authentic hole in the wall, cost $40+ for 8? Never go here. If you want Mexican food go to the real deal. Tastier, cheaper, and you'll get your tacos in less than 40 minutes. The fish tacos were actually not even edible - One was even too many. 

I live locally, and wont be coming back to this disaster again.
author: Chris C.

description:
I love Tacolicious!! I've never left this place in a bad mood. 

The vibe is always really chill, the tacos are amazing, and the queso is TOP NOTCH.  This is the perfect spot for a good lunch on a sunny Saturday. Come by if you're in the mood for a cold margarita and a solid plate of tacos. Nothing better.
author: Katie R.

description:
Came here one of the days during our visit to SanFran. (I know that version of San Francisco is not tolerated, but isn't California one of the most tolerant states?) (Sometime between 07/30/16 and 08/06/16). 

Our friend's cousin and bf came to meet us for a bite. We ordered a whole bunch of tacos. The one with the cheese was amazing. The water service sucked and rocked. It only rocked because my boo next to me was constantly refilling our water for us. No one left thirsty. 

The drinks/cocktails are all margaritas, with which the menu was too vague to mention such. I found out from the server. I hate margaritas! 

The shredded beef taco was too salty for my taste buds. 

And the vegetable taco was also yummilicious. 

I cannot vouch for any of the other tacos people ordered, but everyone was happy. One of our buds claimed that the soft taco shell itself tasted funny, but to me it was fine - I guess he's not accustomed to traditional corn taco soft shells. 

The ambiance is cool and hip. We sat at a long table(s) close to the outside. The windows were open so there was less of a feeling of being pushed against the wall. 

They also had a handful of desserts, that looked mmmmmmmmm! But we didn't get around to it. 

I'd go back for another round (of tacos) another day and maybe try a dessert! 

Happy eats!
author: Ronit M.

description: Best tacos in California! Unique and tasty... affordable and fun.
author: H M.

description:
Taco + Delicious = Tacolicious! DOH! Tacolicious does not have the most affordable tacos (about $3-4 per taco) to be honest, but they aren't bad and some of them are super flavorful! It is also better to go in bigger groups as tacos are cheaper when ordered in a greater quantity. 

Best Tacos: 
-Short Rib: juicy and flavorful strip pieces. My personal favorite! 
-Pacific Cod: Crisp and tasty batter - just wish there was more. 
-Beer Battered Chicken: Very juicy and the chicken has a light and zesty flavor to it. 

Just Okay Tacos:
-Bistec: Way too small for what you pay for. 
-Chorizo and potatoes: Hit or miss - not a consistent portion ever 
-Summer Squash: Wish there was more sustenance like beans with this. Or atleast another seasoning. 
-Carnitas: Nothing Special. 

Also, there are three beautiful sauces - the yellow one is way too spicy and the others are great especially with the short rib! In terms of drinks, they currently have a pomegranate margarita that is so refreshing. I also wish the Sangria had a bigger kick to it. If you come here during dinner time and especially on the weekends, the service is kind of slow, but usually the servers are very receptive! If you are going to get the guacamole, there's nothing really special about it, but it is still a great starter. 
Thanks Tacolicious for a Delicious time! :)
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: I love tacolicious. When you sit down they immediately give you free salsa and chips. The salsa tastes amazing. Their tacos are always a beautiful display. The food comes fasts. Their happy hour menu is fantastic. Ambiance is great and you won't break your wallet.
author: Michelle L.

description:
A fun spot that definitely serves some cool, unique tacos, but the apathetic service here really kills the mood.

I came in with a close friend and one of her buddies that was vacation in SF for the first time. It was about 3PM and the place was practically dead, so we were expecting some pretty speedy service. Wrong. The waitress would stop by us rarely, acting as if tending to us was a chore (it wasn't - all we asked for was tap water and three tacos). The food took a long time to come out, but I admit that when the food came out, it was good. The shot-and-a-beer braised chicken taco was simple but totally yummy, tiny yet hearty. The accompanying salsas were also all delicious and complex, it was really fun to mix/match them with the different tacos. 

If you're nearby and lackluster service doesn't particularly bother you, then I would say that this place is worth a try just because the tacos are pretty delicious. But personally, the only time I'd come to Tacolicious again is if I try a different location in a gamble for some better service.
author: Desiree S.

description:
*** This is based on a to-go order I placed at the bar ***

Due to long wait times at every nearby Italian restaurant in the Little Italy district on Sunday (7/31/16) night, my wife chose to get pizza at the by-the-slice window of Tony's next door -- I wasn't in the mood for pizza, and had just scarfed down a side of chow mien I picked up on our walk through Chinatown, so decided to check this place out

It's a bit funny/random/weird to find a taco-themed restaurant smack dab in the middle of Little Italy, but man am I glad I took a chance, I'm 39 and got hit on by a mid-20's hottie while placing my order, always a nice ego boost; my wife said I should have let her buy me a shot, hopefully they'll be a next time - I'm always game for free tequila :)

As for the food, I paid about $5.50 (before tip) for one jam-packed full carnitas taco (full size, not those wimpy street taco 3-biter tortillas) ... BEST carnitas I've ever tasted, even better than any Mexican restaurant in Los Angeles or San Diego - perfectly seasoned meat, and a side of chips & salsa were included -- also came with 3 types of "sauces" for the taco; I used the green creamy one that tasted like avocado, it was very good

I would recommend this restaurant to anyone headed to San Francisco, definitely added to my must-eat list for any future visits to S.F.
author: Cory H.

description:
When I started mentioning to people I was heading to San Francisco for a little trip, everyone and their mother told me with vigor "you must have tacos while you are there". Being one of my favorite things in life, I obviously knew I would not skip this activity. 

My friend and I were walking around the waterfront and stopped into a restaurant to have a glass of wine and talk to the bartender about good local spots. When we said we wanted tacos, he told us to go to Tacolicious. The name alone completely sold me. I didn't require any additional recommendations. 

We walked over to this little taco joint and were pleased with the colorful and airy interior. A friendly staff member bounded over to us and let us know we can sit anywhere. We grabbed a seat by the window and she came right over to take our drink orders.We decided to get a pitcher of the Sangria Roja (red wine, apricot brandy, spicy apple salsa, OJ). We loved it. It was refreshing and just a little bit sweet. 

We had some guacamole to start which was really great too. I'm a complete sucker for tortilla chips and these didn't disappoint. 

Then we had tacos. Oh lord, so many tacos. 

The Baja Style Pacific Cod was awesome. Fresh, light, flaky. Guajillo Braised Beef Short Rib was unreal. So well cooked and bursting with flavor. Chicken En Mole Colorado was awesome. I'm not usually much of a chicken fan, but these are moist and delicious. I think we got two of each and it was WAY too much food. So dumb. So tasty. So going back. 

I loved the casual vibe of the place, the swiftness with which they delivered my meal and sangria refills, the kindness of the staff. 

Now if only they would open in NYC...I think it would be a real hit.
author: Lauren B.

description: I know good tacos; I was brought up having the best tacos in Mexicali, but these tacos are out of this world. I'm so impressed with their vegetarian variety. They are scrumptious!!! I'm surprised it doesn't have better reviews. I'm bringing my whole family here
author: Melissa M.

description:
First time coming to this place for my coworker's cousin's birthday.  I'm a big margaritas fan so I naturally wanted to try one.  It actually was pretty good...one of the best I've ever had.  I didn't taste the sickly sweet pre mixed syrup and the lime juice tasted real.  That in itself made most of the night.  The tacos looked good although much fancier from what I'm used to at traditional tacquerias.  However, after trying one, I was hooked.  Delicious tacos as expected.

I definitely can see myself coming here after work to have tacos and margs.  The place gets packed at all hours of the night as it is a dinner and post dinner spot.
author: Ben H L.

description: The food is okay nothing to say here. However the service was terrible had to wait 20mn before going to the bar to order then trying to get the check was even worse took 20mn and one wrong check!
author: Florian P.

description:
Woah.. 

I walked in for lunch on a Monday and the first thing I noticed was the casual/ hipster vibe, employees didn't have a t-shirt or uniform just regular clothing. The hostess who greeted us didn't seem to care much and without any discretion, texting on her cell phone (charging ) by the bar next to other guests. 

I was sat by the computer in the back booth, apparently the servers hang out spot because they were standing directly behind my chair the entire time which made me feel uncomfortable. They could of been checking up on tables or keeping busy instead, that made me feel rushed and I didn't stay for long.

My initial thought was where is the manager?? That should never be allowed. 

My server (1 of 2) was very sweet and about the only one who was actually doing her job. One star there. 

The tacos were yummy and the salsas are awesome, that's another star. Overall the tacos were overpriced and I had a very unprofessional experience.
author: Ana B.

description:
I've usually been a big fan of Tacolicious - wide variety of tacos, fresh meat, good service. However, the last time I went on October 29, 2016, I was let down. My group always starts off with chips, salsa, and guac. When we ordered the guac, the waiter told us there was an avocado shortage and suggested we order queso instead! I was in disbelief - what Mexican restaurant doesn't serve guac! Then days later, November 3, 2016 to be exact, there was a huge news announcement about how the avocado prices had dropped almost $1 per avocado. So remembering back on my economics classes, the supply and demand methodology wasn't adding up.

Besides the 'avocado shortage,' the meat seemed to be a bit greasier than usual. 

The plus side of this visit was that we learned how amazing the crunchy shell tacos are. Please keep those on the menu!
author: Emmy Q.

description: Terrible customer service!! Waiter was very rude!! Never coming here again. As a customer, I think it is disrespectful for a waiter to tell me to "relax" if I am trying to explain to her for the third time what our order was!!
author: Laura Ann M.

description:
On weekend nights young, hip 20-30 somethings fill the dining room consuming margaritas and other cocktails.  The vibe here is real!  My fellow North Beach pals and I enjoy eating and snacking at Tacolicious before we head out on the town.

The complimentary chips and salsa rock here! I think I ate an entire bowl of chips before my main entree of tacos arrived.  

The 4-taco special is a great way to sample different types of tacos offered.  A selection of salsas and sauce accompany the tacos-- watch out of the yellow hot sauce!  The special taco is available in the 4-pack special for an additional charge.  I'm glad I went for the special taco in my 4-pack as it was my favorite.  The special during our visit was the Vietnamese chicken taco.  Wow-- this was not only unique but also absolutely delicious.  I hope this makes it only the menu permanently.  

The noise level here is much higher than average.  This may not be the best environment for an intimate date.
author: Andrea H.

description:
Great place for tAcos and drinks. I generally  order whichever fish or shrimp are on the menu and my husband goes for the braised beef and carnitas. Love the roasted brussel sprouts but the sweet plaintains are never ripe and therefore taste bland.

Kids meal is excellent value - $8 for taco, rice & beans, agua Fresca and two scoops of ice cream!

On Mondays they donate 15% to a local public school - another reason to frequent a local business!
author: Serena S.

description:
It's funny how when restaurants expand into multiple locations, the service & the product turn into one big crapshoot.  

Am I right?

If we're being honest, perhaps the only chain to successfully beat this phenomenon is...
Starbucks.

Say what you will about the coffee conglomerate, but no matter what, I can count on my green tea, soy, & unsweetened latte to be fabulous; regardless of barista or location.  99 times out of 100.

Beating those odds is the challenge.

Tacolicious positively kicked butt w Chestnut Street.  Then, w Valencia, it seemed like the apple fell close to the tree.  

But North Beach?  Meh.

Service here is always friendly, & usually efficient.  Props for that.

But on my most recent visit, I came in w a dear old friend just to catch up.  We sat at the counter (between the bar & the dining room) & only ordered the queso dip & guacamole.  While they did keep the chips coming unprompted, yet on cue, the chips were on the stale side.  Bad chips?  No bueno.  
The queso dip was piping hot, but it lacked kick, & was on the runny side.  The best thing was the guac, but even it was a bit bland.  

Donde esta el sabor?

This location (wisely) pays homage to the neighborhood w their shot of fernet, a beer, & a taco deal.  No collective area loves their fernet branca more than north beach.  Outside of Italy anyway.  Props for that.

All in all, I still prefer Valencia street.

3 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
We saw a huge rat run across the back bench while we were dining.  It continued to run back and forth and down the gap in the metal support beam, while we ate.  Yikes!  We informed the waitress who seemed genuinely alarmed but nothing was done about it.   I'm not sure what they should have done, but maybe could have comped the meal or investigated it or something.  I guess they did not feel responsible as blame was placed on the chinatown subway construction.  That may be true - I don't know - but if it is then maybe avoid all restaurants in chinatown/northbeach!  Either way, it's lame to just shift blame.

Food-wise - it is ok.  Very few choices, but decent tacos.  I've had better for sure.  I enjoyed the meatballs the most!

Given the rat situation, I'd recommend staying away until they have exterminated the place.  I'm not sure how long it will take them to resolve it considering the lack of interest in the rat (maybe they already knew about it?)
author: rahul c.

description:
Our server, Dino sucked.. It took 20 minutes to get us straws and 50 minutes to get us our tacos.. There was only about 8 parties in the restaurant. 

He was cocky and full of himself.

My fiancé and I were thinking out buying out the whole restaurant on a Friday night for our rehearsal dinner for 60 people. They could of had our 20k.. We're going elsewhere.. 

Dino was never around until the very end. I think he finally realized he had to work harder for a tip because we were in no mood. He showed more attention to the two guys who were obviously on a date with each other.. He was major c*ck blocking and the guys were annoyed. 

The food isn't worth mentioning since the service sucked big time! 

We came on a Friday afternoon on July 25th, 2014 around 2:30pm if the management feels like this is worth investigating.
author: Darlene M.

description: The music at this location is very loud if you want to have a conversation, you are better to find another place.  We ordered pork, beef, cod and chicken tacos and they were all salty, dry and spicy.  We couldn't eat any of what we ordered so had to throw the entire dinner.  What a shame.
author: Cindy R.

description: Taco Tuesday! Just kidding I'm not that excited about it.  It's was actually the worst tacos I've ever had in SF.  The meat was not flavorful, the taco shells were old and stale, and the rice and beans were cold. The bartenders were ripping tequila shots behind the bar not paying attention to guests while one guy was being super racist telling some Latino guy he wished he would grow his mustache out and wear a sombrero.  Really?!? Did you just really say that nasty comment to this guy?  If you spent more time focusing on your guests and not ripping tequila shots, your margarita might have actually been balanced properly and your tacos wouldn't have sucked so hard.  Gross.  Food, beverage, and racism.  Who could ask for more.
author: James L.

description: This is a really fun, trendy little taco place I found on my visit to the city over Labor Day weekend. The menu wasn't very large but the tacos were seriously delicious. I enjoyed the open kitchen and watching the chefs make the tacos. Even though they were busy, I got my food within 10 minutes of ordering. My waitress could have been friendlier. She hardly made eye contact with me the entire time but was very talkative to her other tables around me.
author: Morgan R.

description:
Quick Review: Another trendy Mexican spot in SF. Overpriced but tasty tacos, healthy options and good drink options. Be prepared for a long wait for long groups

FOOD
Camarones $12.75
Short Rib taco X1 $4.75
The meat of the short rib was very good! Great flavor, very authentic to Mexican street tacos. But they rip you off with only letting you order 1, 4, or 10 tacos. Nobody pays $17 for 4 tacos. The shrimp was also very spicy and not a lot. It came with 2 tortillas.  That dish was ok, I'd rather order the tacos.

SERVICE
Our wait was over an hour, but understandably so because we had a group of 14. Our order was taken fairly quick and the food too. Our party was so large that a few of the orders were just put on the table and we had to figure it out. They were very nice to split our bill into 3 tables and took as many cards necessary.

AMBIANCE
Trendy spot in north beach. The bar has 2 TVs playing that were playing the warrior game. Bar stool tables, minimal decorations.
author: Brittany S.

description: I think you know what you're getting into when you go to Tacolicious.  It's expensive for what it is but can be satisfying.  But I do sometimes avoid coming here because I think the seating and set-up is beyond terrible. Unless you get one of the few booths along the wall, you're sitting on this plasticky, rickety tall stool you wouldn't even find in the dive-iest of bars. But the worst part is the lack of hooks under the table or along the walls while your party of three is sat at a table clearly meant for two. You're either wearing or holding onto your jackets or bags. Although I do see a lot of people just toss them on the not-the-cleanest of floor or sit on their jackets (which I've seen more than once have food or drinks dripped into it by passing servers).  I would suggest to install some hooks; I really don't think it would be that expensive.
author: whatever I.

description: Returned after our initial visit to San Francisco and this place is still just as good as the first time we went! They have some of the best guacamole and tacos we've ever had anywhere. The tacos have a lot of filling, so three is plenty for a normal person. Very reasonable prices and great service. We were there on a Friday night, so it was loud inside, but didn't bother us because the food was so delicious. We loved the hint of mint in their salsa.
author: Cody J.

description: Their queso dip is my favorite thing on the menu. You won't regret it. Their tacos are a little overpriced to be honest, but their sides are awesome. It is definitely more of a high end Mexican food not an authentic Mexican food.
author: Jenna G.

description: As a devout lover of tacos and Mexican food in general, I adored this restaurant and the quality of the food. The meat they use for these tacos are so juicy, soft and tender that it's like eating a steak. (Try the carne asada tacos if you want some tasty steak.) And, as always, the tacos are made with the authentic soft tortilla wrap, not that wannabe-taco Doritos shell. My personal recommendations are the chorizo and potato tacos or the carne asada tacos. Check it out.
author: Elliot F.

description: Two stars for the food, it was good in parts. The service was complete trash. They messed everything up, were unapplogetic about it and it was super slow....wtf like why would you expect a tip if you make your patron work for the food? Bday dinner ruined
author: Asya M.

description:
This place is ok.  

If you must get the tacos, avoid the Filet Mignon.  As good as it might sound, it's not worth it.  You end up getting 3 small pieces of meat on 2 corn tortillas with 1 caramelized onion string. Plus it's $3 extra (for a total of $7.95).  Instead get the "shot - and - a - beer braised chicken."  It's $4.95 and you get a lot of meat on this taco, to the point I was able to separate take my 2 corn tortillas and divide the meat between each tortilla and still each taco was big.  

The bar here is pretty awesome.  Nice cocktails, but a bit pricey.  It is worth the stop.  My favorite is the sangria roja.

The Chips and Salsa is really good here as well.
author: Rose Z.

description:
Pros:

Delicious food (when there isn't hair in the food) 
Fully stocked bar
Food gets to you fairly quickly 
Napkins are of good quality. You won't be murdering the napkin dispenser with constantly pulling out Napkins.

Cons:

Service could have been better.
Don't remember ordering the hair taco. (found a hair in one of our tacos.)
I was using the restroom and I had it locked, One of the workers gave a customer a key to unlock the door. The restroom is a single person restroom if you hadn't guessed it by now. 

The food is good when hair isn't in there. The service is not. 

Go ahead and try it. Just double check your food. 

Enjoy!!!
author: Joshua R.

description:
Solid Mexican food, but nothing that really sets it apart. The taco fillings were a little greasy but not overly so, but weren't particularly distinguishable from other Mexican places in terms of taste.

-GUAJILLO BRAISED BEEF SHORT RIB - 4/5
My favorite of the meats we got. The beef had nothing special going on flavor-wise, but it was superr tender. A little fatty and greasy, but not as fatty as the carnitas.

-TRADITIONAL CARNITAS - 3/5
Kind of fatty. A little salty but sweet at the same time, but flavors were weak.

-SHOT-AND-A-BEER BRAISED CHICKEN - 2/5
Chicken was shredded and on the dry side. Had a little heat but was too salty

-BUTTERNUT SQUASH, PASILLA PEPPERS, SWISS CHARD, PEPITAS - 3/5
Pretty greasy. I don't think I'd order this again, but it makes for an interesting vegetarian option. The squash is cooked nicely - neither mushy nor hard and undercooked.

-RICE-O-LICIOUS - 2.5/5
Not bad, but the texture is too mushy for my liking

-GUACAMOLE - 3/5
Their guac is SUPER creamy and doesn't have tomato in it. Not strong with the lime/acidity either. I usually like chunkier guac, but theirs isn't bad.
author: Jessie L.

description:
Reluctantly had to come here for a networking event and I have to say management definitely has changed a lot since my last visit.  

Our server Jennifer was great, food tasted fresher than I ever remembered it.  The manager is gone and the staff seemed really on it.  I'll be back for sure.
author: Robert M.

description: One of my favorite places in North Beach! Great drinks, the food is amazing (tuna tostadas are a MUST) and the service is always attentive and friendly.
author: Emily S.

description:
You know that scenario where you land in town, your friend is still busy at work and you're walking around aimlessly for something to do in a short amount of time, within the neighborhood you're staying?

Yeah probably not. 

Walking around North Beach and after checking out Washington Square Park, I was walking over to some bars I knew about, around 3 o'clock. 

As I'm walking I see an employee bring out the chalk board, which says happy hour 3-6. 

That was convenient! 

Step in and grab a seat at the bar, I was ready to start my vacation the way I normally live my life, drunk. Saw a nice deal, tequila, beer and taco special for $10 bucks. 

The bartenders and I started chatting it up. I inquired about the local beer, liquor and grocery stores around. They were very helpful. 

The carne asada taco was packed. I was able to split my soft tortilla into two and essentially get two tacos out of it. It came with three sauces, all of which were pretty good. 

Ordered another beer, they didn't even charge me. Left a nice tip and went on my way.

Great staff, very friendly, super helpful. Seems like an awesome spot to hit up for happy hour if you're free that early.
author: Mitch E.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants I've ever been to.  Nailed it!   Tacos are amazing with HUGE portions of meat.  Cocktails are creative and delicious.  Environment is fun and lively.  Get over here and try this one!
author: Larry B.

description: The place/atmosphere was fine. Service is fine. Tacos were fine. But I guess if I just wanted some tacos I'd just go to a taqueria.
author: Tinou B.

description:
Had lunch with a friend last Friday when the weather was California-terrible (I feel like I always have to qualify any negative statements I make about our weather since plenty of East Coast friends have filled my Facebook news feed with photos of the #polarvortex).  

I left the office at 12:30, trekked from the FiDi to Tacolicious in about 15 minutes, and realized that I really, REALLY need to start exercising because it was just embarrassing to be red faced BEFORE even partaking of the libations offered here.

And let me tell you 'bout their libations.  Oh wait.  I can't.  That's right... it was lunch on a work day.  And I work in HR.  (Note to self: come back over the weekend).  Seriously, though, they've got one gorgeous bar set-up.  Like something you'd want to see in MTV's cribs.  Get on it, Lil' Wayne.

I got one of the high tables and chairs for two in the middle of the dining area and found the seating... adequate.  Let's just say that they definitely aren't encouraging people to stick around for long chats unless you're comfortable with being uncomfortable.  I did, however, appreciate the purse hook that was built in... but there was only one of them.  Would it really have been too much to ask to have put in two?  Quintessential #firstworldproblem?  Sorry.  :(  I'm not complaining; I'm just sayin'.

The waitstaff promptly bring out glasses, water, chips, and salsa when you arrive.  The salsa is not spicy at all.  (I'm a total wimp who can't handle hot cheetos so I should know.)  When my friend arrived, we decided to split the 4 for 14 taco platter since neither of us were all that hungry.  She had been there before with coworkers and recommended the beef short rib (a quick skim through Yelp reviews seems to confirm this, too).  I, however, had a hankering for chorizo and since I couldn't drink, the "shot-and-a-beer braised chicken."  

I'm guessing that all of the filling is prepared ahead of time and just spooned into two freshly heated-up-on-a-grill corn tortillas.  I know that that's just practical for the restaurant, but I'm not a huge fan of cold chorizo.  I mean, I know that it's not the greatest thing for me, but I don't need to have that point emphasized when certain bits and pieces have congealed on me.  The braised chicken, though, was amazing even though it was cold.  If I come here again while ravenously hungry, I'll want to see 4 of those suckers on a plate.

All in all, I'd definitely come back if I was in the area, especially for their weekend brunch and some drinks.
author: Iona C.

description:
This is the third Tacolicious location I've been to (previous locations are in the Mission and in Mountain View). Upon arrival, I noticed it was rather empty - which has never happened to me before at any of the Tacolicious locations. My friends and I sat down and were greeted by a nice gentleman who then introduced our waitress. 

The four of us ordered some sangria, guacamole, and a plate of tacos to share for the table. I was incredibly impressed that the gentleman took out order without writing anything down and brought out all of orders without any mistakes. The food was mediocre and fell flat compared to the other locations on my opinion. I also noticed that they had removed the pork belly tacos from their menu which are my favorite. 

The waitress, after initially being introduced, didn't return to our table until it was time to get the check. I am surprised she even bothered to come back, seeing as the nice gentleman had handled everything for us. I really hope that he received the tip we left.

Overall, the atmosphere was nice, the food was mediocre, and the service was great (from the guy, at least). I'm not sure I'll come back to this one, and may have to give the Mission location a second chance to see if they, too, have gotten rid of the pork belly tacos.
author: Mike D.

description:
You know, for yuppie tacos, these are pretty darn good. 

I'm quite a fan of the made-to-order guacamole. It's bright, fresh, and flavorful with just the right amount of spice for a little kick. Pair that with the trio of salsas/dips and you will have no lack of good choices for your chip dipping pleasure. Now onto the tacos: I love the braised beef short rib taco. It's incredibly tender but bursting with flavor that only slow braising makes possible. It's nice and salty but with some heat to balance it out. The fried cod taco is a close runner up. I like the flaky fish with it's crispy batter exterior but it's well balanced with the cabbage and creamy sauce. No taco meal for me is complete without carnitas and they do it pretty well at Tacolicious but the edge goes to mom and pop taquerias on this one. 

The veggie taco is also really good here with the amalgamation of flavors from the asparagus to the oyster mushrooms to the garlic. The flavors work well together and that's what Tacolicious does well - putting a contemporary spin on the humble traditional taco. Pair it with some margaritas and beers, you've got yourself a good night of dining and conversation. Beer, shot, and taco specials for happy hour and they have a taco Tuesday deal too I believe.
author: Jon L.

description: Great happy hour. 6 bucks 3 tacos. 6$ glass of wine. Excellent service. Outdoor tables overlooking washington sq park
author: Mitch W.

description:
Solid place. My husband and I have been here twice now and both times have been good. 
Definitely not authentic, but I don't think anyone comes here for authenticity.
