Overall a good vibe. A little pricey but what isn't now? And solid food. The fried plantains were my fave. And my husband had had all the tacos. He likes the brisket and chicken the best! 
If you're in the area I'd recommend it.
author: Angela C.

description:
Service was great but prices are ridiculous 
$18 for 4 tacos - all were delicious but tiny, $4.50 for a 2 bite taco

$41 for a pitcher of house margaritas - split with the wife and not even a hint of a buzz afterwards

Next time I'll take advantage of the free chips and salsa and go with a draft beer and a tequila shot
author: Bumble B.

description:
I've been here several times, and I don't know if it's just this location but the quality has gone down hill. I used to go to the tacolicious in Marina often and got really excited when they finally opened a location in North Beach, but it's not the same. Several issues:

1) way under staffed. The manager has maybe 2 servers during peak eating hours. I understand the trade off by maximizing profit, but the wait times are not ideal.

2) what do you do to compensate for the lack of staff? It seems you make tacos ahead of time to meet demand. So when I order 4 tacos, they're not hot, the tortilla is not fresh and the fried cod is cold. WTF? 

3) to make matters worse, you charge 5% for "San Francisco health tax." Okay, cool but now I'm subsidizing the fact you underpay your staff and there is a lack of them, so I feel I am taking the hit twice.

4) you keep raising prices. I am aware of this city's inflation and how businesses have gone out of business due to the lack of rent control. But $18 for 4 cold tacos with cold tortillas? No thanks.

5) margaritas aren't that great either. Sorry staff, but I expected so much more.
author: Karl A.

description: This place has delicious tacos! I just wish they delivered so we could order them for office lunches. I'm not a vegetarian, but their veggie tacos are really good too!
author: Elena K.

description:
Disappointing. So disappointing. I had heard from a couple coworkers that this was the place for tacos. I read on Yelp the raving reviews about the short rib taco. All disappointing.  I wouldn't bother coming here for anything except maybe to have some drinks with friends.

Other things that made my experience poor? The lacklustre service which made me feel like I was being a burden by even being there, the salty guacamole (tragedy!) that we had to send back, the head poundingly loud acoustics (music + people = LOUDLOUDLOUD).

I hear that other locations might be better, but I can't say that I'm in a rush to go check them out when SF is filled with so many other places for tacos.
author: Colene C.

description:
Tacolicious is always a reliable choice!  I usually get a couple different tacos (the cod is delicious!) and I also recommend the margaritas! It's not super filling unless you order a lot or eat a lot of chips... guilty :P

Food and drinks are on the pricey side but kinda standard for this type of place in SF. I often suggest this place when I'm meeting up with a couple of different people because it seems to be universally well-liked.

Unfortunately no reservations, I think only the Mission location does them for large groups.
author: Connie Q.

description:
Friday night was pretty busy but luckily, seats at the bar were available. 

To start off, I loved the chips and salsa and was adding the salsa to the tacos I had. They do bring out three more additional salsas (mild, medium and hot) with the tacos but my preference was the chunky salsa that came out with the chips. I shared a bunch of tacos which were loaded with fish/meat. We got the following flavors: fried local rock cod, shot-and-a-beer braised chicken, traditional carnitas, guajillo braised beef short rib, and house-made chorizo and potatoes. My favorites were the rock cod (hunk of cod with a crunchy batter) and the braised chicken (moist, super flavorful and saucy) tacos. I wasn't very impressed with the other three flavors but it really depends on what tickles your fancy.

Service was spotty. I didn't even realize there was a hostess until we were leaving so I don't think she did a very good job of greeting folks but she at least smiled and thanked us when we left. The bartender just simply took our order and gave us the bill. But the guy who delivered our tacos was the friendliest of the bunch.  

If you plan to pay a visit, look out for the little taco picture. I don't think I saw an actual sign with the word "Tacolicious" out front.
author: Maya S.

description: The chips and salsa are great, the guac is great, the carnitas and chicken tacos I had were amazing. I loved that they had fun/unique (& REFRESHING) drinks that were nonalcoholic (in addition to the alcoholic drink selection of course!) Everyone in my group cleaned their plates and service was fast and friendly!
author: Tina P.

description: If I could give this negative stars I would. My girlfriend and I ordered takeout today, two Marina Girl salads with Chicken. The Chicken aside from being minimal portions at best doesn't even equal a whole Chicken breast between the two. The chicken was also burnt, dry, and appeared to be yesterday's left over chicken. The salads were also entirely romain lettuce, no avocado, cucumbers, radishes, etc which are normally in the salads. For $14/salad I expect at least what the description says. The fact that the quality of the food and amount of the food vary greatly depending on if you order take out or dine in is just poor quality control from the management.
author: Josh N.

description:
Very nice service. All staff are friendly and very attentive.

Food is a little too pricey. Tiny portion & not filling. I ordered beef tacos with picked onions: they were great but again, very tiny portion.
author: Salisa K.

description: Thank you Tacolicious probably hands down one of my favorite steak tacos I've ever eaten in my life. I eat Mexican food 5 days a week. ;)
author: Codi B.

description:
As much as I ADORE tacos, there are few that can really grab my attention and keep it. 

This was one of those times. 

I wish they would've given me an unlimited supply of tacos from here because I easily could eat them for breakfast, lunch, dinner...midnight snacks, brunch, and "after the break-up binges". 

They were that fantastic. 

The chips and salsa both really hit the spot, and when we got our tacos (which were $5 by the way, cheap for San Fran) I was in heaven. I tried the carne taco and it was the perfect size. The best part is, they put another tortilla shell under the one cradling the meat, so technically you can make TWO tacos. 

They do no skimp on the meat either. And they bring some side sauces to compliment your meal. Mmmm mmmm soooo good. 

The design is fun and hip. Orange and silver make it look posh and sleek. And the water "pitchers" are fun too. Take me word for it, you want to come here. 

TIPS & TRICKS: 
* Try the shrimp taco, it's fresh and delicious, especially with us being right next to the ocean. 
* Get a Mexican Coke, just a coca cola in a glass bottle, but it is great.
author: Haley N.

description:
We wandered into Tacolicious after walking around Chinatown, North Beach, and a failed attempt at Coit Tower. We were hungry people. 

And this was indeed the place to satisfy our hunger. It was pretty empty on a Saturday at noon, which could be a turn-off for some, but was a turn-on for us. Again...hungry people. 

The menu is mouthwatering. We had a hard time deciding what to get. So we compounded that with five tacos (him), and one taco and a side of rice (me). Holy spiceballs, it was spicy. Even for him, a man usually unfazed by all things spicy. Spiciness aside, the food was delicious and I'm already craving my taco (the weekly special Halloween-themed taco: shrimp, beans, two different kinds of crema, etc.). The beans, oh, the beans - YUM. So creamy. Yes, I'm singling out beans amongst a vast sea of other bomb ingredients - I didn't choose the bean life, the bean life chose me.

Oh, and if you're positioned just right in the restaurant (i.e., a table facing the bar), you'll see a picture of President Obama tucked away in the hallway, smiling. No, he hasn't visited - I asked our waitress. Yeah, I was excited for a minute there, too. 

Go for the tacos (and um, the rest of the amazing-looking food on the menu, too!) and for the candid picture of the President, if you're so inclined. I don't think you'll be too disappointed.
author: Morgan R.

description: Had s get together after work with some ex coworkers.  Tried a variety of tacos.  Enjoyed the fish and the chorizo tacos with various salsas. Margaritas was pretty good as well.  Service was ok but it was extremely crowded when we went so it was difficult to get a waitress for while to take our order.
author: FG L.

description: Everything here is great. The salsa has a hint of mint in it which I love. Not a fan of the intense fast paced music while eating that's the only negative I have to say. Love their tortilla chips.
author: Kristen K.

description: Took a short Uber ride from Fishermans Wharf to Tacolicious and I was not disappointed. Arrived in time for happy hour and they were playing the warriors game on all the TV's. Very chill atmosphere. Service was A1. Happy hour prices were great considering the area. The tacos are small but flavorful and filling. Nice selection of drinks and superb shot sizes. Definitely recommend for happy hour.
author: Richard B.

description: This location continues to have the worst service one could possibly find in the city. I do not understand how it's still open. It seems like it's run by a high school student as an after school project rather than an actual business. I suppose it's still open due to tourists who don't know any better. Please do yourselves a favor and go to Don Pisto's up the street or the Chestnut location.
author: Katy M.

description:
If you're allergic to peanuts, STAY AWAY from their chicken mole taco.

Unless you want to die.

Because that almost happened to me.

Chips and salsa were solid though.
author: Chris Y.

description: Omg!  The best Margherita I have tasted ever in the world!! Made by our most adorable bartender Claudia!
author: Mezzi M.

description:
Tacolicious doesn't have the hustle and bustle of typical tacquerias....definitely more of a modern sit down restaurant to just kick back and catch up with some friends. The crowd was small when we entered for a Monday at lunch. 

Tried a variety of their tacos, but to be honest, I wasn't blown away by any one of them. Granted, I ordered a plate of tacos for more of a value...but when you consider the fact that the single taco is $4 each, its pretty pricey as far as Mexican food goes. While each taco was piled nice and high, the flavors were all kind of flat. Not enough seasoning all the way through...especially for the braised short ribs and braised chicken...midway through it was just meat. While that's all good fun, it was difficult to get through without the additional salsas and lime they provided...to really add that extra kick. Kind of disappointing if you ask me.

The single redeeming factor to my meal was the chips and salsa. 

Now those were good.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Food is good (and where do you find goat for tacos?), but SSSOOOO LLLOOOUUDDD.  Also, for the most part, very uncomfortable seating (bar stools throughout except one row of booth-style seating along one wall, all taken).  Won't go back, unless they tune the music (which drives up the loud conversations) WAY down.
author: Mike L.

description:
Great bartenders and great place for drinks.

Eating dinner here - didn't refill waters the entire time never saw our server on the floor. Had to keep our eye out for her and ask twice for chips and water.

If you're a vegetarian or vegan careful when ordering - the meat tacos were slammed up against the veggie tacos. Had to re-order and it seemed like a surprise to request vegetarian on a separate plate.
author: Kelsey L.

description: Significantly less tasty than the marina or mission version, really wasn't pleased with the meal for $45. Terrible.
author: Brittney B.

description: Pleasant atmosphere with some nice outside seating for a sunny day.  Was looking for something lighter than pizza while passing through North Beach and got a great salad - the Marina Girl - with chicken. I didn't have the tacos but they looked delicious and will have to do that next time.  If you're looking for a place to watch the game and have a margarita, this is a good choice for that too.
author: Amy D.

description:
It was getting late, but I wanted to grab a quick bite before the trek back to our lodging for the evening. And that's when I saw the sign...an orange-glowing beacon of hope in the shape of a taco. I had to go in. 

You know how sometimes when you're out in the daylight for a while, you have to adjust your eyes when you step into a restaurant, because of the change in lighting? Well, it was already dark outside, and I still had to adjust my eyes when walking in because it was so dark inside of this place. I had trouble reading the menu at the bar; the candles were useless help.

I wasn't looking to splurge, just wanted a quick snack. A grab and go from the bar if you will. But the bartender seemed to think I was coming in to casually enjoy a cocktail and order a full plate. Though I tried to drop the hint that I wasn't interested in anything other than a mere taco to go, they suggested that I try at least two. Fine. They took much longer than I expected getting the order put in and the food out to me. Tacos were okay, but not what I was expecting when I was lured in by their logo. Tacovicious, rather.
author: Christel L.

description:
Complimentary chips are thicker than what I'd prefer but the salsa it comes with is refreshing & tasty. 

Plantains were good. I'd prefer them being more sweeter. They just needed these to ripen a bit more. The Crema cumin that it comes with is excellent.

Short rib taco has plenty of meat but very oily. 
Rock cod taco of the week was good. Big piece of fish and tasty. 

Service was great with female waitress. She followed up with me on more than one occasion. 

Service was NOT good at all from guy waiter. He simply dropped off food took my order as if he has no desire for a tip.
author: Ivan D.

description:
Foods is delicious, drinks are good, blah blah blah, but my real tip is ELAINA is the best waitress I have literally ever had. Request her and have the best dinner ever! We love you, Elaina!

Ps order the passion marg and the short rib taco- delish.
author: Kaitlin H.

description:
Wow what a gem!  Loved the dinner.  We were headed to Tony's for pizza but due to the wait we went next door to tacolicious and we were so glad we did.

Best taco in my opinion is the chorizo and potato taco.  The plantains are great as is the salsa.

I couldn't find a fault 5 stars!
author: Smorga M.

description:
THIS IS THE BEST T LISH IN TOWN. I've been to every tacolicious in SF and hands down this one is amazing. Amanda runs a tight ship whenever I'm around, which feels like every time I come in and that's a lot. 
Anyway the taco of the week is buffalo chicken and it's made to precision. Not too much Frank's red hot sauce, perfect breading, amazing chicken, what more can I ask for? 
Oh and don't forget they have my favorite cider- Crispin. 
Amanda keep up the awesome work your crew and you are the best 
Ps These bartenders know what they're doing.
author: Chauntae M.

description:
I'm a fan of the other Tacolicious locations, and generally think their food & drinks are OK. The service at the North Beach location is so bad it's mind-boggling. We have given this place so many chances, but the service stinks more and more each time. Here are some examples of what we've experienced at this location:

-Long wait times when the main dining area is sparsely seated and there are multiple servers/hostesses on the floor

-Apathetic/unfriendly hostesses and waiters

-Incorrect food & drink orders

-Ignored by waiters when we're ready to spend more money there, or close a tab

-No apologies when said service sucks

-The kitchen area is open to the dining area. We witnessed a male line cook on his phone showing his co-workers Instagram or Snap videos, without gloves (as a dude, I have a hunch that phone has made a trip or two to the can with him), then go back to prepping food

-On one visit, we asked three different employees very politely to please turn on the Warriors game, and then basically we were ignored (i.e. never got the game on and it was not busy. No one was watching anything else that would have taken precedence). PS...It's SF, you have three TV's in there. Make an effort to know when your local teams are playing. The fact that you have multiple TV's is your only advantage over Don Pisto's (another taco place around the corner that's great) especially when a local team is on.

This all being said, I'm lazy and live close by so I'll probably end up here again at some point. In closing, I hate you North Beach Tacolicious. 



-
author: Michael R.

description:
I feel bad only giving it 2 stars. Staff is nice place seems cool but was not impressed with the food or drinks. Chips were ok, Guacamole was not good. Taco was ok.
Margaritas.... I've had better.
I wouldn't go out of your way for this one.
author: Jacqueline M.

description: This location is not my favorite due to the decor and it always being busy (they all are). I'd suggestion mission or Palo Alto. The food isn't quite as good here, but it's still decent. There is normally a wait, but it moves quickly. Most of the bar is also "seating" and part of the reserved tables so there is less space for walk in eating.
author: Jonah K.

description:
Tacolicious is a great lunch spot for a fun group of friends. I haven't been to the other locations but the food here is fantastic! My favorite items on the menu: Aztec chicken soup, fried sweet plaintains, marina girl salad, the pacific cod taco, and the mole chicken taco. Their chips and salsa are terrific as well, and they'll keep them coming as long as you're asking for them. I also love their pitchers of margaritas (yes, sometimes we order them at lunch). 

My only grip with this place is the slow service and then loud music. I've tried coming in a few times for dinner, only to be bombarded by extremely loud techno music. I wouldn't even be able to hear myself think, never mind have a conservation with someone, in that environment. Things are lot more quiet and casual at lunch, which is my preferred dining atmosphere. Either way, the food is worth trying, but whether or not you come for lunch or dinner depends on what level of party mode you're looking for.
author: Regina L.

description:
The tacos at Tacolicious are certainly delicious, so the name is fitting. The place is cool -- dim, open and illuminated slightly by the open kitchen where you can watch the taco wizards performing their wizardry. Something I didn't know going in: Tacolicious is not for babies. Nope, it is not family-friendly. Now I know, and so do you. You see, the lights get dimmer and the music gets louder as the evening progresses, and Tacolicious becomes something of a clubby atmosphere. Tacos and cocktails in a nightclub? Awesome. Just don't bring the kids. 

I also had my first Spicy Beer here. I wanted a Michelada -- a real one with just beer, lime and salt -- but they didn't have that version, so I went for something different and ended up breathing fire for the rest of the night. The Spicy Beer is definitely spicy, so if you're not into the heat you may want to stick with their version of a Michelada (featuring assorted sauces) or just plain beer; they have plenty to choose from. 

The location is great, the seating is ample and the tacos are fabulous. My favorite? The braised beef short rib -- it's rich and flavorful and truly amazing. I also loved the chicken en mole and the shot-and-a-beer braised chicken. Three tacos was more than enough, by the way -- especially if you down a basket of their tortilla chips and awesome salsa. 

All in all, a great spot if you're looking for a fun adults-only night out.
author: Hilary H.

description:
I love that this location is less crowded and more spacious - even on a "date" night on Thursdays. It's a nice place to stop by on the way home for happy hour or catch up with friends. Since there's more empty space, I found it easier to actually hear my friend talking even though we were sitting across from each other. Sometimes the Marina Tacolicious is just unbearably loud and crowded because the bar is centered.

There's a deal to get 10 tacos for $33 that I highly recommend. You could probably split it between 3 people! Or maybe 2 if you're feeling ambitious. My favourite is the beef. I'd probably skip the chicken, but the carnitas is bueno too. There are usually 6-7 types of tacos you can choose from so it's a fun platter to get esp to split for a date!

The sauces are my favourite I've found in San Francisco. Not the spiciest, but definitely flavourful and reminds me most of San Diego salsa!

For a non-hole in the wall "Mexican" restaurant, Tacolicious is pretty damn good!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Can't figure out why, but the Tacolicious in the Mission is just consistently better than the North Beach location.  I order regularly for delivery (through trycaviar.com) and each time I break down and order from North Beach (which is WAY closer and costs me WAY LESS to have delivered) I'm disappointed - or worse.   Once, my fish taco was so deep fried I couldn't find the fish in there - (where's the fish??) and left my tummy really upset - activated charcoal time! - and once the fish taco - which I ordered GRILLED this time rather than deep fried - 'cause I'm no dummy! - comes with the fish uncooked all the way through - and their special pork belly taco was nothing by a lukewarm slice of FAT  - and it smelled a bit off.   Into the trash.  Kerplunk.   So, back to paying $5.99 for delivery from the Mission location - they just seem to know how to do it better out there (though they forget the guacamole a lot !!  Keep that in mind - )
author: Annie C.

description: My friend and I made plans to go here last weekend and when we went to the other location it was closed, so we called and it ended up that it had moved down the street. What was really cool though was the woman who I talked with told me the marina location had an hour wait. When we arrived at the north beach location we sat down immediately. Pretty dope that they have an operator that provides that info. AND the food was awesome. I had the chicken taco, the chorizo one, and the taco of the week which was a calamari one (highly recommend this & chorizo). Order the guac and honestly any of the margs. We had two pitchers (lol) and we got the grapefruit one and I can't remember the other... but super good (not that much alcohol tho FYI). Def will be coming back!
author: Noelle C.

description: Excellent service! Food was good. I really like the chips and salsa. We went there at 2pm on a Thursday so it was pretty quiet, service was quick and the waiter was very helpful!
author: Linh L.

description:
went for dinner last night this place was awesome. Staff is very attentive. you are provided with chips and salsa once you arrive. we ordered queso dip and guacamole which were both delicious. a little pricey but they give you a lot. my friend ordered carnitas taco which was very tasty and I ordered brisket. both tacos were very good. got full off the appetizers and one taco. fun place to hangout enjoyed music. wish we had one of these in my hometown 
will defiantly be returning.
author: Jennelle T.

description:
I stopped in to Tacolicious last Friday around 6:30 for a quick dinner with friends before heading to an 8:00 show at the nearby Beach Blanket Babylon. Granted, several of my friends showed up a few minutes late, but we ultimately put our food order in at about 10 minutes to 7. We ordered a plate of 10 tacos to share, which we thought would be easy enough. At around 7:20, we asked when we could expect the food to come out, as we had tickets to a show that started soon. It turned out that the kitchen actually never received our order, which was a bummer, as we had to end up taking our food to go (and then had to check the bag at BBB, so we didn't enjoy the tacos until a few hours later that night).

On the plus side, the food was comped, but it wasn't the great fun easy dinner we had expected. I'm also a big fan of the "Spicy Beer" - think Michelada with no tomato juice, but tbh, I would have been much happier having grabbed a (sober) slice at Golden Boy.
author: Laura H.

description: I am a big fan of Tacolicious, but for some reason the North Beach location is trying to be a club.  The music is so loud you can't have a conversation with friends, let alone hear your own thoughts.  Do your patrons a favor and turn the music DOWN!
author: Christy L.

description:
This place is BOMB. Delicious tacos and great variety. I liked the carnitas the best. We got rounds on rounds of salsa/chips and enjoyed the fried plantain and hamachi appetizers--both very delicious, although a little too small to share amongst 4 people.

The margarita fresca pitcher was good too, not too overpowering but with enough alcohol to know you weren't just paying for juice.

The ambiance is hip with very dim lighting--my friend had to use the iPhone flashlight to read the menu.

Only 4 stars because despite the quality, the tacos are definitely overpriced. Worth it for a ballin night out.
author: Taryn K.

description:
F-minus, zero stars. Came in tonight and sat at the bar alone for some of my favorite tacos,  I go to the Valencia location all the time so I knew what I was going to order before I came in. I sat at the bar and waited...and waited...and waited. The bartender was catching up with friends, telling co-workers about last night's party, making drinks. He was doing a lot, except serving his counter customers. He handed me a menu at the 22 minute mark, and left before I could tell him I was ready to order. Then I waited...and waited...and waited. I was able to order at the 35 minute mark. I ordered two tacos, a beer, and some salsa for the big bowl of chips they had dropped off. 

Tacos came quickly. The bartender dropped my beer off and left before I could ask for a lime. That's okay, I'll catch him when he comes back. Salsa had not made it to me yet (nor did it ever arrive). I finished my tacos and waited...and waited.

My tacos had been finished for a good 15 minutes, he finally came back and asked if I needed anything else. I told him what I would LIKE is a lime for my beer and the salsa from back when I ordered my food, but what I NEED is my check because it had been over an hour and 10 minutes and all I have to show for it is two tacos, and I had to go. Got my check, he said the beer was on him and apologized for how long things took (the kitchen was lightning fast, only he took long). In reality the beer was not on him because I was leaving, and did not end up having a beer, or water, or any beverage of any kind. Ironic because I was sitting at the bar!!

This location has a couple of solid servers, but the bar is always an awkward place to sit because it is always just the staff socializing in full earshot of the customers. Your not there to hang out, your there to work. 

The food is great though, that's the only thing the North Beach has in common with the other locations.
author: Jeff C.

description:
We came on a Saturday night and surprisingly there was no wait! The seating here is "modern", personally I don't think their stools are comfortable or the way their tables are so high. Anyway, to start off we ordered guac and we ordered I think 13 tacos. From reading reviews and hearing how sometimes you have to wait over an hour to eat here, I wasn't impressed. Don't get me wrong, it was good but it wasn't amazing where I have to come back. 
We also had desert, churros and I think the flan. The chocolate that the churros came with was disgusting, it totally ruined it. Being Hispanic maybe I'm being a little too harsh, but I did come with high expectations and left a bit disappointed.
author: Irma R.

description: I work near this location and probably order take out at least once a week. Food is always fresh, taco combinations are delicious, and the guacamole is da bomb!!!
author: Meg S.

description: Service was friendly but slow. Place was not all that busy and took about 10 minutes from the time we sat down to have our server show up and then about another 10 minutes to get drinks. Food was good but nothing to get overly excited about. All and all it was just ok.
author: Garrett W.

description:
I'll be honest: I come here for the queso alone! In my former life in Austin, Texas, queso could be found on almost any street corner. In San Francisco? Not so much. 

Besides the creamy, spicy, terrible-for-you-but-oozing-with-deliciousness queso, Tacolicious also does a bang up job with their guacamole and their carnitas tacos. The grilled Brentwood corn? It's just alright.

The cocktails are spendy for a casual eatery but admittedly good... and they may or may not go down a bit too easily.  Be sure to check their Facebook and Twitter on Thursdays for their featured taco of the week - I always make sure to order this taco because it's the best!
author: Jelena Z.

description:
Aw shiet, I think this is gonna be one of my new favorite spots!

Busy but no wait during Sunday brunchtime. EXTENSIVE drink menu and everything sounded delicious. I opted for the sangria roja (red wine + fruit + spicy apple salsa wuuut?) which was sweet and lightly spicy.

Free chips + salsa right when we sat down. Oh haaaaaaail yea. These are thicker corn chips which are my FAVORITE and they are fried in-house, even better! Thick corn chips FTW! This is going to be my new fav spot mainly because of the chips itself. Hahah.. Yummy salsa and chips which just kept coming even when we didn't ask. Woot. They have hella worker bees!!

The place may get loud but not annoying-ly so. Tall tables with tall chairs (as a short person, I love this!) Lots of menu items at decent prices. Salads for the health conscious as welll!

At first glance, $14 for 4 tacos was expensive.. (c'mon if you go to ACTUAL Mexican restaurants they're like $2 each). They really stack up the filling here though and it IS slightly fusion food. In the end it was pretty worth it since I got started getting full after 3 tacos (WELL, maybe it was because I gorged on the chips too, lol). We got 8 tacos (1 of each + the special).
My favorite was the rock cod and and chorizo with potatoes. The chicken one was a close third (super juicy + flavorful) and my LEAST favorite was by far, the short rib one (it was a bit dry and overcooked, didn't help that we ate that one last too..)
Overall, pretty awesome. They do layer on 2 tortillas per taco (PRO-TIP, remove the 2nd tortilla when you eat so it's less heavy!)

Def would return!
author: Emily C.

description: I want to like this place, but it's just not very good.  The tacos are bland, the drinks are meh, and the queso doesn't even excite.  On top of that it's about 50% more expensive than it should be.  I think it used to be good but it hasn't stood the test of time.
author: John S.

description:
I was really excited that a Tacolicious was opening up in North Beach. The one in the Marina is always good. 

We came in on a Thursday night and got seated right away which is good. It was very loud and the music was playing really loud so it was kind of hard to hear each other or talk. That wasn't really my problem.

EVERYTHING WAS SOOOOOOO SALTY. Like can't eat this salty. The guacamole, the fish tacos. Everything. The fish tacos were also so heavily battered there was barely any fish. The batter was also extremely salty. I tend to not really care about salt, I actually like salt, but this was just bad. 

There is definitely better Mexican food around this neighborhood and I was thoroughly disappointed with Tacolicious. 

Also, the service was just not great. The waitress never really checked on us, I had to ask for a new pitcher of water twice and when we sat down, no one came up to us for about 10 minutes. 

Overall just not a good experience and I will not be coming back.
author: Cara C.

description:
Good food!!!!  Great atmosphere!!  A friend who
lives in San Fran recommended it and it was awesome!!  The server recommended  some
tacos and they were fantastic!!!
author: Kelly D.

description: We love Tacolicious! This was recommended to us by a 'local' we spoke to on the airplane to San Fran! We went there on Taco Tuesday and the special was a nice amount to serve three of us (with the rice & beans side). We love this neighborhood too!
author: Sherri S.

description:
A fun and fancy taqueria! :D

With a full fancy bar, tacolicious turned a normal taqueria into a fun GNO spot! 
I came across Tacolicious during columbus day parade. I've seen pictures and check-ins on yelp and facebook for quite some time now and I finally decided to check this place out!

We ordered: (party of 2)
*grilled squid veracruz $9.95 - almost like the Italian squid in marinara sauce. grilled squid in a bed of tomato-caper sauce, garbanzo beans and jalapeno. It's very tasty.
*Ceviche de verano $11.95 - there's lots of cucumbers, cubes of avocados and fish. I wish it has some shrimps though but it's very refreshing!
4 tacos for 14 dollars:
*Carne asada taco - a little bit dry not my fav
*slow cooked short ribs taco - tender and juicy with a decent amount of short ribs in the taco, mouth full. 
*fried calamari taco - it's a bit dry for my taste, but it's really good if you put a lot of salsa with it.
*fried cod taco - my fav, huge piece of cod, it's flakey and flavorful with the right amount of batter and slaw on top.

House Salsa - absolutely yummy! I also like the medium spicy salsa they give you with the tacos, super smokey with the right amount of heat. 
Decor - modern and simple, I like it! 
Enjoy your meal with a delicious margarita or cold beer, how much better does it get?!
Arrrrrrrrriba Arrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrriba!
author: Mindy C.

description: Service here was absolutely horrendous. 4 of us ordered 3 orders of 4 tacos, but ended up with 3 single tacos. We tried to straighten it out, ended up with one more taco, and only after we asked the waiter again did we received our other two other  orders of 4 tacos. Our drink orders and simple water orders also took forever. The worst part, was that after all of the missteps we were not only not offered any comped items, but they tried to charge us for another order of tacos! When we told the waiter this he wasn't even apologetic. Food wasn't bad but the awful service is something I would not like to experience again.
author: Shabnam E.

description: FANTASTIC PLACE! Chealsea's Service is Top 10, Vibe is Excellent, and the Food is Awesome! My wife and I where just walking around choosing the Best Place to Go To, and we fell in there, and we didn't try to get out! Definitely Try This Place!
author: Bernie L.

description:
When in for lunch here yesterday. Bartender puts his pen in his "man-bun". Absolutely disgusting. 

Chips were good. Salsa is weirdly sweet. Tacos were greasy. Ordered a chicken taco and cheesesteak taco. They brought me a braised beef taco and and a carnitas taco. They did give me a free cheesesteak taco. So that was cool.
author: Cliff H.

description:
We got 3 different tacos : chicken, beef and fish. It was yummy a bit spicy but enough to be flavory.  The fish one had a lack of sauce, it was a bit dry and the sauce was too bitter.
The service was friendly and fast.
author: Cristelle M.

description:
Tacolishes is always a great go to place. Delicious food. The service at this location is awesome. A great decision for big or small groups. Last night, Thursday, I went with about 8 friends with no reservation. We put our name down then headed to the bar, watched the warrior game and drank pitchers of delicious grape fruit and pomegranate margs! It took about an hour to get seated, and it flew by!

Enjoy
author: Maxine S.

description:
7/17/13 Dinner

Came here to check out the newest Tacolicious in town. Everything---from decor, vibe, flatware, napkins, plates are the same as the other locations except, to my utter delight, they don't blast the music here like they do on Valencia. The clientele is also different, a mix of tourists, older locals, and less of the hipster scene.

Tacolicious doesn't dish out authentic tacos although they are tasty. We pretty much get the same thing to see if they are consistent with quality. They don't disappoint!

*Grilled rock cod tacos: always love the tangy spicy sauce. But for the first time we're offered the "grilled" option, which was not available previous on Valencia or Chestnut. Fish was very fresh.

*Shot-of-beer Chicken taco: I think this is their signature item. It actually tastes a bit like the chicken taco at Lolo. I always get this when I'm here. 

*Guajillo-braised beef short rib tacos: very strong favored, but tender short ribs in tacos. Perfect with the yellow hot sauce. This has been a hit-or-miss at the other locations but the new location seems to have got this right. Not overly salty and no spices caked on the meat.

Overall this is a nice alternative in North Beach if you're not into pretentious, touristy Italian and mediocre Chinese food. The Sangria Roja was also good. Our server Emma was friendly and attentive.
author: Matt Y.

description:
Food is always delicious, but the service is always outstanding at this restaurant. The manager named Matt is great and has a fantastic attitude. I had a work emergency that required me to sign a document. Matt asked me to email him the piece of paper and he printed it out for me. 

5 stars out of 5 stars.
author: Alexander D.

description:
HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE.

As a fan of the Tacolicious in the Mission and having also used the Tacolicious in Palo Alto for corporate catering, the Tacolicious in North Beach is an extreme disappointment! I would tell everyone to AVOID this location.

1) THE FOOD IS HORRIBLE
- So, so, so SUPER salty! It was as though I was sucking on a salt shaker! 
- DRY, DRY, HELLA MUTHA EFFIN' DRY! How old is the meat in these tacos? The short ribs were simply dry chunks of yuck. The duck was made up of hard strings of meat chips! WHAAAATHEFUDGEEEEE?!

2) ZERO, NON-EXISTANT, BEYOND HORRIBLE SERVICE
- Our waitress, a younger blond woman, was totally oblivious to customers. She was going to look for an extra chair. Never looked for one. Never mentioned it. One person in our party ended up leaving.
- Sat there for a good 10-15 minutes without any acknowledgement after being seated. I had to ask several times if I could give her my order! WHAT THE HELL?!!!
- Asked for water, 20 minutes later, had to ask again...and again. WTF?! The food was so incredibly salty, I probably needed buckets of water!
- I was given a MAC lipliner (by a woman who wasn't my server) to sign off on my credit card receipt! This was actually pretty funny and the highlight of my experience here.
- I don't know how busy they were inside, but the quality of the service outside sucked beyond words. If they were understaffed, then they have management issues which still deserve a sh:tty review. No matter what, they are deserving of a negative review. 
- I will say that there were a couple of guys towards the end, who stepped in to help some of the customers, and they were far more efficient than the ladies that work there--THE LONE STAR IS FOR THEM.

3) THEY WILL OVERCHARGE YOU
- I was with my 90 year old grandmother. I asked if they could make a Virgin drink, basically, soda water but with the fruit juice and fruit added to it...they charged it as a full cocktail--$15!!! ALCOHOL is what drives drink prices to what they are. To charge $15 for soda water with some pomegranate seeds thrown in is so F-CKING RIDICULOUS! WHAT THE F-CK B1TCHES?!!! THEY CAN HAVE THAT $15, BUT THEY ARE NEVER GETTING ANOTHER PENNY FROM ME NOR ANYONE WHO WILL HEED MY ADVICE TO AVOID THIS LOCATION!

Despite their sh:tty @ss service, I still tipped my personal minimum of 15%, because that's how I roll as someone who worked as a food/beverage server in my teens and early 20's, but I totally cringed at writing that tip in. They are very lucky for Yelp, because I was able to hold my temper and tip them, with the satisfaction of knowing I would leave them a negative Yelp review later.

I HATE THIS RESTAURANT. THE PLACE SUCKS FAR WORSE THAN ANY PLACE I HAVE BEEN TO IN THE PAST 10 YEARS! I WOULD GIVE THEM NEGATIVE 10 STARS IF I COULD!!! 

I AM STILL SEETHING OVER MY EXPERIENCE AT THIS SH;THOLE OF A TACOLICIOUS! I NEED A FKN SPA DAY!
author: Ladi Da A.

description:
-Empenadas? Yes. Potato and queso.
-Nopales? Yes. On tacos with tons of queso.
-Plantains? Yes. My fave.
-Chips? Yes. With mild, medium and hot salsa on the side.
-Dark and moody? Yes. Just the way I like it.
And your name is TACOLICIOUS!?! How can I stay away?
Yep. Count me in.
Tip - Gang up and order your tacos in bunches of 4 or 10 to save a few bucks.
author: Kristina K.

description: My friends recommended this place and not to be horrible but it was a huge disappointment. If you love tacos and tequila then this is not your place. The guacamole was tasteless. In fact we tried a few items to give them the benefit of the doubt and nothing changed.
author: Ani T.

description:
DISCLAIMER : this review is only about the Tacolicious in North Beach. The ones in the Marina and the Mission are actually great places to go.  Both of which I have been to many times and always enjoyed myself.

When I moved from the Marina to North Beach I was actually a little excited that another branch of one of my favorite watering holes was right down the street.

I have honestly been to the T-lish in North Beach 10 times and they have always found a way to screw something up.  Whether it be the wrong tacos, wrong drink, rude service etc... Today's visit solidified that I will never come back here again. I would rather take the $5 Uber to the Marina.

Having worked in the industry I have an excessive tolerance for service so I usually give places the benefit of the doubt but today it was just too much. I showed up around 7 and put my food order in. The bar was moderately crowded. After watching 3 people come in and place to-go orders, get there food and leave I asked the bartender if something went wrong with my order. 40 minutes had passed so I gave them the benefit of the doubt. 

Turns out my they put my order in to go and have my food away. An honest mistake but they had known for 15 minutes and never told me. That is just inexcusable.

Suggestion to ownership... Bring in a manager from the Marina or the Mission that can get this places shit together.
author: Cortlin H.

description:
Waiters are very friendly. Food comes out really fast. No line  for 7pm on a Saturday evening. It's quite busy in here. Loud atmosphere. 

The food? Pretty average and a bit overpriced. $18 for 4 tacos? It would be worth it if the tacos are full of deliciousness, as the name suggests. The tacos are fully loaded with meat. It's not too flavorful. It's just a heavy dose of meat. You can def get better Mexican food in the Mission. 

The salsa is delicious!
author: Sa M.

description: Despite our initial reaction of "Another White Mexican Restaurant" we were honestly blown away by the taste, creativity and service.  Now anyone who's feasted on late night dollar tacos on the streets of Puerto Vallarta will find themselves sticker shocked at the thought of a 5 dollar taco but as an aficionado of the former these tacos are the mercedes benz of meat topped tortillas. The taco of the week and the flank steak at even a dollar more were worth every penny.  We started with an order of chicharrones de pollo (fried chicken skins - what's not to like?) absolutely yummy.  2 bowls of homemade guacamole, each one better than the next. The drinks were inventive, tasty and out of this world.  Top this off with never ending tortilla chips and an array of different salsas, delivered table side by an attentive staff and you have the recipe for a great night out.
author: bruce z.

description:
Good casual place for tacos; casual ambience, fairly quick service, but prices are a little higher than expected here. 
The standout here for me is the churros. 
Yes, the churros. They were so good that we actually had 2 orders coz one was simply not enough. 
Everything else was expected but nothing else really stood out
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Twice in one month and both times Tacolicious did not disappoint.  I am such a fan, new favorite taco place, my only problem is that they are a Bart ride over the bay away.  They took street tacos and kicked it up several notches.  I've tried the short rib twice, the grilled fish, chorizo and pork and although I repeated the short rib I haven't kicked any of them to the curb but will be going back to not only try  new one's but repeat others to determine what are my favorites.  Keep cooking great food in a lively atmosphere and come to San Ramon city center in 2017.  We would love to have you in our neighborhood.
author: Dianne M.

description: Not my favorite taco place, especially considering how many other amazing taco options there are in the city. While the flavors are good, it's more on the expensive side. Good for a nicer date maybe, but not if you just want some quick and good food.
author: Michelle L.

description: Came here for late lunch with two others. We were greeted by a really friendly hostess as well as the owner. Great service! The food was delish. I loved the kale salad, the guac, and tacos. Good position sizes. Tip: free corkage!!
author: Christine L.

description:
The ambiance here is super fun and hip. I love the reclaimed wood behind the bar and the cool tile floor. It can be a bit loud when it's full, but that adds to the liveliness. 

The tacos are a bit pricey, but that's because they're more than your typical carne asada: there's pork belly, brisket, filet mignon, seasonal fish, vegetarian options, etc. 

They have a fun beer + shot of tequila special sometimes that's cheap and fun. 

Clean restrooms, decent service. I'd recommend it to a friend for sure.

Note: If you're looking for an authentic taqueria, this is not the place. This is a fun, hip, trendy restaurant that serves delicious tacos at San Francisco prices. For hole-in-the-wall authentic Mexican food, head to the Mission.
author: Lisa F.

description:
I'm not a huge Mexican food person, but thought I'd come with a couple friends and give this place a try becuase there wasn't a wait here on NYE. We ordered the 4 tacos to share, a pitcher of magherita, guac, and some other appetizers. 

The tacos were pretty good! They double up on the tortillas, so we split the tacos easily in half and shared amongst the three of us. Their drinks are tasty too, and service is quick. They have a great drinks menu, and delicous chips/salsa/guac!
author: Jeanette S.

description:
Love the other two SF locations. This one has excellent food - the carnitas is one of their best (among the three locations) - but the ambiance is a bit lacking. It is like they had an odd-shaped space to work with and did the best they could. Still, the food is top notch. The chorizo tacos are very good. The michelada is perfect. Margaritas are good as well.
Try the non-alcoholic fruit drinks...especially if you are 9 years old.
author: Jubilee D.

description: Great little Mexican place! We have always been to the one in N Beach when we visit and love that part of town. Service was fast and the food and margaritas were great! What more could you ask?? Oh and get the guacamole, it's awesome!
author: Erin Y.

description:
Tacolicious is good. Not great but good. I've had better tacos and I'll continue to have better tacos at other restaurants. I did enjoy the chips and salsa, and that our waitress was on top of refilling our chips as much as possible. I always like to try the vegetarian options when I go to a restaurant. It's not that I'm a vegetarian or anything but I think any restaurant that can create a mouth watering vegetarian option is worth going to. Each and every time I go to tacolicious I'm pleasantly surprised by the vegetarian options available. They're far from boring letting me know that tacolicious can make even the poor sad meatless meals fun and delicious. 

Despite the delicious vegetarian options and rotating menu I never really crave tacolicious. I feel like it's a if I'm in the neighborhood and really need some chips and salsa joint. However, it's not terrible it really is good. But I have yet to have a taco there thats made me sit up at night and crave it. I want to love it, but tacolicious where's the excitement? I like you, but I don't love you.
author: Sarah M.

description:
I frequent the Mission location of Tacolicious, but as a family we decided to try out the North Beach location on New Year's Eve.  The quality of service and food at this location was quite low compared to the one in the Mission.  

We were seated right away, and given chips, but it took about 25 minutes before our drink orders were taken. Two servers came by and said they would "be right with you."

The waitress on the floor then went out to the curb to talk to a couple of friends for a while, then came back and took the order of the table who came in after us.  Then went away again, then came back and apologized because "only person on the floor." 

The agua fresca we ordered for our two young daughters was supposed to be pineapple citrus, but was really a quite sour limeade. Maybe they forgot the pineapple juice?  In any case, it made the adults' lips pucker.

The Nopales and Oaxaca cheese taco had no cheese, and the tortillas on all of our tacos were dried out and somewhat brittle.  

We'll be sticking with the Mission outpost from now on.
author: Bea A.

description: We LOVE this restaurant. Always a great experience when we go. We have been here several times and the food, drinks and service  are always outstanding. Went last night for a few drinks with my boyfriend. Walked in and the bar was slammed. However, immediately Jay the bartender greeted us, attended to us, and provided us with menus. We had the passion fruit margarita, as well as the margarita with coconut water..both very good and fresh ! Jay frequently checked in on us and made sure we were happy with our drinks. Overall, a great experience! Any time we are in SF we always stop by :). Walnut creek needs one !
author: Liz B.

description: Suuuupperrr overpriced. The food wasn't "bad" but it wasn't great. Definitely not worth the absurd prices. Salty tacos, watered down margaritas. $100 for two people and we only got tacos no appetizers. Two stars is probably generous. Would not recommend.
author: Hoki J.

description:
I came here for dinner and drinks on New Years Eve with my boyfriend. Luckily for us, we beat the crowd and got seated right away! We were about to order 5 tacos each, but our waitress was super nice and warned us that the tacos are pretty big. We ended up only getting 5 tacos total. My favorite is the braised beef short rib taco. It was overflowing with juicy goodness!! The drinks were also delicious! I love tequila, so might be bias about the drinks since we got 4 drinks which all were tequila based. The Nopal was my favorite. 
 
There's also a bar there, so you can order drinks while you wait for your table.
author: Lina C.

description:
The food was pretty good but the service was lackluster. It took a long time for our waitress to take our order. She apologized for the wait, which was considerate, but it even took a long time for us to get a carafe of water. The restaurant seemed to be understaffed for an afternoon lunch rush.

The tacos were decent but nothing that blew me away. I thought it was kind of pricey for the portion size but maybe its because of the quality of the ingredients.

There are a lot of good places to eat in North Beach so if you aren't craving tacos, I would suggest going somewhere else.
author: Bridget G.

description: I love Tacolicious, I've been there a lot and also to the Marina location. Their tacos are delicious and fresh. I recommend the carnitas and chicken en mole!
author: Delphine L.

description: Small portions. Ordered the kale salad, which was ok. The taco sampler was good but very small. Not too busy during lunch, which was good for us. Don't think I would come back. Nothing spectacular about this place.
author: Rosanna T.

description: Food was BEYOND amazing ! Service was great as well don't know what else to say other than that lol that's how much I LOVED IT
author: Mona A.

description:
Great tacos amazing environment! We waited for our table on a wed night at 9pm california time! Thats how u know this stuff is GOOD!!! Mmm 
8 Carnitas, braised beef, fried cod tacos and 2 empanadas later we practically rolled out of the restaurant completely full and satisfied. Id go there again any time of the day (or night)!  Beware, all spicy food lovers, the braised beef taco was proclaimed extremely hot but isnt at all - just slightly oily ;) so put on the extra hot sauce go ahead!
author: Galina M.

description: It's as the name says.  Tacolicious! Great tequila and booze selection to boot.
author: John B.

description: Food was good. Service was ok. Had to ask everytime we needed something...drinks, food, Bill.  Honestly wouldn't come back.
author: Michael H.

description:
Excellent addition to the neighborhood and a fine substitute for Don Pistos when you aren't willing to wait in line for that around the corner. It's an upscale, hip, but casual place to get tacos and drinks basically.

The 4 taco combo is quite filling, especially if you load up on the free chips and salsa. I recommend the carnitas tacos and the chicken tacos. The short rib tacos are pretty rich and heavy while the fish taco is deep fried and way heavier than I imagined it would be. The agua fresca is quite refreshing too.

Service is a bit hit or miss here. They are friendly but they were mixing up people's orders (which table food goes to) and forgetting to bring a few things. Clearly, there's still some service hiccups but I'd probably give it another shot.
author: Victor W.

description: my favorite taco place in SF! I get it delivered through the app Caviar almost every weekend. LOVE IT!
author: Kelsey K.

description: I absolutely love the location in the Mission so while on a business trip I opted to try another one of their locations.  The service level was terrible at the north beach location they just don't seem to have it down like they do in the Mission.  That being said if you want the same great food without the really long wait for a table you'll get it here although with the terrible service level you may just be better of wattling it out in the Mission.  I hate to do it but I have to go with only two stars for this location and recommend that they pull it together like they have in the Mission.
author: Christine S.

description: Amazing tacos! Definitely try this place for great tacos in San Francisco. I always get the carnitas street tacos but my wife loves the chicken. Definitely give this place a try, you wont regret it.
author: Cliff S.

description: Allie at tacolicious hooked it up. She made sure me and my party had a great time. Would suggest this place to anyone visiting Berkeley or the city any night. Make sure you ask for Allie!
author: Allison M.

description:
This place is good. 
This place is alright. 
Though I wouldn't say it's out of sight. 

Yet I return. 
For guacamole. 
And tacos. 
And mescal. 
And cute girls. 

It's really a good formula.
author: Jason B.

description: We came as a big group on a Saturday and while I was initially unimpressed by the wait (longer than they initially said and seated someone else before us) the food was great and service pretty good. Solid guac, good margaritas and great salads. Most tacos pretty good and gluten free as well as veg options for people that need. I'd definitely recommend it here, and ambience is better at this location relative to other ones
author: Allie M.

description: I SAW 2 HUGE RATS AS I WAS PASSING BY IN THE RESTAURANt . It was disgusting , u can't believe they are still open. I haven't tried this place. & now, I'm definitely not going to try it out a I your me soon
author: Luis C.

description:
Great food, super quick service, and a really nice environment. 

Stated with the chips and salsa. Bf loved the chips, I loved the homemade salsa. 

Tacos were on point. Best ones were definitely the carnitas and the braised short rib. Chicken wasn't bad. 

A little pricey for tj style tacos, and the music was a tad loud, but at least it was good music, so I can't complain too much. 

Overall, it was a good experience and I would definitely come back.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Lots of hate for this place, and I don't know why.  It is actually fantastic.

All of the tacos here are great, particularly the fish tacos for me.  Everything is pretty light, with fluffy tortillas, and the margaritas are tasty!  The only taco I would advise against here is the cactus, which I think is too deep fried and killed the cactus taste.  But almost all of the meat tacos here are great, especially the fish and stewed beef.

The service here can be a miss however, as the cleanup crew can sometimes be a bit rude if you trying to get in and squeeze into space before the table is ready.  Understandable to some extent...

Good scene too!
author: Mark M.

description: Came here only after seeing the line at the famous pizzeria next door  .. On to the food, tacos were excellent ! Drinks , spectacular ! Plenty of tv's around to catch the game. Nice clean decor. Thumbs up
author: Louie C.

description: Pricey for what you're getting. Quite loud and for unexplainable reason the overhead light got dimmed (a lot) during our dinner. Tortillas had an odd taste to them, but what was inside them was good. They did get my order wrong, but 3 out of 4 tacos correct was no reason to send it back.
author: Heidi W.

description:
I live in North Beach, so we come here frequently to dine-in and grab take-out. 

Hands down my favorite salsa! LOVE the guac. Tacos are very good and I like the rotating "taco of the week." The kale salad and albacore tuna tostadas are my favorite items on the menu. The margaritas and tequilla cocktails are good. And huevos rancheros at brunch is delicious.

I like the open feel of the place, and that they have outside seating, especially nice for getting some sun at brunch. Though when they're at full capacity inside, be prepared to bring your shouting voice if you want to converse at your table; the acoustics are terrible.

The only reason I can't give them 5 stars is the service. It's really mixed. We've had friendly bartenders and we've had sullen bartenders that try very hard to ignore us. We've had friendly hosts and hostesses, and some that seemed annoyed. Nice waitstaff and sour waitstaff. It's really hit and miss and can tarnish the experience, especially when bringing out-of-town friends here.
author: Sonya Y.

description:
Braised short rib tacos are amazing. 

Atmosphere isn't quite what you expect but it is very informal. Staff are knowledgeable on the menu front and like to guide.
author: Gareth B.

description:
LORD HAVE MERCY. I love this place.  I am addicted to their mint lemonade drink called Silas.  I don't get why more places in SF dont sell this.  I've legit made people leave a venue across town early with me so I can get here before this place closes and get the silas bc it was all I wanted in life at that moment. 

Anywho, the tacos are amazing, kinda fancy and not your run down taqueria.  I truly recommend the grilled fish taco bc HOT DAMN SAM, that shit is on point.  The filet mignon is alright and I would skip the fried fish taco entirely bc their batter ain't the best in town for that (you'd have to head to el metate in the mission for this..trust me I'm a taconnoisseur)
author: Mia F.

description: Ritzy-ish taco bar. Strong margaritas, artisan tacos, decent staff, fantastic location and vibe. Higher caliber establishment which reflects in price but worth it to be in the environment.
author: Daniel D.

description: Good tacos, great sangria. HORRIBLE SERVICE. This is the third time Ive been here and clearly not busy. Takes the staff at least 30mins acknowledge you to sit down.
author: Michelle Q.

description: Great tacos, easier to get into than other locations!
author: Baygirl R.

description: Just left tacolicious for dinner celebrating my 2 month anniversary and it was amazing! We had the house margs, quac and queso to start. I had the Kale salad and my bf ordered the chicken mole tacos and they couldn't have been better. To top it all off we had Elaina as our sever and she made the dining experience one of a kind with her A++ service. Definitely going back soon and hope we get the pleasure of dining with Elaina again!
author: Camille J.

description:
Don't come here if you're looking for a hole-in-the-wall taco experience for $5. There are plenty worthy places for that in the Mission.

Reasons to like:

- Menu is broad (not just tacos) and ingredients are fresh. I highly recommend the squid appetizer and the kale salad. The spice options (hot, mild, chipotle only) are well done. The tacos are tasty and fill you up more than you'd think from the size.

- Cocktails are great- the piccante margarita is a love it or hate it drink (try it).

Issues:

- If you're on the high stools, the seating isn't that comfortable.

- It can get very, very noisy in here. More of a party atmosphere than a date-destination. And yes, the crowd can get a bit douchy (it's better than the Marina location).

To my mind the main question is whether you feel you're getting bang for your buck here. Personally I'm in the 'yes' camp - it's good quality food, fairly priced - but if Mexican food is anchored for you at the stuff-your-face for $10 price point I honestly think you should go elsewhere, and avoid inevitable disappointment.
author: Matt G.

description:
Don't Yelp too often anymore, but just had a fantastic experience for me and 3 other friends here. I've gone to the Tacolicious once or twice in Marina but this was my first time at the NB location.

Food was spot on - we followed our server's (Joy or Joey I think!) recommendations and everything was delicious. Service was excellent - not overbearing and always available when needed.

I might be converted to this location from now on!
author: Jason L.

description:
First time I went food was great service was good. Typical north beach yuppy crowd...blah.
Went again last night. Food was still pretty good. Service however sucked. Waitress couldn't be bothered. After taking the drink order she never returned, finally after flagging her down we ordered and she didn't get the order right. At some point another waitress came over and took over. 
The most disturbing part of the evening was seeing a bus boy drop a dish on floor then pick it up and use it for sauce! 
You go to a restaurant for food and return for service. I won't be back.
author: robbie l.

description:
This place is amazing. Best Guac I've had in the US, solid cocktail list, great tacos, love the salsa as well.

My only complaint is the acoustics in the NB location extremely loud inside. To the point where you can't hear the person sitting right across from you. This could be good if you hate the person you're dining with but outside of that circumstance it is less than ideal.

Either way I'll always come back to Tacolicious. I'm addicted.
author: Michelle A.

description:
For all they hype I've heard about this place, I just wasn't really that impressed. To be clear, nothing was amazingly bad; but, the overwhelming mediocrity of the place combined with slightly overpriced offerings will most likely send me straight to the Mission instead of Tacolicious when I'm looking for taco satisfaction.

Two of my friends and I sauntered in (yes sauntered) on a Saturday afternoon and it was completely empty, which I thought was amazing.  However, I've heard the place gets super packed for happy hour/night time drinking and it's clear by the set up this is what they're catering for (high tables with stools, lots of standing space). 

Service was....odd. Everyone was friendly and our waitress helped suggest menu items and got us more chips/limes/etc without complaint, but they were so fast to clear our table and provide the check that it felt like they were rushing us. Clearly, since there were only two other parties in the restaurant, they were most likely not trying to get rid of us. I can't tell if they were just super bored or if they normally are trying to provide fast turnover during high traffic times. They also are very stingy with portions of free stuff (they gave us two lime wedges for ten tacos and roughly a Tablespoon of each salsa for 3 people). Admittedly, the waitress had no problem getting more for us and this way we didn't waste food, but I would have liked to not have to ask for extras of everything and feel even more annoying than I already am.

And for the most important thing, the food: Meh, with a capital M.

We tried amongst the 3 of us: fish taco, chorizo taco, short rib taco, carnitas taco, cactus taco, and guacamole.

The fish and the short rib were by far the best tacos and the only ones we would actually reorder. They were very filling, good quality of meat, and had a huge portion of protein for a street taco, but they still were a little bland. I slathered them with our guacamole, the lime and their salsas and they were still missing some spice. I think if their salsas were better, it would be more enjoyable, but the tablespoon of spicy habanero salsa they provided for the three of us tasted like nothing. The chorizo and carnitas and guacamole were just alright, but nothing special. (and the guacamole was $9 for maybe a cup of dip :/ ). The cactus taco was downright bad, and I highly suggest not ordering it. At the end of the meal, we paid $19 each for three tacos and some guacamole. Not sure if that was worth the price.

In conclusion, I think you're supposed to come here for the drinks and then after a few you'll be less finicky about the value/quality of the food.
author: Christina R.

description: The brisket tacos are amazing. Interesting flavors. The salsa is sweet and the tortilla flavor unique.
author: The D.

description: Love this place. Come here as often as I can. Carnitas are my favorite, but the roommate will never order me my own so I just end up begging at the side of the table.  The sever always brings me a water bowl outside which is appreciated. Oh and the drinks must be on point, my roommate is quite the lush and we always end up having to cab it back home since I don't have thumbs to drive the car back myself.
author: Graham J.

description:
they seated & served us very quickly -which I loved! 

however, I wasn't the biggest fan of the tacos that I got. the tortillas didn't seem cooked enough to me, but maybe that's just how they make them.

the chips & salsa are great, I really liked how the salsa had a sweet zingy taste to it :)
author: Brooke W.

description:
I work next door to this location, it is a great and convenient spot for happy hour food/drinks. They have a small happy hour menu but with a wide variety of selection at awesome super cheap prices. 

My co worker and I came at 5pm when there was no one there. When we left around 6 the place was packed!! 

We ordered the nachos, which were a 8 out of 10 on the nacho scale. The service was fine, nothing spectacular. The crowd was casually dressed, informal groups


The only real complaint I can have is that the lights were too dim. I usually love that ambiance but this was to the point where I could not see anything. Other than that I love the decor and feel of this place. 


I would definitely come here again and recommend it to my friends for quick, inexpensive and tasty mexican fare.
author: Zahra K.

description: This place was a pretty big disappointment. I read the reviews and was so excited to try it. The service was bad but we were expecting that from the reviews. We ordered the charged squid appetizer and 4 tacos. The squid was terrible and undercooked. It was so bad that we actually could not eat it and sent it back. The four tacos we ordered were the short rib, chicken, deep fried cod, and carnitas. The carnitas was the only decent one and still had a few flavor issues. The only perk was that it was a super cool atmosphere and probably cool for drinks.
author: Samanyha O.

description:
Remember during the late 90's mid 2000's where it was cool to add -licious to every single thing? It was annoying as eff but we'll let this one slide this time.

The menu consists of simple Americanized Mexican food with a culinary twist. They have some weekly tacos, which I always add to my order. The tacos are quite cheap but they get pricey fast when you add chips and guacamole and some margaritas.  Its an easy $50 plus bill with me and a friend or two.

Even though I think the guacamole is over priced, it is really good. The fish tacos are amazing and also their taco of the week and I say that in faith. 

My friends like to order several tacos and then cut them in half. Why? Cause they are weird and like to share their food. Or keep their figures. Or it could be that they want to make room for margaritas. Who knows.

The house margarita is hands down the best. They do have other fun inventive flavored ones but why go against the best?

You don't really go there too much for the ambiance. If you go to the one in North Beach, you can people watch if that is your thing. The one at Chestnut is uber tiny and does have a small section for outdoor seating. You also get to see what the cooks and bartenders are doing behind the counter and ensure they are not doing anything weird to your order. At Valencia, they do have outdoor seating, its not to the street but looking at other tables to see what they've ordered. Plus, the place is dimly lit there that you may go home with people you didn't come in with.

The most horrible thing about it is that they don't have locations outside of SF.. cause guess what I want when I'm not in the city.. Taco-damn-licous.
author: Samantha E.

description: I love Tacolicious on valencia, great service, awesome food tasty tequila and 5 star bartenders. This is not that place. Was there on a Saturday afternoon, the waitress was fine, but food took quite a while, and didn't have those three salsa dish thing that I love about the other locations.  They did charge my phone,  but when I went in to get it I asked if they had chicken grease tequila, aka Pechuga. The manager with a broken arm started yelling at me to get out of his bar, and was really rude. I think they deal with a lot of tourists or something here, but I felt this guy is a class A jere and shouldn't work in food service at all.
author: JJ L.

description:
I brought my three visiting cousins to Tacolicious on Saturday night. We were told it would be an hour wait but were seated in about 25 minutes - woo hoo!

We ordered a big platter of tacos, wanting to sample the various types. They were delicious for the most part, especially the rock cod and shrimp. (I didn't love the chicken taco on special - too spicy!) 

Regarding service, the host was awesome and made sure we were taken care of. Table service was fine. While we were waiting for a drink the bartender took my order but never delivered the drink. After about 15 minutes I found it sitting on the far end at the wait station and paid a different bartender for it... that was weird. Bar service was slow throughout our meal.

The restaurant is loud so I wouldn't anticipate any deep conversation but it's a quick, affordable (for SF standards!), fun spot serving great tacos.
author: Jenny V.

description:
I really like this place for their tacos! They do it well and you can definitely taste that the ingredients are super fresh. We opted for 4 tacos for $14: two rock cods, braised short rib and the chipotle shrimp. Rock cod was good. The batter wasn't as crispy as I've had at other restaurants, but maybe I should have eaten this one first? So I'll blame that on my lack of judgement. The braised short rib was very tender and flavorful! And they piled that beef on. No shortage there!

I'm a HUGE fan of chips and salsa and their salsa is awesome! They add mint (!) to their salsa, which gives it a nice refreshing kick. Never had that before so it was a great surprise. Definitely loved that taste. Kudos Tacolicious.

Margaritas here are good too, but not as strong. I had the Fillmore Paloma: azul silver, fresh grapefruit, elder flower. Great balance of sweet and salty and bitterness.

The only gripe was that service can be slow. It did take us a while to get our drinks and the guys at the table seated down after us got their drinks before ours even though we ordered first. Not usually a big deal to me, but worth noting. Although our first waitress neglected us, at least two other servers did stop by to check in on us.

All in all, a good alternative to the North Beach area for late night  munchies.
author: Ling H.

description: Hands down, the filet mignon tacos were amazing!!!! Must try them! They are very filling:) I ordered 4 and only finished 3! And the margarita with pomegranate was awesome as well!!
author: Kay M.

description: It would have been considerate to have  mentioned that they use flour tortillas for some reason. It might have prevented an hour of severe discomfort at 5AM.
author: jo a.

description:
I have been staring at my computer monitor for the last 20 minutes trying to best way to fully encapsulate the awesomeness of this fine establishment. Here goes nothing:

LOCATION: Right in the heart of North Beach (pro and con). It is within one block of the 45, 41, 8X, and 30 bus lines. NOT good for driving/parking (it's non-existent). If you do not take public transportation, Lyft/Uber/Sidecar/Flywheel/Taxi is HIGHLY recommended

AMBIANCE: It's a small dining area and bar, which can get crowded quite quickly, especially during happy hour and weekends (not atypical of ANY North Beach establishment). The noise level can get quite loud, but would not attribute it to the music. People start drinking and start yelling and the tile floors do not help. 

SERVICE/STAFF: Generally, everyone is really great. If it's busy, you can tell they are hustling and trying to accommodate everyone. I'm a realist and don't need them to wait on me hand and foot, although I do get antsy when my chip bowl gets empty ;-) I have been fortunate enough to hit the restaurant at the right times - have not had to wait more than a couple minutes for a place to sit.

DRINKS: Mmmm, the Sangria and Margaritas are delicious! It's on my list to try the Chupitos next!

FOOD: The go-to for me and my boyfriend is 4 tacos (for $14, $2 off v. single tacos) and Chile Con Queso (TO DIE FOR). All the taco varieties are heavenly, but my party and I generally stick to carnitas and shrimp. If we're in the drinking mood, we'll go for the Prix Fixe which is: one taco, one generous shot of tequila, and one can of Tecate ($15 value)

TO-GO: I have periodically ordered to-go and service is incredibly fast. I was recently made aware they accept online to-go orders, which is fantastic. Have not utilized this service yet.

OVERALL: Just ... amazing. Food is addicting, service is good, ambiance is typical for North Beach.  Wish they were open later!
author: Alicia M.

description: Awesome food. Well put together tacos with fresh ingredients. Came here for a late night bite and it was perfect to get a little nibble in without feeling fat afterword. I will say that the short rib taco was delicious but was sitting in some grease.
author: Sheena N.

description: We had dinner a few weeks ago. Party of 8, sat outside.  Excellent customer service. The server offered order suggestions. We ordered just the right amount of tacos!  My only complaint was the other 3 adults didn't want to share another pitcher of delicious margaritas (killjoys)!
author: Suzi L.

description:
marina location is better.
Magaritas are abit too sweet -   tacos are a bit too plain - prices are a bit to high.. but I still love this place and eat here at least times a week.
author: Chris S.

description:
I am bummed because I like the food and enjoy the Marina location, but I live in North Beach and was excited to try the new neighborhood Tacolicious that I assumed I would love! 

The bottom line is that we had such horrible service here that it ruined the entire meal. Despite the fact that I liked the food, I am deterred from returning.

They seated us outside and it took 45 minutes for her to come get our drink orders. We had to actually go inside and ask to put in our orders and the waitress finally came out. By that point, we had AMPLE amount of time to review the food and had placed both drinks and food orders. The waitress brought the food out in a regular amount of time, but after we had finished eating, we waited another 30 minutes for the check. We had to go in and ask for her to come give us the check too. Then 30 more minutes for her to collect our check. We went in and gave her the credit card and check. Needless to say, she didn't get tipped very well. The horrible service was the topic of dinner, but hey, at least they were consistent. Why bother to sit people outside if you don't serve outside?

Needless to say, we left with a really bad taste in our mouth, figuratively speaking. I don't plan to go back here - but would likely return to the marina location where the service is much better.
author: Megan F.

description:
The food is ok. The service is horrible. 
After we got seated we had to wait 30 minutes for our server to finally take our order. Meanwhile they kept serving us chips and salsa. After we placed our order it took another 45 minutes for the food arrive. By then we were tired, also full from all the chips they served us. No one really touched the food. We just wanted to pay and get out of there. The manager offered to give the kids a few Churros sticks. Not sure if I would go back to them again.
author: Gelareh E.

description:
A***holes, and horrible customer service.
Typically such a fan of T.L. But today service was way below standard.
So I show up on a tuesday date day on a nice Sf day. As we walk into the the bar we are told "Oh the staff is just finishing up up a tequila tasting, come back in maybe 20-30 minutes. 
Fine, no big deal my date and I head off to have a drink. We return approx 30 minutes later and are told the same thing.
Umm okay. . .
The game game is on so we visit another one of of our fave bars in the area and this time return 45 mins later.
At this point it is blantantly obvious the guy that talked with us in the begining is lazy-eyed drunk(along with most of the staff at the bar) and slurring his words "another 15 more minutes" There was no way we were waiting around again to be served by this crew.
Hey, if you're closed just say so. Show some respect for your customers.
Won't be returning. . .
author: Kia B.

description: I love the habanero (yellow) salsa. Good selection of tequila and mezcal. Place fills up really fast so plan accordingly.
