author: Tiger T.

description:
Went here for a friends bday a few weeks back.

The appetizers were great. The drinks were fantastic. The tacos......eh.

the prices were ridiculous. Im all for spending my money on food but knowing that Don Pistos was only a block away made my tummy sad.  The al pastor tacos i got were REALLY REALLY dry. 

Our waitress was fantastic though!!!
author: Krishna M.

description:
We were new in the hood when we decided to try the hyped up Tacolicious. This means we ordered way, I mean way way too much food for 3 people.

Our order:
Made to order guacomole - we were so hungry when we got there and I was especially excited about the guac. Then it came...and it was such a tiny portion for $8.25. YES! $8.25!!!
Fried sweet plaintains - oh so yummy!
Empanadas de calabaza - these are veggie friendly. 
Kale Salad - power greens so we had to order them.
Albacore tuna tostadas - not memorable.
10 Tacos - we ordered all of them and none of them stood out so I can't recommend any of them. Sorry folks. 

Anyway, if you're looking for mexican without the frills, go to El Farolito for burritos or La Taqueria for tacos. But you'll have to find my reviews for those spots.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Yummy Taccos and great place. The Salsa was also really good. Order 4 mixed taccos  and taste the difference.
author: Inderle L.

description:
We went to Tacolicious for the first (and last) time last month. The food is good, but poor service made it the worst dining experience I've ever had. 

The waitress who served (Ella) us was very condescending and we felt like we were intruding rather than being her (paying!) guests. She seemed to be annoyed by the fact that a colleague had a special dietary requests (dairy free). She walked away from our table in the middle of taking our order, because we had questions about the menu, promised to be right back, but in fact she returned over 5 minutes later and in the meantime managed to take an order from another table. The same happened when we requested the check - another table requested the check after us and got it immediately, we had to wait for our check much longer and then another 10 minutes to for someone to run our card. Our drink order was mixed up (we specifically ordered everything with no ice, when the drinks arrived with ice and we asked to have them replaced, the waitress did not apologize and only seemed to be annoyed by that) and we were continuously neglected during the stay (she was approaching all other tables, but not ours, and since she was not even looking in our direction, it was impossible to attract her attention). 
The waitress only had a couple of other tables in her section, so I really can't find an excuse for her to neglect us in such a way, and there is absolutely no excuse for her to be rude and condescending. 

Needless to say, we will not be coming back. The area has a lot of other workday lunch options and Tacolicious lost 3 potential regulars.
author: Ela P.

description: Excellent food been here several times for dinner. Margaritas are strong and the tacos are Heaven. I red command the short tips and fish taco. They also have a weekly taco which is a nice switch of pace. Best deal is the beer, shot and taco for $10! Can't beat it! Great place for a fun date or a night with your buddies. Yummy and hospitable. Pisto!
author: Katelyn B.

description:
Service was great but the Bloody Maria was not good at all. Hoped the ceviche would be good but I couldn't finish it.
My friend had the tacos and the carnitas was subpar. I know the other reviews complained about the service but I went in a Sunday afternoon with a small crowd. It was raining and people were waiting around the block for Mamas and an hour wait for pizza. So I figured this would be a good alternative but was proven wrong. 
I grew up in the mission and had my share of tacos. This doesn't compare to good locations out there. If you want high end Mexican I recommend you try Reposado in Palo Alto for real high end Mexican food. Los jarritos on Van ness is a good choice for a sit down Mexican restaurant.
author: Cesar B.

description: I've been here more times that I can count and this is great. Huge - I mean huge- selection of tequila. If you love tequila, you must check this place out. It's such a lively and fun place to get a drink with friends and have a light dinner. They have tacos, a couple of salads - very good salads, very good tequila cocktails and some decent deserts; churros, flan, waffle chocolate taco. The thing that keeps me coming though is the vibe. Very laid back, casual, and fun. Sometimes I just want to go have some tacos but don't want to go to some hole in the wall or an upscale place. This place is an in between. The service is hit or miss but at a place like this who cares. It's such a fun environment to meet people for a casual drink. If you're into margarita - the real kind - then check this place out.
author: Sam W.

description: It's really more 3.5 stars.  4 tacos for $14 is a pretty decent deal and will definitely fill you up.  We ended up trying 6 different tacos.  The cod, short rib, and shrimp were all just OK.  The vegetarian (corn, squash, and peppers) was very good, and the carnitas was great (comparable to Nopalito, IMO).  The double corn tortillas were a little too substantial for some of the tacos, so we had to discard the outer layer in some cases.
author: Simon L.

description: Terrible service, but good food. We were ignored for a good 20 minutes. People next to us (seated after us) were seen before us. Only after we called someone over did they actually come to our table. Surprisingly this isn't the first time I've had terrible service at this place. Order ended up being wrong, TWICE (meanwhile having no idea who are server was because we had 4/5 different people come talk to us). Really disappointed because not one person apologized for anything. At least do that when you mess up, MULTIPLE times at that. Anyway, wouldn't recommend this place. You can get bomb ass tacos at another place, not pay up the ass for them, and get amazing service.
author: Rachel C.

description: Awesome tacos.  Can be very busy on weekends.  Waiting to go back on next trip to SF.
author: Rich N.

description: $5 for a single, yet fancy-ass, street taco?  Never again.  Not to mention the fifteen minute wait for a margarita pitcher as we watched the bartenders mill around doing something (apparently) infinitely more important than making drinks.
author: Jason R.

description:
Very good happy hour, with a nice crowd.
We had the Tacos, Nachos and the chips and salsa felt like I was in Cancun.
author: Kevin K.

description:
Hysterically the worst service I've ever had without actually dining at a place. 

I understand wanting to close the place at 2:20 PM on a Tuesday afternoon without putting up a closed sign so the employees can have a tequila "tasting."  Just don't tell people, "We'll be open in 20 minutes" only to have customers return in 30 minutes and tell them "20 more minutes" and have them return and tell them again "20 more minutes."  By this point, the manager who kept telling me, "20 more minutes" was visibly intoxicated and had nothing to say other than "20 more minutes."  I told him what he could do with his 20 minutes and walked out only to hear an eruption of laughter from the drunken employees of this marginal chain restaurant.  

You're probably asking is, "why keep going back?"  
Because my friend had a coupon, that's why.  God knows, I'll never give them business.
author: Corey V.

description: Had date night here last night. Wasn't disappointed! We had four tacos, three fish and one braised shortrib. We also got the queso dip to start and a few beers. They have the huge old school Coronas and it was great to have with our meal. The chips and salsa were amazing! They have this yellow habanero salsa that's pretty damn spicy but oh-so-delicious. Definitely coming back soon.
author: Cat G.

description: for the soft opening, like the other ones im biased. ive gotten to know the core crew pretty well, and they always treat my friends and me so well. chips salsa/queso, mini ceviche tostadas, tacos of short rib/carnitas/mixed grilled veggies and churros compleated the eats selection. sangria, margaritas and a drink with cucumber juice made the booze trifecta. The GM Ryan and his crew took amazing care of us even though we were in the far corner. It's great to see theyre flourishing and killing it across the board.
author: Kim N.

description:
With the new North Beach location just off Washington Square Park, I must say I'm a fan. Outdoor seating, large open space inside and friendly staff make for a good experience. Food is reasonably priced and they have a great happy hour to top it off. 

I always get the pasíon margarita (extra spicy) when I go, so delicious. I like the North Beach location better than the Marina one for sure; the crowd is much more manageable.
author: Carlynn A.

description:
On Saturday, 6/21/14, my girlfriend and I decided to go eat at Tacolicious in San Francisco located in North Beach for lunch. I've heard a lot of positive things about Tacolicious and I've really been craving Mexican food so we made it happen. Read on to see how it went. 

Atmosphere/Decor:

Tacolicious is located right next to Tony's Pizza which is in a nice area. When you walk up to Tacolicious you will see outdoor dining tables. This is a great option especially when the weather is nice or when you want to sit outside and eat on a nice summer day. The interior of the restaurant is pretty nice. It has a nice open floor plan. Once you walk in to the restaurant you will see a nice sized bar to the right with plenty of alcohol options. The tables are pretty modern. Each table is set up where one person will sit on a large sized grey stool structure and the other person will sit on the the other side which is more like half of a booth seat. The wooden tables felt a little bit unstable. I only saw a few tables where you could sit about 4 to 6 people. They also play pretty loud music but you can still hold a conversation without the music taking over. The music playlist was mixed with various types of songs. I also liked how you can see into the open kitchen located towards the rear of the restaurant. Overall, the restaurant was well designed. 

Food: 

My girlfriend and I decided to go with the 10 tacos for $33. We ordered 3 guajillo braised beef short rib tacos, 3 traditional carnitas tacos, 2 shot-and-a-beer braised chicken tacos and 2 house-made chorizo and potato tacos. All of the tacos came with the traditional cilantro and onions. Let me start off by saying that each and every taco was packed with a lot of meat! These tacos aren't skimpy at all! The short rib tacos were okay. I've had better shredded beef tacos. They were good but lacking in flavor. A little bit of added salt would have helped. The carnitas tacos were good. They didn't taste like traditional carnitas to me but they still had a nice simple flavor. The beer braised chicken tacos were my favorite. Too bad my girlfriend and I only ordered one each. The shredded chicken was packed with a lot of flavor and the chicken was very tender. The chorizo and potatoes were my least favorite. The chorizo didn't taste like traditional chorizo. There wasn't that much flavor to the chorizo nor was it spicy. It actually wasn't spicy at all. The tacos weren't bad at all it's just certain tacos lacked flavor. We also ordered a side of semi-traditional refried beans with cotija cheese and a side of rice-o-licious with mojo verde. The beans and rice were pretty good. All of the food was very fresh and I felt clean after I ate it. Usually when I eat Mexican food I get really bloated and feel heavy. I didn't feel that way after eating at Tacolicious.

Service:

The service was really good. Our waitress actually greeted us when we walked in and sat us down at our table. She took our order within a few minutes. We were brought chips, salsa and water very quickly. All of the employees seemed very friendly. 

Overall: 

Tacolicious is a pretty good place to get a variety of fresh tacos. Each taco is loaded with a lot of meat. It's different compared to authentic Mexican or American Mexican food. In my opinion most of the tacos were lacking flavor except for the carnitas and chicken tacos. If you're craving tacos and are in the North Beach neighborhood, give Tacolicious a try.
author: David R.

description: Awesome prix fixe! We stopped in for a bite to eat before a comedy show, & enjoyed this. It was a beer, tequila & taco of your choice. There was an expansive variety of tacos. Everyone can find their favorite taco! I did not plan on eating Mexican food in North Beach, but got fast service since it was so empty on a Saturday night.
author: Tiffany P.

description: Delicious! My favorite was the Shot and a Shot Braised Chicken Taco. I loved the vibe and atmosphere of this place. And everything I tasted was delicious
author: Brooke M.

description:
My first experience at Tacolicious was a positive one. 
I tried two different tacos, the shot-and-a-beer braised chicken and the pacific rock cod. i was able to pick up a beer taste in the battered cod, it had great flavor. The chicken tasted like it had been simmering all day, very good. The sauces that come alongside the tacos are a nice addition, my favorite was the green one.
The sides of rice and beans my boyfriend and I got, were the perfect amount for the two of us to share. 
* We drove by the Tacolicious  on Chestnut Street and there was a line out of the door. We decided to drive a few miles to this one in North Beach and it was a lot less packed, no wait for seating.
author: Vanessa J.

description:
I'm a huge fan of T-Lish and though I live no where close to this North Beach location, a few coworkers and I made our way over for lunch as it's the closest one to our office.

By far the most spacious of the SF locations. Food is consistent with others. Pro tip: for a group of people, order the 4 tacos (or more) and split each one between 2 people as they double up on the tortilla. Thank me later.
author: Johanna L.

description: I've been to the North Beach location a couple of times, the mission location as well as ordered Tacolicious for catering events. Every time I have been consistently pleased. The food always hits the spot, whether its tacos, guacamole or the marina girl salad. On my last visit I got the chile con queso which was very tasty. Tacolicious will continue to be one of my favorite go to spots in SF.
author: Tracy S.

description:
I like the concept at Tacolicious and I think if we had experienced even mediocre service, opposed to the non-service we experienced then maybe I'd give it 4 stars.

Ordering a la carte can really rack up the dollars! Sure, I can get cheaper tacos most anywhere in CA but a veggie taco + a kale salad was a perfectly sized meal, not to mention quite tasty. I know that I could've gotten more bang for my buck at a traditional Mexican spot but that would also lead to overeating and/or leftovers and I just wasn't in the mood for all that.

Our drinks were good but nothing to write home about. It'd be nice if they had a few more table and chairs arrangements. After walking around all day my bf was looking for some more back support. 

Service: 1 star ( that's for our server; the bussers and hostess can have 5)
Drinks: 2 stars
Food: 4 stars 
Price: 1.5 stars 
Ambience: 4 stars 

I'd try it again! Who's paying? I'll need more tacos next time!
author: Bailey M.

description:
Been here twice for dinner and a third time for drinks.  Delicious, fast service for the right price.  $45 will get you dinner for two and two drinks.

Carnitas, braised short ribs, and cod are delectable.  I've tried all of the tacos--yay for splitting with the boyfriend--and they're all really good as long as you are a fan of what's in them (if you don't like shrimp, don't get the shrimp tacos).  The chupitos (mixed shots) are fun, the cocktails are pretty good, and the margaritas are very good.

Ambiance is lively with low lighting and they have outdoor seating.  Small restaurant - group of 6 or less.
author: Francesca N.

description: Great food! We're on vacation from so cal and found this place on accident, so good! Yummy margaritas and the nacho were to die for!
author: Jessica H.

description:
Tacolicious in North Beach!

Woohoo! Same taco-y goodness as all the locations (same menu according to the manager), and a super delicious looking cocktail menu!

Mexican corn was a little dry, but that's the only complaint. 

Happy to have them in the 'hood!
author: Eli B.

description: Excellent Beef Brisket Tacos! Get the 'Prix-Fixe' option that comes with a tequila shot + beer + taco for $10!
author: Ernie G.

description:
For the second time in 7 days we experienced incredible service from Jay and Josh. On our first visit we were blown away by the incredible food and fantastic attentive service. Their knowledge of the vast array of Tequila and Mezcal was very impressive, our drink of choice and the tasting of said we take quite seriously.
The Ahi Tuna tacos are a religious experience not to be missed. The recommendation from Ella of the chicken Mole was amazing and Jason the chef then sent over the meatballs and a desert of Churros with chocolate dipping sauce was sinfully good. 
Bravo to you all, we will be back next week with more friends and family. Thank you.
Julie and Robert
author: Julie C.

description:
I'm a huge T-lish fan and I actively frequent both the Marina and the Mission locations. But now that this wonderful spot opened so close to me, I am in big trouble. I somehow always manage to order one too many pitchers and one too many tacos. I deem it the T-lish curse. 

What do I love about this spot? 
- Pitchers of the Original, Grapefruit and Passion Fruit margaritas 
- Short rib tacos (1st preference) and Carnitas tacos (2nd preference) 
- Guac dip with chips 
- Dim lighting and trendy ambiance 
- Friendly waiters
- Great neighborhood location across from Washington Square Park

So why only 4 stars? The tall stools instead of chairs - it just does not work for me. I'm naturally very clumsy and after a glass or two of margaritas, how in the world is one expected to sit down without falling?! I need to rest my back against something or will consistently feel quite uncomfortable. 

Aside from that, however, I love this new location and will definitely be returning!  

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description:
Tacos are solid, drinks are good, ambience is fun. Great place to go with some friends and chow down on a bunch of different kinds of tacos and try some drinks. 

I think i've tried all their tacos (but their menu changes from time to time) and they are all pretty good. Their skillet roasted mussels are really tasty as well. 

Service has been okay most of the time - when it gets busy, be prepared to wait and be ignored sometimes. 

One time, however, when my boyfriend and I ordered tacos for pick up, they forgot about the order completely and when we got there later to pick them up, they'd lost the ticket or something. The manager (I think?) was incredibly nice and apologetic, and got us a few different kinds of drinks to try while we waited for our order at the bar. Thanks for being so great about our forgotten order!
author: Yishian Y.

description:
YEAH HEY! Tacolicious in North Beach! Woot Woot!

Let's face it, the T-Lish in the Marina is always a pain in the ass, and when I'm in the Mission I stay loyal to the same burrito I've been eating from El Farolitos since I was in elementary school, but boy oh boy did North Beach need something like Tacolicious.

Service is great. Alex and Wayne are totally kickass bartenders, the tacos are tasty and always come out quickly, and the Camarones A La Diablo, yes please. Also, there's so much more space than the one in the Marina, so I always love coming here for a quick drink and a taco on my way home.
author: Jessi M.

description:
So happy to give this location in particular a rave review.  

Dined here with two girlfriends, we had a great time cocktailing and eating our Saturday night away.

I like this space slightly more than the Marina location, it's more open which lends itself well to the ever-present crowd.

We did have to wait, which we expected, but happily got down to business with a pitcher of margaritas.  For dinner we tried the kale salad (3 stars, only b/c I'm not *yet* a kale lover), tuna tostadas (infinity stars), an array of tacos (no explanation needed, perfection), and guac (5 stars).

Such a great evening of delicious Mexican fare and drink!
author: Brianna M.

description: Worked in this neighborhood for 6 years now and just found this place.  I just wanted a salad as I was walking around, read vinaigrette menu outside.  They had a Marina Salad, thier (which I typically don't like), cucumber, pumpkin seeds, add chicken with a Jalapeno avocado dressing....I literally can't get enough of it...I eat every last bit.   It's a bit expensive, but worth every penny ....I might be eating this every day.
author: Patty H.

description:
I'm physically full. Emotionally disappointed. 
The tacos are bland. I'm all about the tacos. Forget all the other bells and whistles.
author: Max H.

description: Very yummy mexican treats with huge portions. Great chips, salsa and guac and good salads, tacos, etc. Nice outdoor seating and plenty of room inside if you were to come with a big group, etc. Lots of fresh ingredients at fair prices.
author: K. L.

description:
Two strikes and this place is off my list.  
Last week - sat down at the bar with my wife for a late night drink.  Hipster bartender has a major attitude and lectures us on how to order from him.  We put up with him and head home.

Last night - Major attitude from the greeter/seater.  Seriously ridiculous under the breath whining about her job. No one comes to the table for over 10 minutes except a nice bus boy with chips.  We finally drop a $5 for the bus boy and leave.  

This pace has no concept of customer service and clearly does not want or need my business.  

There are some many good and gracious places in North Beach to enjoy!
author: David E.

description:
I shared the empanada de calabaza as a starter. Then had the fried cod, braised chicken, short rib, carnitas, and a special pork (forgot what it was) taco. 

They really pack on the meat! They definitely do not skimp. I liked the cod, chicken, and short rib the most. I thought 5 tacos wouldn't be enough, but it filled me up good. The empanada was good, but I would probably skip it next time and eat more tacos instead. 

This is a great place to share tacos by splitting the double corn tortillas and redistributing the delicious insides. It's a bit loud though, so it may not be a good place for a date or to have a quiet conversation.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
I'd go back. While ambiance was hip, service was good and the food and chips were nicely presented, nothing was particularly noteworthy. 

I had 4 tacos for 14 dollars. The two pork ones were good, the seasonal veggie one also good but a bit monotonous, and the Pacific rock cod tacos was pretty bad, tasted like fried breading and there was a real lack of spicy, tangy or creamy flavors to make up for its overwhelming blandness. 

So maybe I'm being hard on them but I just get frustrated having to pay a price premium solely for ambiance, I'd been hoping for some exceptional tacos or at least some interesting imaginative flourishes at this price. For as few mexican options as North Beach has, foodwise you can pay half the price nearby and get better tacos and better salsa.
author: Devin M.

description: Though the food is the same, I have more fun at the Mission location. I don't like that the restaurant and bar are right next to each other. The noise level is way too high to hear the person next to you.
author: Margaret R.

description:
I went here for a casual birthday with some friends last night ( there were 12 of us) and it really was such an awesome time! I was kind of worried because I read that they didn't take reservations so I just had everyone meet up and was prepared to wait. It was Wednesday night so I didn't think it would be that bad, and turns out we didn't have to wait at all!  My friends had a table that was a little too small so they happily moved us to a larger one as soon as they could.  No problems, super nice and friendly staff.  Our waitress was so nice and handled the large crowd of us with ease and a smile.  

Tacos are delicious!  Try them all!  My favorite Margarita isn't on the menu - I always ask for just a plain margarita with jalapeño and it is sooo good! Just a little kick and so yummy!  

Love this place, the North Beach Location has to be my favorite for sure!  Thank you Tacolicious for making my B-Day night awesome!
author: Camille D.

description: Expect to wait  for good  mexican  food. For the real stuff head to the mission area.
author: Jeff D.

description: What's not to love! Location. Food. The bartenders. Wish I knew the one waitresses name - will have to go back and ask so I can give credit where credit is due - she's incredible. It's just overall a great place to go - whether it's 2 of you or more - the food is amazing. The margaritas perfect for the restaurant. And what's not to love about the location.
author: Sheryl F.

description:
Great place!  Food is delicious.  Best tacos that I've had in San Francisco.  For a first timer, i'd recommend the 3 tacos for $12 and try 3 different ones to see what your favorites would be.

Great video on  YouTube of them making Guacamole.  Order it and its made fresh right in front of you.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R31jcwTdlxw
author: Michael U.

description: I've been to the Tacolicious in the Mission and the Marina, and maybe it was the night I was there (a few days after Christmas), but it was incredibly quiet when we walked in after being told the wait at Tony's was going to be 2.5 hours for 7 people. I had just received the Tacolicious cookbook from my mother-in-law, so naturally coming here with her was really special.  We were seated right away at their bar tables and were approached by a waitress almost immediately. Baskets on baskets of tortilla chips and salsa were provided within sitting down as well, and it turned into this basket that never seemed to have a bottom. Since there were 7 of us, we ended up ordering a fair amount of food...as in, 30 tacos, two orders of guacamole, and an order of the grilled squid veracruz. As always, my favorite taco here is the carnitas.  Surprisingly, the taco of the day was probably the most disappointing despite it having bacon in it. We passed on dessert because everyone left here absolutely satisfied and insanely full. Tacolicious is fairly consistent when it comes to delicious tacos, and its North Beach establishment is no different than the other two places I had been to before.  I loved here and wouldn't mind going back!
author: Lisa I.

description:
So here's the trick to having a good experience at Tacolicious : Sit at the bar, and go on an off night.

We've been a few times on Friday and Saturday nights had decidedly disappointing experiences due to the service and noise levels. The quality of service just isn't there and both times we ended up waiting rather awkward lengths of time without drinks (nothing puts a damper on tacos like empty margarita glasses). The sound is also pretty atrocious here. On a busy night, you can hardly hear the person sitting across the table from you because there's just nothing to absorb the noise. 

However - when we've gone on slower nights and sat at the bar, the experience has been great. The barstaff is friendly and charming, they know their tequila and the service is on point. Plus, you can actually carry on a conversation with your date!

I love the ceviche here, and the fish tacos are pretty great as well.
author: Caroline M.

description: The service here is excruciatingly slow. I come here all the time because of friends they consistently take 10+ minutes to complete a beer order.
author: Andrew M.

description: This place is really delicious. I went with two friends and we got the 10 for $33 deal and ordered a variety of their delicious tacos. The food is very filling and tastes very natural. Service and location were also great. I will definitely come here again.
author: Dani P.

description: Wanted to visit here the whole time in SF and it was certainly worth the wait! Excellent food, great fast service. And I am in love with any restaurant that will leave you a carafe/bottle/pitcher of water. It's so smart, frees up servers for more important things!
author: sharon m.

description:
The food, cocktails, and service were great here. 

The main problem with this space is the acoustics. When I cannot hear someone talking to me in the same table there is a problem. They need to put in some foam insulation so there are fewer surface sound can bounce off.
author: Anthony K.

description:
haterz gonna hate

disclaimer: i dont live in SF and cant speak out for the bay area food snobs, however tacos are my life and i really, reeeeally enjoyed myself here. also i went on an empty monday evening. 

if an affordable taco is what you seek go somewheres else, i came to san fran to spoil myself and spoil i did.

house salsa is great, a nice medium/mild blend with some chunk and a nice citrusy aftertaste. i sat at the bar, barstaff was super nice. house margarita: BOMB! order 2 (at least :) ) 

at this point i will digress a moment to discuss taco prices. in california if you are eating "authentico" and it tastes good, my younger, degenerate self would tell you that if you are at a joint that 1) charges you over 2$, 2)accepts credit cards, 3) allows u to order in english; than ure just wasting your time. however!!!!!! my recently hard working self would tell you that paying 4.50 per taco at this small, little, "hipster" taco bar is worth every penny.
 
i had one cod, short rib, and shot and a barrell chicken, my taste buds were rocked. they played the "safety dance" while i was there but my wallett was three sheets to the wind. have been once, will be back for more; hopefully while some girls and not a creepy old man are present. really liked the presentation on all levels, everything i oredered came out in a clean, sleek, and well organized vessel. hot sauces are TASTEY, especially the habañero, dont be afraid!!!! has a more mild and rich flavor than one would expect with that pepper. 

upon receiving my 3 taco/2 margarita bill of 40 dollars, i was greeted by a firm handshake from the bartender who thanked me for coming, after which i happily tipped 6 dollars. 

if you are worried about breaking the bank, stay in the mission, if you are looking for a foward thinking (read:fresh/fun) expexerience on the taco than you cannot go wrong

also****** if you are a stickler, these folks wrap their s$@t in not one but two taco sized corn tortillas, 1) because they LOAD it up and 2) because thats how mí abuelita does it
author: Eat M.

description: Service was pretty rough. Tacos were yummy but server forgot sauces (had to ask) and we ended up clearing our own plates from the table onto an adjacent table after the server brought the kids' desserts but didn't remove their lunch plates! So bizarre since the restaurant was practically empty.
author: Lindsay W.

description: This has to be the loudest restaurant in San Francisco. On a recent visit, we were literally screaming at each other and sitting next to each other.  Our food arrived before our drinks and was fine.  But cold.  This place makes me wonder what is happening to the old school charm and authenticity of SF.
author: Monica C.

description: Place is Crazy crackin sometimes but food is quite good... drinks our flowing.. staff seems very competant but I wish they would hire some more people and raise prices so it can be more relaxed feeling.
author: Adam O.

description:
When I first read that a Tacolicious was opening up in North Beach I was extremely excited! (I love me some Tacolicious but the one in the Marina is always so crowded and while the location in the Mission is nice, we just don't venture that way very much anymore.) 

Fast forward to yesterday when I officially received a job offer and couldn't think of anywhere else I'd rather celebrate than the new Tacolicious location. Delicious margaritas and tacos? Yes please.

My guy and I arrived around 8ish for dinner and were seated right away. Chips and delicious salsa were placed in front of us as we perused the menu. We started off with a pitcher (probably not necessary) of margarita picante (a favorite) as well as the albacore tuna tostadas "contramar-style" per our waitress' recommendation. We decided to go with the 4 for 14 deal and ordered 2 fried local rock cod tacos, 1 house-made chorizo and potatoes taco and 1 guajillo braised beef short rib taco. While the fried cod is always delicious, we decided that the chorizo and the short rib tacos were definitely the winners. The fried cod seemed to have a higher batter to fish ratio than we prefer, but it's still tasty.

We decided that this is definitely our favorite location not only because it's within walking distance of our apartment but also because of the size and layout of the restaurant. It feels much more spacious and open than the others. We definitely plan to make many return visits, there's a lot of delicious looking eats and drinks that I still want to try.
author: Emily S.

description:
Reasons for the 3 stars:

- 1 for the lack of tables. It's a big restaurant, but you'll notice that there are a lot of 2 seaters that they put together for larger groups. IMO, a few more tables can easily be added to reduce the wait time.

- 1 for the bar service while you're waiting to be seated. During my experience, I was waiting at the bar to get two beers. Two of the three bartenders were working on table orders leaving one dude to man the bar. Took about 8 minutes before the one bartender could get my drink, but when I was seated, I ordered a drink and literally got it within a minute. Here's a suggestion - people that are seated can wait a little bit for their drink since they're already seated. Keep the people waiting for their tables happy since the wait takes a while.

Other observations from a Friday night:

Food: The food was great. The only taco that seemed a little off was the Chorizo taco - it just didn't have that much flavor.

Atmosphere: I couldn't tell if the music was loud, or if the crowd was louder. Just be prepared to talk loudly, or repeat yourself during a conversation.

Waiter Service: Excellent, no complaints.

Note: This has nothing to do with the restaurant, but let me just say...Blondes, blondes everywhere.
author: Alfonzo J.

description: I love this place and try to go at least once a week. My only problem with it is the lighting. Apparently the owner likes to dim the lights and it makes it hard to see if the place is even open, much less read the menu without a flashlight. So, if you are walking by and think it's closed, take another look.
author: Patrick R.

description: Great new spot in North Beach, which was sorely lacking in Mexican food options. Lots to like about Tacolicious. Great chips and salsa trio. Great beers on tap. Great service. The tacos are very solid as well. They are sized somewhere between street tacos and full-size tacos, but are very tasty and satisfying. Skip the fillet mignon option. They are not worth the extra $3 per taco. There are TVs for watching the game and a comfortable bench along the back wall. I lingered a while watching MNF, and enjoying an excellent IPA on tap.
author: Brian C.

description: Unfortunately some of the people here don't know how to treat customers and manage the tables. I asked the hostess a table for 4, she said it would be one and a half to two hours, which looked strange considering that there were many empty tables and just a few people standing, but I said ok, let's wait and see if maybe it gets faster. After 10 minutes I got the text message saying that my table was ready. How can you misestimate the wait time that much? What if I had decided to go somewhere else and get a drink while I was waiting for my hour and a half? Whatever... As I went to her, I discovered that she put down a table for 2, although we clearly said that it was for 4, but she was only able to say that we would need to wait again for a new table for 4 to open up! The funny thing is that there were at least 3 tables for 4 empty at that moment and no one waiting for them, and she couldn't fix her mistake by giving us one of those tables... Besides the hostess, we also had some other unpleasant incidents with other employees, which makes me think that this place needs to reevaluate how they treat their guests. Too bad because the food then was good and our waitress was nice, but because of her colleagues the overall experience was poor.
author: Massimo C.

description: I hate giving anyone a low review. I really wanted to love this place I mean how cute is the name. Had the guacamole & albondigas & tacos. Nothing special about it. Wish we would of tried somewhere else.
author: Kami R.

description:
What a pleasant alternative to the Marina,  which would be the perfect location... If it weren't in the marina.  I'm a little sad they took away the Victorian charm out from the previous resturaunt here,  but its a dope spot.   Playing all my favorite songs from The Animals to Psychedelics Furs to 2 pac.  Oh and did I mention the food...
10 starts if I could.
author: Kelly N.

description: So, although I wouldn't say Tacolicious isn't true and authentic Mexican food, or even the best place for Mexican in San Francisco (go to La Taqueria in the Mission for this), Tacolicious is amazing.  I especially love this location because all of the staff make an effort to make sure you're happy and are treated right.  Their guac and cheese appetizers are must haves.
author: Courtney S.

description: Loved this place!! My friends took my husband and I here on our first night in town. The drinks are strong, and the tacos are delicious! Reasonable prices too. It had a fun, boisterous atmosphere, and was a perfect place for a fun night out with friends!
author: Katie B.

description: One of my favorite places to go with friends. Great food & great atmosphere! Their deal of a taco, a shot & a tecate for $10 is the best!
author: B S.

description:
Hate to do this to you tacolicious, but this location is a shit show (love the one in the mission, other two I went to have been fine as well). Let's see, in short these were the major issues:

1. Seated right away due to a pretty empty restaurant, so food will come out fast right? Nope, 2.5 hrs later and we finally get our 10 tacos.

2. Tacos were lukewarm. Maybe they microwaved them...in 2.5 hrs. The beef short rib tacos are my favorite, I've had them at least a dozen times at various locations. They came out rock hard/dry, cold, and fatty with no seasoning. 

3. Chips were stale.

4. Service--- doesn't exist, it took only 30 min to get a menu and we never saw our server again. They didn't even get the order correct, but our party was so done by that point to care. We just wanted to GTFO.

WTF is going on at this place. If I was blindfolded and served the food, I would have never guessed I was eating at tacolicious. One of our friend's said "this is just like Yabo's tacos in Columbus" as a compliment...that's when you know it's bad, Yabo's is horrible. Tacolicous should never be compared to such a place...

The mission is insanely busy on weekends, but at least the food is great. Just go on a Sunday if you can or a weekday. In fact I went the very next day given my experience here, to get my taco fix and make sure I wasn't dreaming. It was like going to an entirely different restaurant. Sure we had to wait for a table for 15 min, but at least it was worth it....unlike this location. I normally give places two tries (in case it's an off day), but this one is out in one when there is no shortage of other locations.
author: Puneet S.

description:
I love the tacolicious near me on Chestnut but I visited this location yesterday w some friends from out of town and was very disappointed.
1. Service- Very poor. Our food came out promptly but was just dumped on the table by a food runner. There was no explanation of the different tacos or salsas. We didn't know whose order belonged to who. The food was cold. We wanted to get it heated up but couldn't find our server, she never stopped in after to ask how the food was. It took 20 mins to find someone to run our card. I had to ask the staff to remove dirty plates. I think only 1 server was working and the food runners were not being quite helpful. There were two guys behind the bar hanging out, not sure why one of them couldn't help her out.
2. Traditional carnitas was very greasy and lacking flavor. Probably would have been better hot. The fish tacos were also generic. The huevos rancheros was satisfactory as was the short rib. 
3. The margs were disappointing. Not worth the $10. Visit Nopalito, or the Chestnut tacolicious for better margs! 

I will never return, so many better options
author: Lisa M.

description: I have been meaning of to write this review for awhile. Back in June my husband and I came to visit SF with some friends. We made a group reservation for 10 people on a Saturday night. When we arrived for our reservation they said they were really busy and our reservation would be pushed a little. After one hour past our reservation time we asked the hosted when we would be seated and what happened to our reservation and she rudely responded with "SH*T HAPPENS!" WOW!!! Talk about quality customer service. We remained polite and finally were sat 1.5hrs after our reservation time. The bartenders were also rude and no one apologized for the delay. Probably the worst customer service I have ever had at a restaurant. Definitely won't be coming back or recommending to anyone! Managers really need to be taking a closer look at their staff.
author: Laura K.

description:
There are not enough good things to say about this place.  The food, the atmosphere, the staff, the drinks, the Paul Madona artwork... AMAZE!

Atmosphere: Tacoloicious is perfect for any event or time of day. My roommate and I joke that it is an extension of our apartment. We go straight from work, on Sunday afternoon after a gym class or on Friday night before going out. The patio is great for eating outside and the bar is always vibrant and lively Thursday-Saturday night. It is a super trendy spot filled with Paul Madona artwork. The open kitchen makes things feel more authentic. 

Food: I literally eat here at least once a week and it never gets old. The short rib taco is unreal, the queso is delicious and the chips and salsa are phenomenal. They recently had a vegi taco of the week that was perfect for my roommate (in addition to the vegi taco permanently on the menu). The taco of the week rotates - every one I have tried has been unique and tasty :) The marina girl salad is a great lighter option as well. If you are looking for dessert the churos are the best I've ever had. 

Drinks: All of the drinks are amazing. The ingredients are fresh and there are a lot of fun margarita and mixed drink options. The Nopal is my personal favorite. If you buy a pitcher it is affordable. 

Staff: The staff are some of my favorite people. The hostesses are always friendly and greet you as you enter. Chips, salsa and water are delivered to the table shortly after sitting down, my order is always taken promptly and the food is delivered very quickly. Ryan, the old general manager, and JP the new one (and previous bar tender) are great and do a fabulous job making tacolicious a welcoming and fun place to spend the evening. 

If you haven't been to tacolicous you are missing out!!!
author: A H.

description:
Chips & salsa, vino and the Marina Girl Salad.  The little things in life that get you by :)

Amen for the new spot.  Perfect reason to stop by on the way home from work or start a night out in NB a little earlier than planned.

3 reasons why I love the new spot,

1.  Cannot thank them enough for opening up such a spacious location to house one of the best restaurants in town. 
 
2.  I can hear my friends talk from across the table.. without having to scream.

3.  My glass of wine, although always a generous pour from any T-lish, is kept full of my favorite pinot grigio without question.  

Bravo T-lish, bravo.
author: Lisa G.

description:
I came here for lunch with a friend on a Sunday and it was packed. Luckily there were two spots available at the chef's counter facing the kitchen. We watched the cooks as they quickly grilled meats, assembled numerous tacos, and prepared salads. 
We ordered a bloody mary, tacos, and the kale salad. The salad was fresh and the vegetables crisp, although it didn't come with quinoa as advertised. We tried the chicken, steak, and veggie tacos. The chicken was the best - shredded chicken was marinated in a flavorful smoky cerveza sauce. Homemade chips and salsa were a nice addition. They also served three different sauces with our meal, each unique in spice and flavor. I highly recommend this place, especially if you can grab a table outside on a sunny day. They have other locations in the Marina and Mission.
author: Alya G.

description: Delicious tuna tostadas, calamari salad, and guac. The margs are also always amazing! Taco of the week is always good and generally the tacos have enough meat to make two tacos. Only one time out of the hundred times I've eaten did I have a so-so experience when the tuna on the tostada was a bit too salty. Overall a fool-proof go to mexican spot. The only reason for 4stars is because it is $$$$
author: Taylor P.

description:
The guac and tacos here were very good.  Also enjoyed the fresh salsa served at the beginning.  My biggest gripe here is the price.  While the tacos were savory, the portions were small for the price, and there was nothing out of the ordinary about the cuisine to merit the higher price.  

However, for a clean, fresh dinner at a fun place with tasty cocktails, this is definitely a solid pick.  Ordered the taco wine, fish tacos, and carnitas tacos, and all were tasty, as I said before.
author: Laura A.

description: Tacos, cocktails, and great service. What's not to like? Dino is our favorite server. He's funny, charming and attentive. Any time we are in North Beach we stop by here just to see him, and have a taco or two. Like Good Times Dino is Dino-myte!
author: Jacklyn H.

description: My girlfriend and I had an assortment of street tacos and salsas.  They were great along with the drinks!  We just moved to the area and I think we found a spot we'll be hitting up frequently! Thanks!
author: Matt H.

description: This place has a cool atmosphere but not my type of party. Food is too expensive, we ordered guacamole for 9$, which we could of got for free at a real mexican restaurant and not a white mans mexican themed establishment. BUT they were playing good music.
author: Ryan S.

description: Went for Sunday lunch, very happy with our food. Guacamole was excellent and the place is nice  will probably go back if in the area.
author: Laura D.

description: Overrated in a serious way. Perhaps this a great spot for happy hour, but we came to eat food after reading rave reviews.  This is the loudest place I've ever eaten a meal. The chips and salsa were both decent, but the tacos were nothing but meat. Imagine going to Taco Bell and getting a taco packed with pure Taco Bell meat. Can I have some sour cream, cilantro, tomatoes, or anything else other than pure meat packed into a taco? Additionally, even if this is a well known happy hour spot, the sangria was nothing to write home about.
author: Jolie C.

description: Always a pleasure eating here and enjoying all of the sights. I order the carnitas and chicken tacos. The three sauce selection pairs perfectly with the entrees. Drumroll please: the chips and guacamole is the best in San Francisco. Get there before peak time e.g. weekdays before 5:00 PM.
author: Trevor C.

description: Insanely good food!  Took awhile to get post mates to deliver it on a Memorial Day but that's just life.  Best tacos I've had in years and great sauces too.  Wife is half Mexican and we think we are experts on the topic of good tacos.  Love this place.
author: Andy P.

description: Tacolicious is one of my favorite spots in the city! The bartender Wayne is so accommodating and nice and very helpful. The foods great and we always have very efficient service whenever we come in. Try the pasion margarita and carnitas taco! They're the bomb!
author: Anna K.

description:
Great Tacos, great service, would recommend next time your in North Beach.  

Went to Tacolicious on a Saturday around 12:30.  The restaurant was busy, but we were seated right away.  We ordered a 10 pack of assorted tacos and 4 chupitos (large shooters).  All of the tacos were great, I especially liked the short rib.  When ordering the chuitos we tried to order more than one kind but were informed we had to order all the same because they make them in one large batch, makes sense if you think about it.  We couldn't decide between the Nopal and the Mucho Gusto. We decided on the Nopal.  At the end of our lunch along with the bill our waitress came over with another waitress and brought us 6 Mucho Gustos. 4 for the table and 2 for them which they drank with us.  All in all a great experience.
author: Brian B.

description:
Ambience- super cool. 
Food- delicious 
Drinks- inventive. 
Go!!
author: Shannon M.

description: Very good food but salty and greasy. Great drinks. Overpriced for what it is. The guacamole is $8.25!!
author: Marcy M.

description: Bartenders know how to use tequila - I'm not talking strong, I'm talking about using it as an ingredient to compliment some damn good tacos.
author: matt j.

description:
When I say I am always here, I am ALWAYS here.

I visit this Tacolicous at least 2-3 times a month and I am never disappointed. 

Service: This place can get really busy during happy hour and big events, but the servers are always attentive.  Be ready to look over the menu quickly and place your order. Tlish is fast-paced - not because this place is trying to rush you out- because they are trying to feed the masses. My water glass never empties and there's a never-ending supply of chips and salsa. 

Food: I've had almost all of the different types of tacos and margaritas - my favorites are the Nopales and carnitas tacos and the nopal and mucho gusto margaritas. Each taco comes with an extra tortilla which means if you order two tacos, you're really getting four! 

Ambiance: The music can get loud as the night goes on, but it's a boisterous, fun place to have a quick meal.  

Overall: Check your expectations at the door folks- just come in and enjoy the food and the ambiance.

Tip: TRY THE QUESO. Just do it.
author: Jess A.

description:
Enjoyed my meal here. I would actually give this place 3.5 stars but one of my issues with Yelp is that they don't allow you to rate in half increments. Food is good enough that I would definitely back come here again and I can tell you that I have already craved those excellent tacos.

Was served a basket of good chips and salsa. Followed up with a hearty and very good Aztec Chicken Soup which had a tomato base and large chunks of dark meat chicken with additional condiments. 

I then had three very good beer braised chicken tacos with a side order of rice. 

Liked that they brought out three sauces to use for the tacos.

For taco lovers I recommend this place.
author: Mitchell M.

description: Finally made it to SF to try this place, and very glad we did.  I had bookmarked their salsa recipe online a while ago, and got to try it at the restaurant - it is seriously delicious.  I ate way too much there, and then went home and made it myself.  It's a roasted tomato salsa with mint added, which takes it to a really special place.  The rest of the food was good.  Unusual things to try, mostly well-executed.   There were a couple vegetarian options, and they were good, but a place like this could easily have more than the couple.  I thought the only vegetarian option for beans was good but a bit boring.  Cocktails were good, we tried a couple of their signature drinks and enjoyed them.  Table are very close and it gets loud.  Service was okay, not great, though our bartender was very personable.  The food was good and I would definitely go again.  Tony's Pizza next door is a huge draw and doesn't take reservations, and the waits are usually 1-2 hours.  For now, Tacolicious is much less crowded and we spent some time at the bar there waiting for our table at Tony's.  We also diverted there for lunch instead of Tony's on one visit, and it was a nice alternative.  Definitely follow your meal at either place with gelato from Naia across the street - best gelato anywhere!!
author: Robyn B.

description: Delicious. We came on Saturday and it was a full house, but not too crowded. Great margaritas, and a fun vibe. Accidentally ended up here for breakfast that Sunday and we were not disappointed! The lemonade is so good, it's insane. We got the brunch breakfast burritos, very tasty.
author: monica t.

description: The chips were stale.  We asked for another bowl, but were told they only had one source so it would be the same chips.  The beer on tap was flat. We were there at 5:30 so this would have been prime time for dinner food,
author: S S.

description: Great meal, service, and location. We sat outside on a gorgeous San Fran afternoon. The braised rib tacos were incredible and the guacamole was also really good. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone; it's kinda family friendly if you went early and your kids were cool.
author: Mark L.

description: Horrible service and drunk employees. Waited to be seated for 45 minutes and decided to leave after seeing people arrive after us that were being seated right away. The owner should get a clue and hit responsible adults to run their business.  We had guacamole while we waited which was mediocre at best. Don't believe the hype.
author: Michael N.

description:
First let me say I'd give 3.5-4 stars for the food and atmosphere here.  I've been here a couple times already and like most of the food (and service the previous time was 'ok') IMO, the ambiance and atmosphere are exactly what this neighborhood needed.

BUT the service at the bar?  Are you f r e a k i n g kidding me?? 

There were two young male bartenders on duty (Monday night) I simply couldn't believe the complete lack of service and attention to ALL the customers, not just us.  These guys clearly didn't care about their customers at all.  Ordering seemed to be a privilege that bartender #1 reluctantly granted to me.  Once the food arrived, not ONCE did they ask if any of our food was ok or if we needed anything.  In fact I really wanted to send one thing back because it was cold but I couldn't get their attention, so I just ate it cold!  We would have also drank a lot more but they never noticed our empty glasses or asked us what we'd like next.  Imagine that, at a bar!?  They don't even make eye contact with the thirsty customers or notice when glasses are completely empty!  Wow.  One customer next to me was trying to pay their bill for at least 15-20 mins, poor girl.  It was good to see though that the bartenders enjoyed several shots shared and cheered between themselves during this time.  I guess they were toasting mediocrity, indifference, or the fact that they were so lucky to con somebody into giving them this job.

Note to Management:  You have a great restaurant in a great location.  Don't screw it up by hiring such ungrateful non service oriented d-bags for "bartenders".  This kind of service might fly in the marina, but to adults in North beach, it's offensive.
author: Kyle K.

description: Everything was fresh and timely. Drinks were delicious, with or without the alcohol. Generous portions of actual protein on taco. Too bad the taste and creativity is mediocre and nothing memorable.
author: Kayu T.

description: I had no idea how good a taco place could be until I tried Tacolicious.  My group ordered a few of each type of taco and a pitcher of margaritas, loved everything, then repeated the same order and thoroughly enjoyed it all over again.  It was fantastic, I can't wait to go back.
author: Kenny J.

description: Sat in the corner part of the bar with a friend and was very content. Bar tender was friendly and attentive. Their salsa is amazing. It has a fresh kick to it that is beyond lime....i feel like it's mint. We split 4 tacos between us and 2 was enough to get us full on top of the guac, salsa, and bean dip they gave us. The pulled pork tacos were a win! Definitely be back.
author: J L.

description: Just had a killer lunch here. Vegan tacos. Great SFO-based IPA. Amazing server (Brianna). Thanks! Just enough food to get me back on my walking tour of this awesome city. The habañero salsa was just enough fire in the belly!
author: Vikas S.

description: Mediocre tacos--I don't understand why everyone in SF is obsessed with this place! I'd say it's because of the free chips and cheap tacos, but everyone knows the Bay Area has more $$ than they know what to do with. I'd rather try a random shack in the mission.
author: Abby H.

description:
I have been going to Tacolicious religiously over the course of this past year and it never disappoints. Whether coming with a huge party at night or for a business lunch during the work day, the ambiance allows for any type of rendezvous. 

Being a vegetarian can make it challenging to find filling and delicious mexican food that isn't drowning in sour cream and guacamole. However at Tacolicious there are a number of options for vegetarians that actually have flavor and can fill me up. They switch up the combination/flavors of the vegetarian tacos seasonally and they are always out of this world.

The Queso with their warm chips is sinfully delicious...because it is liquid gold, and that is always one of the first things to get devoured when I go with groups.

Let's not forget to mention the drinks...the Nopal pitcher is a personal staple however you cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. Nothing is from a mix, all of the cocktails are fresh because they use fresh fruits and amazing combinations (so no hangovers!) I literally watched them cut over 50 blood oranges for their fresca once!

It is hard to put into words what makes this Tacolicious in particular stand out against it's peers in the mission and marina, but I think it can be attributed to the service. The servers always makes sure to personalize each group's experience and continually check in to make sure everyone in your party is well taken care of/having a great time. 

There is so much more to say about this wonderful place that a review can't do it justice, but after writing this I'm officially hungry and heading there for dinner again tonight!
author: Alison G.

description:
Horrible service.  Asked for a 10 person table, the hostess said they had a party of 15 also waiting and whoever got there first would get the table.  They ended up seating 4 of us at a small table assuming the table next to us was going to finish soon (they had full drinks and had not even paid yet).  We awkwardly kept squeezing people around the 4 person table until the table next to us left making them and us extremely uncomfortable.  We asked if we could move to the 15 person table since it was still open, they said no even though our full party was clearly there before the other one.

Ordered queso and guac and only had 1 basket of chips that was constantly empty.  Slow bar service when ordered several pitchers margaritas. 

Great food. Terrible service and clearly understaffed.
author: Nicole J.

description: This is my favorite little restaurant chain in the city.  You can't beat the raw tuna tostadas and the braised beef short rib tacos!
author: Kevin P.

description: You have to try the Albacore Tuna Tostada, they are AMAZING!!!  Always a great place never disappoints
author: Shannon W.

description: Tried this place for the first time on Saturday... Yum! Asked for no cilantro on my tacos,  but forgot to ask them to leave it out of the guac... but when the guac came, no cilantro! The waitress had them make everything without it since I'd mentioned I didn't like it. Considering that half the time places forget to modify orders even when you remind them, this really won me over. I'll be coming back.
author: Mary M.

description: I've lived here just under 2 months and this is my first official favorite spot. Lee ( I hope I don't forget these names ) greets you so kind and consistently she's not over the top but super nice . Great first face for any company . Patrick the bar tender went above and beyond ! Great drinks great suggestions full of information ( about the food , location etc) I'd go back just to see him and then the food itself ... Has been so awesome . I've managed , bar tended , served over ten years combined and great service and dining experiences are rare . I have had two in a row at this location. Go!
author: Lauren S.

description: Liked the spicy dip. Limited vegetarian choices. And the veggie tacos pretty much sucked.
author: Sagar J.

description: In town on vacation and met a friend here for dinner. Cute little spot,  love the atmosphere. Tacos were delish, braised chicken were my favorite. Sangria was great too. Staff was friendly and attentive.
author: Leticia D.

description:
I've walked past this place several times and finally decided to give it a try. After waiting about 20 minutes, we were seated inside. The overall vibe of this place is very fun, loud and it's a great place to go with a small group of people, have some drinks and eat some tacos. 

Unfortunately, the service was not great, and the food was average. 

The fish taco (Baja style) was good but needed a bit of a kick. None of the hot sauces was particularly good, and the short rib tacos were oily and a bit greasy. 

The tuna tartare tostada was the bright point of the lunch.
author: Adam D.

description: Came here to have a few drinks while we were waiting on a pizza next door! Good drinks, awesome bartender..will definitely be back when we come this way again! Oh & you Can't complain about the complimentary chips & salsa ;)
author: Stephanie M.

description: Gluten free and delicious! This place was great and everything was very flavorful! Please note I do not ask if everything I order is gluten free I use my best judgement and hope I don't get sick (also I have severe gluten allergies not Celiac disease) and I will know within 20mins if I have consumed gluten and I will be severely ill for the next 48-72 hours. I had a chicken taco, veggie taco, chips, salsa, Guacamole and Sangria and I loved everything!
author: Onna S.

description: Meh, Average at best. Pistos is 100 times better in every aspect
author: Paolo C.

description: Given my recurring bad experience at the North Beach T-Lish, I was hesitant to give it another try, but my friend had a Gilt city brunch deal only valid at this location so I figured one last chance couldn't hurt. I can now confidently say I will not be back to this location. This time, we found a sticker in our guacamole, my breakfast burrito arrived cold (I sent it back and waited 15+ mins for a new one even though the restaurant was empty),  and our bill was totally messed up at the end. On a positive note, I will say the service seemed mildly improved from my last visit, but we were one of only three other tables there, and frankly, the bar for improvement was pretty low. Tacolicious is still one of my favorites restaurants - just not this location!!
author: Mindy G.

description: This location is more wide open then the others, which made it seem a little different. The food is still fantastic.  Didn't care that all the tables are high tables with seats that have no backs. However, compared to the other Tacolicious restaurants, it was easier to get a seat/table here. So that is a good reason in of itself to visit this one.
author: Dilly M.

description: The manager lied to us and said there was a huge dinner party coming in so we had to sit in the back. Made us feel completely awkward and unwelcomed. Even stopped us as we walked in saying "whoa whoa is there something I can help you with?!" No party ever came. The place was EMPTY on a Friday night and continued to stay that way. Thanks for lying to us. Even when we told our server, he did not even have the balls to apologize. He did give us a discount, which we appreciated, but a real man and a true manager would have come up to the table and apologized for being rude and flat out lying. For this reason, we won't be back to this location.
author: Lauren M.

description: Great chips and salsa, margaritas, and braised beef tacos.  Pretty good for the money too... if you get the margarita pitcher!
author: Maurice T.

description: By far the worst experience eating ever. Disappointed that I even gave this place a chance given the fact that North Beach houses such culinary gems. From the second we walked in, we were not serviced properly. The place was empty and yet we still had to call attention of the waiters to seat us. After which, we waited forever for the menus to be delivered to us. When we finally got our menus, they ignored us and did not even offer water. Nevertheless, hunger propelled us further into the dining experience. After ordering our meals, we were highly disappointed by the quality of the food. The tacos were drenched in grease, the sangria was worse, and we were all wondering why it was that we were spending $5.00 per taco. We couldn't even finish the six tacos, so I mentioned to the bus boy that we were honestly disappointed and whether we could do something about it. He proceeded to tell me that I could take the tacos I was complaining about home. After I asked repeatedly to speak to someone, he went ahead and decided to speak about me to his coworker in Spanish, obviously unaware that I could understand him ( including the moment he called me a bitch). Finally, I was able to speak to a waiter and settle on taking the uneaten tacos off our bill. Worst eating experience in North Beach, will not be returning.
author: Julienne R.

description: Went with some family members, the adults shared the taco platter(4 veggies, 3 fish 3 short ribs) refried beans, rice, guacamole and 2 pitchers of margaritas (watermelon ones).Carnis liked the fish tacos the most.  All the food was very tasty.  I liked the veggie tacos quite a bit.  They had a kids menu, which was great, but the one issue was (and the reason this isn't 5 stars) is that tween we were with found the kids chicken taco to be very spicy.
author: Sheetal P.

description: Wow! Mexican pizza on happy hour menu paired with an agave-lime margarita, yikes! Homie bartender did a great job. Chips and salsa were great too. HD TV, clean bar.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Had a bad experience completely turned around by Alfonso this afternoon. 

I came in right after they had sat a huge rowdy party in the dining room so I sat outside by myself and ordered a salad and some tacos. The tacos came within 2 minutes, some crazy fast tacos let me tell you. Of course they were good too, they always are. Anyway I finish my tacos and they get bussed and I sit around a while waiting for my server. It's like 2 in the afternoon and I've got nowhere to be so this is fine. Next time I see him, I let him know that I never got my salad and I felt like it was too late for it now. I asked him to make sure it wasn't on my bill. 

He comes back a few minutes later and apologized that I never got my salad, and even took care of my tacos for me. What a great guy! I feel like he went above and beyond what was an appropriate response to make sure I left the restaurant happy. Which I did. 

I don't leave a lot of reviews, but I think in this case it was the appropriate response.  Thanks again Alfonso, see you soon.
author: Alex C.

description: I'm in love with the carnitas. This location is really nice, and feels more spacious than the Mission and Marina ones. The floor tiles are beautiful, I want some for my house. The service at this location is awesome, and everyone who works here is really attentive. I love coming here after work for dinner. They're open for lunch, too, if you're in the Financial District, it's not that far away. Highly recommended from a Jewish lady who loves her some pork.
author: Julia D.

description:
I'm a pretty regular tacolicious go-er in the marina. When I saw the Gilt City deal for brunch at the newly opened Tacolicious- North Beach I was stoked, seemed like a great deal and I expected the same quality as I get at the marina taco. I had a few qualms with the north beach location. 
Pro-
-No wait, we got seated immediately at a table of our choice. 
- a choice of pitcher with the Gilt City deal 
- enough options for brunch though I wish tacos were included in brunch menu. 
- dessert--churros were quality
Cons-
- the service was slow even though there were only a handful of customers in the restaurant 
- our waitress was nice though a smile wouldn't have killed her. 
- we found a sticker in our guacamole-- I guess that means its fresh? 
- the burrito we ordered was not hot all the way through. They took it back and remade it, came back better. 
- bistec y huevos were good the rice seemed a little old for noon though. 

In all... Perhaps Taco isn't the best brunch spot. I can't say how taco in north beach is the rest of the time, I'd stick to the marina taco if I were you though .
author: Megan S.

description: This is my favorite of the 3 locations because it seems to be less crowded and has a great happy hour during the weekdays.  Everything is delicious so just get what jumps out at you!
author: e w.

description: Have never been to the tacolicious in north beach but was thrilled when I found out it was there. Have had great experiences at the mission and marina locations so I suggested it to my group of friends. The hostess seemed a little ditsy but she got us seated on a Friday night in less than 20 minutes. I already knew what I wanted but some of my friends have never been there before. Our server "MK" was great. She had great recommendations and kept our drinks full (not to mention she's very easy on the eye.) I've now been to all 3 locations in San Francisco and look forward to trying the one in Palo Alto!
author: Jesse J.

description: Came with my boss and coworker and we sat outside and it was lovely. I got the cod tacos. Loved the spiciest yellow salsa as well as the medium one. The service was great and personable.
author: Alexandra W.

description: The tomato salad is super yum. The option to order a giant variety taco platter is super awesome.  I like that they have a full bar. Lots of taco spots don't.  I almost like them better than Don Pisto's,  However, and to be fair, they both have slightly different menu options and prepare their menu options a  bit differently and that are equally mouth watering.   Thanks for opening up a spot in North Beach!
author: Jessica S.

description:
It was my first time at Tacolicious and I had 4 different types of tacos: The beef, the chicken, the fish, and the carnitas. They were all delicious and especially like the fish. All the food was very fresh and the presentation was good. The tacos are all served with 3 different types of sauces and all of those were tasty. If you like super spicy go for the yellow sauce. 

Travis along with one of the young ladies took care of me and we both excellent. They were both very attentive and also gave some good recommendations about what to get because I couldn't decide at first. The margarita was also great a really complimented the food. 

The atmosphere was also good and I could see it being a great place to go to hang out with a group of friends. 

I had a great experience there and will be going back.
author: Mark P.

description: Amazing margaritas, tasty tacos, and perfect chips and salsa... Is there anything more you need to know?! Go here eat tacos and be happy!
author: Kiley T.

description: Love the new location - food/service is the same as in the Marina (and i'm sure the Mission location as well). Very spacious and the decor is awesome. Well done!
author: Alison M.

description: We went on a Monday- third time we tried to get in but it's so busy that we never got seated prior to this. The gal helping us was sweet and attentive. I was blown away by the tequila menu: a double sided sheet over a foot long. Ended up getting a pitcher for $32 of a drink - it was really just a carafe but that didn't change that it was good. The tortilla "snack" was the best thing we had on the menu. Everything else was good but standard. The rock cod was probably my least favorite. I agree with Johanna L. that 2 people can split 4 tacos. I will be back however, to try more of the snack menu along with those delicious sounding shots.
author: B S.

description: I love Mexican coming from LA and these were up to par with anything that I have had! Love this place
author: Aanand P.

description: My girlfriend and I went to Tacolicious for brunch not knowing if the food was good or not, but I have heard a lot of Tacolicious before from others, so I thought we'd check the place out. Best decision! We both had an order of the Lone Star Tacos and they were fantastic! It was like a breakfast burrito in a flour taco. The tortilla seemed homemade, not exactly sure, but it was great. The peppers added with the egg, melted Oaxaca Cheese, and other ingredients really pumped up the flavor. We also shared a Margarita with coconut water and that was also good. The chips are quite basic, as well as the salsa, but overall, not bad at all. I'm not too sure how the other restaurants are like, but because this one is in a fairly busy touristy area, the place can be a bit crowded, but not overwhelming. We sat at the bar and watched the Giants game, so I cannot complain at all. The food is a bit pricey, so be sure to expect a somewhat high bill (4 Tacos for $17). The service was pretty good. I believe the bartenders name was Ashley. I overheard someone call her Ash, so I'm assuming her name is Ashley. She was really nice with a smile on her face. I'll definitely recommend others to this place and I'll be going back for sure, perhaps with a larger group.
author: Eric M.

description: Great tacos, I usually go to the ferry building on Thursdays to get them. Try the chorizo and potato or whatever the daily special is! I also love the agua frescas!
author: Amber M.

description: Having been to the Marina and Palo Alto Tacolicious restaurants, I had relatively high expectations for this one and they were certainly met.  The good news is that this one is 4 blocks from where I live.  The food at Tacolicious is always consistent and always very good.  They tend to keep it simple and only change the menu seasonally, which I like.  When I think of high end Mexican food and a good time, I think of Tacolicious.  I've been with anywhere from 2-8 people and we are always accommodated and get what we expect (sometimes that means waiting, but they are accurate).  I'm not sure if it's a good thing or a bad thing, but it always ends up not being cheap - mostly because of the drinks that you are compelled to order given the fun environment.
author: Alex O.

description: The drinks were amazing. The food, incredibly bland. If it hasn't been so expensive I would have let it all slide. I can get amazing tacos for $1.25. Here they are $4.00. Here they uses special tortillas and beans but that doesn't justify anything. It's just a tourist upscale taqueria.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Three words: yummy red sangria!  I sampled all the tacos but my favorite was the carnitas.  I would give another star if the beans were better.  Compared to the flavor of the tacos, they seemed a little bland.  But the carnitas and sangria are enough to get me back in the door!
author: R. B.

description: SO LOUD!!!! I love the food/drink here, but it's impossible to carry on a conversation without losing your voice. They really need to fix the acoustics at this location.
author: Sarah J.

description: Just as good as the Marina location but this one is larger. There is some outdoor seating, but it's pretty minimal
author: Ami D.

description: Tacos are solid. Drinks are great. Nice addition to North Beach. Pretty loud.
author: Stacy W.

description: Visited on a Tuesday for the first time and they have a Taco Tuesdays special of 6 shells plus the fixings to make your own taco for $12. Add the awesome rice and drunken beans for just $5 more. And lastly don't forget you get two discounted margaritas for $5 each and you have one awesome meal that is plenty for two for $30. Everything was great. We will be back!
author: Mark P.

description: We got seated hella fast, which is great compared to some of the places around this area.  They fed us high quality chips & salsa while we waited for our food, & weren't all weird and cheap about it either which is refreshing.  I'd like them to have fresh squeezed orange juice please.  I liked the waitress's jeans but they could've used another server.  Anyway the food was pretty average, they really beaned up mybreakfast burrito.  So overall ok place if other options packed but not really worth traveling across town for.
author: Shoaib M.

description: Dank! This place reminds me of Bar Taco in Hartford, CT. Came with two friends and followed Yelp's advice, getting the tuna tostada (something like that) appetizer- imagine sushi crossed with mexican food- it was incredible. Also had the pear margarita. Yum! Can't wait to go back :)
author: Eliza D.

description: Perfect place to come for a quick dinner and drinks. The tacos are super filling and the salsa is to die for. Brunch is great too, especially the huevos rancheros. My only issue is the cocktails on the menu are super inconsistent and each time I order the same cocktail, it's much different than the previous time I ordered it.
author: Ali A.

description: Perfectly met expectations. Braised beef had fantastic flavors and the margarita was delicious. Giving only 3 stars because while the meal was perfectly tasty, nothing necessarily exceeded our expectations. Simply put, no flavor explosion occurred.
author: Mel W.

description: Very good... The short rib tacos are really good.  Guacamole was definitely Worth getting
author: Amanda K.

description: At a taco joint goes this place is pretty good - creative tacos (would have preferred more veggie options). The chips and salsa were fantastic - there was some Indian type spice in the salsa - cant pin point what it is - but tasty. Wasn't in the mood to drink liquor so I had a Silas - lemon, lime, mint, fizzy water - hit the spot.    Side note - good music - would be a good bar to visit and get food. Would have been a five if they had a wider menu with a few more taco options. Service  was friendly and  prompt.
author: Paras P.

description: steak in our shrimp salad, which was over dressed. slow service. queso was poorly prepared velveeta (i.e. not restaurant queso).
author: Shane B.
