description: The carnitas tacos were great! The margaritas were delicious and the service was quick! Couldn't ask for more.
author: Ashley J.

description: If you're looking for margaritas and Mexican food in the city, this is the place to go. The salsa is unreal, the food is delicious and the margaritas are strong. Really can't ask for anything more! Our favorite tacos are braised beef short rib and the carnitas. This also is my favorite location of the 3 in San Francisco, feels like the largest so usually not too long of a wait. TLish never disappoints.
author: Bailey B.

description: Incredible Kale salad, amazing tacos, cool vibe - we loved it! The cod and the carnitas tacos took the top honors. I highly suggest checking it out!
author: Barry N.

description: Our table was not greeted for about ten minutes & the appetizer came after our entrees. The food was okay, but not nearly good enough to outweigh the bad experience.
author: Elaine K.

description: Yum! I will be returning! The tacos are wonderful and the margaritas are good!
author: Bridget O.

description: Now hear me when I say this.. This place is seriously one of  the best taco places I've ever Been to. They also have ridiculous good queso and chips.. You must seriously try this place. Get several different tacos. My choices were the chicken and carnitas and the vegetarian. Outstanding. Well done tacolicious.. Well done.
author: Jed T.

description: I'm actually appalled by my experience here tonight. I walked in with a friend and we both stood there for a good 5 minutes before anyone even thought about saying anything to us. Actually, my friend had to walk up to someone to get any service. Then the hostess seats us at the bar and as we go to sit a group of drunk girls run up and say things like "oh! Are you pulling my seat out for me?! I'm sitting there." So I say "sorry, this is just wear the hostess sat us. See the menus?" So I have to ask a group of guys if they would move over from where they were standing so we could sit and have dinner. Then a waiter drops chips and salsa directing in front of us. Awesome! Some food! As I dip my chip into the salsa one of the guys yells "no no no don't do that!" So I stop and turn looking confused. He says "that's ours! Did you order chips and salsa?" And I said "no..." But don't they typically come before the meal? So they actually grabbed the plates from us. My friend and I were shocked. We tell the hostess what's happened and we didn't even get an apology. What I got was a couple cold tacos. Get it together! I work in the service industry and what I experienced tonight is just ridiculous.
author: Chloe H.

description: Chicken tacos  were just okay, Aztecs soups was really good
author: Lu G.

description: We always have an amazing experience here thanks to Cameron and Dino! They are so attentive and so much fun! The micheladas and camarones al diablo are to die for! Totally going back!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Great location but they recently raised their prices and now the prices don't match quality. Overpriced average Mexican food.
author: T. B.

description: Great food even better margaritas , I usually end up enjoying the veggie taco  the most. Would recommend.
author: Ted J.

description: I am not a frequent reviewer but I felt compelled to write this. We have gone to tacolicious in North Beach twice, the second time leaving before we even ordered and the first regretting our decision to stay. Unlike the friendly (and kid-friendly) experience on Chestnut) the north beach restaurant is unpleasantly loud, holds a happy hour which doesn't include wine (??), and employs staff which are rude (we had to ask one of the wait people to stop swearing in front of our ten year old(f-bombs rained !!). Why we went back a second time you ask ? We'd gone to Chestnut a few months back and had such a great experience, that we chalked our first one up as bad luck. Not the case. We will never go back. Fortunately, Cafe Divine is right across the street, and welcomed us happily, wine included :)
author: anita w.

description: The braised beef short rib tacos are amazing every time, without fail! It's a fun atmosphere and a good place to come with friends. I just wish the drinks were stronger. At first I thought it might be the bartender, but it happens everytime and I'm assuming it's not the same guy working every night. For $10 a drink, it would be nice to feel slightly buzzed.  Also, I promise I'm not an alcoholic, just a broke college student.
author: Caroline D.

description: We tried tacolicious because previous reviews were so good.  But we were disappointed.  The food was fair and a bit pricey for what you received.  We tried several different tacos, but none very exciting.  Nice location.
author: Patti A.

description: Pleasant experience.  After spotting a patio spot from afar during the dinner hour, my bf, dog and I dashed for some tacos.  The food (4 tacos for $14 and queso dip) were yummy with a unique flavor and the margaritas were solid.  The waitstaff earns pints for brining my pup a bowl of short rib.
author: Ashley P.

description: Total meh experience... Wanted to go with 2 stars, but opted to give the benefit of the doubt given that we came in an hour before close on a Friday night. I was disappointed from the start BC they were out of the ceviche & the tuna tostadas- two of the items that enticed me in previous Yelp photos. The chip were stale, the refried beans tasted like they came straight from a can, and the tortilla soup could have used more salt or spice. The tacos, the Micheladas, and the ambience were the higher points.
author: Mary C.

description: What can I say? Tacolicious is the best! The atmosphere is fun and the staff is fun. Everytime I go I feel at home right away with friendly service. JP always makes sure to go above and beyond!!! Can't wait to go back this weekend!!
author: Jill E.

description: Food is good, but service is so not. None of the servers or staffs are kind or friendly, they seem all a little awkward, even. Tacos are okay, portions not so small, so so sangria. Can't recommend it.
author: Esther L.

description: First of all I would like to say that the food is delicious and very consistent.  This review is specific to this location.  If I was rating the food alone I would give this place 4 maybe 5 stars.  If I am sitting down and have time to enjoy a casual meal also 4-5 stars.  On two occasions I have sat at the bar while I ordered food to go and on both occasions the bartender has blown it.  Same guy, shorter hair and tattoos.  Both times I saw our order sitting on the counter for 15+min while he looked at it multiple times and just moved on.  He even moved it cause it was in the way still couldnt make the connection....come on bro figure it out its not that hard.  Only when we asked about our food did he finally realize it was the right one.  I would still recommend this place for causal night out where you're not worried about service and just want good tacos.
author: Rick J.

description: White boy frat party with about a 10:1 male:female ratio, super noisy and annoying people and prices were extremely high for just meh food.
author: Andy D.

description: Super excited when I heard that Tacolicious is now in North Beach!!  Went there today for lunch and had the Fresca Margarita....super refreshing and seriously never tasted anything like it before.  Had the Ahi tuna tostada which will be one of my new favorites there.   Ryan who is the GM there is very cool
author: Michelle K.

description: Extremely loud on Fri nights but otherwise the yummiest tacos in town. Definitely worth checking out. P.S. Beet salads might be on the verge of passé but still worth ordering here!
author: M M.

description: Great food, great location and atmosphere. The service was terrible though! We only saw our waitress once. However, I would give it another chance
author: Emily K.

description: Delicious food but super disappointed in the customer service and portions. Ordered for my coworkers today, and considering the $450 price tag, there was not enough rice, beans, or salad for everyone despite ordering enough for all 15. When I called to inquire about my order, thinking perhaps there was an error, not only was I hung up on the first time around, but I finally got a hold of someone, left my number to talk to a superior, and never heard back from a soul. Definitely not the spot for a big group lunch to go.
author: E G.

description: What is the big deal? Went there on a recommendation from a coworker.  What is this Shi shi foo foo tacos? Small portions, high prices, tacos mediocre at best. Beat salad barely enough to feed a hobbit, $9. Come on.  Far better tacos in most any taqueria.
author: david b.

description:
Visited Tacolicious North Beach while walking from the ferry to downtown.  I have been a fan of these outlets from the beginning. This one does not disappoint.  The service was excellent although admittedly I arrived at 1:45 p.m. so after the lunch crowd.  I sat at one of the side tables in the main dinning room and could watch the Giant game while eating lunch. The music was a little frenetic but not so loud that it distracted.  The decor is upscale, roomy, clean and excellent.  The waiters were very attentive and the service was outstanding.  I ordered the old standby, two carnitas tacos for $3.95 each.  They were terrific.  The meat was seasoned perfectly and seemed of high quality. The tortillas were soft, two for each taco. This gives you a little bonus as you can peel the second tortilla away and turn two tacos into four, given the amount of carnitas filling in each of the two.  The tacos are served with three mouth watering salsas -- including the basic for the day which was a tomatillo/tomato/mint salsa.  In the three were also an mild avocado salsa and a yellow/habinero salsa that would sizzle the toughest palate.  The tacos are served with piquante pickled vegetable slices that you can add to the mix.  

I asked the waiter if they did crispy tacos and he said "no."  I know that at the Marina restaurant they sometimes do crispy tacos as a special one day a week, maybe Tuesdays. That option -- well executed --would vault Tacolicious to five stars in my opinion. 

Other features that make Tacolicious so good are such details as providing you with really thick white napkins, as many as you want, given the tacos are juicy.  They provide you with a small dish of special salt to sprinkle on your food as needed. This place is well worth visiting.
author: Bill L.

description: Got take out from here this afternoon and ordered the carnitas and braised short rib tacos.  Opened it up back at my apartment and realized they gave me some chicken tacos instead.  They were also kind of dry and none of the standard sauces on the side were included.  .......... my sunday is ruined.
author: Walter M.

description: Drove up from San Jose to visit Tacolicious after watching a segment on the Food Network. We tried the Albacore tuna tostadas which were good but nothing like the portrayed on TV. They didn't make my knees buckle but they were yummy. A little pricey for what you get but not bad. The disappointing part was that they were out of the shrimp tacos which was the featured taco of the day. It was only 4:00 in the afternoon so either these are that good or it was bad planning to run out so early. We then wanted to try the chili con queso aka Mikes Cheese Dip. Strike two! They were out of this too which leads me to believe it was just bad planning to run out of two of the most popular items that they are known for. We then tried the braised beef short rib tacos. Not quite strike three but pretty close so let's call it a foul tip. The final strike out was that we waited a long time to get out check. If you live in the city it might be OK to stop in but if you plan to take a drive to visit this over hyped place featured on the FN skip it. I, along with my girlfriend, were disappointed.
author: Ron B.

description: Yay! Another Mexican place in North Beach!! Tacolicious has the BEST sangria I have ever had, their salsa is amazing and they are super attentive even though its jam packed w/ customers. Sooo happy to have another option in the neighborhood!
author: Catherine M.

description: Well, I can't review the food as I never got a chance to taste. I had been told how great the food was so I decided to grab a bite before work. I was greeted by a very pleasant host who told me that I should place my order at the bar and the order should come up pretty quickly. I went to the bar and stood with my menu in hand  and watched as 2-3 people shimmied behind the bar. After standing for about 3-4 minutes I see the host enter the bar area and I am encouraged because I'm thinking he will surely inform the staff that I was waiting. Nope....the host poured himself half a beer, took a sip and chatted with one of the bartenders. They continued to chat and catch a glimpse of the football game. The bartender never looked up or even seemed to be aware that I was even in his periphery. Just as the host took a sip and looked up at me, I let my menu slip from my hand, land on the bar and proceeded to exit. I might visit another location but most likely not here although it is convenient to my job.  In any case, not a good first impression
author: Renee L.

description: great mexcian  food .
author: K G.

description: Awesome ! great ambiance , the beer chicken and steak  taco were amazing ....had a Don Pilar Anejo Margarita - Delicious ! Going back often !
author: tony r.
